deck_list.description: When you spend time working on something for a long time, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Footpad
deck_list.description: When you need to follow a plan, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Boatman
deck_list.description: When you follow the flow, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Bodyguard
deck_list.description: When you put you in between somebody and a danger, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Bounty Hunter
deck_list.description: When you try to immobilize someone, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: TollKeeper
deck_list.description: When you convince others in giving you something, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Tomb Robber
deck_list.description: When you take something that you aren't supposed to take, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Trader
deck_list.description: When you convince others in asking for a favor, ,you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Trapper
deck_list.description: When you setup a trap, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Coachman
deck_list.description: When you need to get somewhere fast, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: What Are You Waiting For?
deck_list.description: When you cry out a challenge to your enemies, roll+CON. On a 16-19, they treat you as the most obvious threat to be dealt with and ignore your companions, and you take +2 damage Ongoing against them. On a 9-15, only a few (the weakest or most foolhardy among them) fall prey to your taunting.

deck_list.name: The Upper Hand
deck_list.description:
You take +1 to Last Breath rolls.

When you roll a 9-15 on a Last Breath roll, you make an offer to Death for your life, instead of the other way around. If Death accepts, you will be returned to life. If not, you die.

deck_list.name: The Champion
deck_list.description: You hunger for fame and glory, seeking to make a name for yourself and leave a lasting legacy. When you roll for a move while pursuing this appetite, roll 2d20 and take the best two dice. However, if any of the dice you roll are duplicates, the GM will introduce a complication or danger that comes about due to your heedless pursuits.

deck_list.name: The Plunderer
deck_list.description: Your insatiable desire for wealth and property drives you to take risks and make bold moves. When you roll for a move while pursuing this appetite, roll 2d20 and take the best two dice. However, if any of the dice you roll are duplicates, the GM will introduce a complication or danger that comes about due to your heedless pursuits.

deck_list.name: The Ravager
deck_list.description: When you have an insatiable appetite for destruction, roll 2d20 instead of 1d20 when making moves. Take the best two dice. However, if any of the dice you roll are equal to 12, 17 or 13 the GM will introduce a complication or danger that arises due to your reckless pursuit of destruction.

deck_list.name: The Dominator
deck_list.description: When you have an insatiable appetite for power over others, roll 2d20 instead of 1d20 when making moves. Take the best two dice. However, if any of the dice you roll are equal to 12, 17 or 13 the GM will introduce a complication or danger that arises due to your reckless pursuit of power.

deck_list.name: The Hedonist
deck_list.description: When you have an insatiable appetite for mortal pleasures, roll 2d20 instead of 1d20 when making moves. Take the best two dice. However, if any of the dice you roll are equal to 12, 17 or 13 the GM will introduce a complication or danger that arises due to your reckless pursuit of pleasure.

deck_list.name: The Marauder
deck_list.description: When you have an insatiable appetite for conquest, roll 2d20 instead of 1d20 when making moves. Take the best two dice. However, if any of the dice you roll are equal to 12, 17 or 13 the GM will introduce a complication or danger that arises due to your reckless pursuit of conquest.

deck_list.name: Thief
deck_list.description: When you try to do something while not being seen, you get +3 to you rolls.

deck_list.name: Herbalist
deck_list.description: When you need to study a plant property, you get +3 to yoour rolls.

deck_list.name: Herdsman
deck_list.description: When you need to gather something into a circle, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Hypnotist
deck_list.description: When you try to mesmerize sometone, you get +3 to your rolls

moves.moves_description: when you deal damage in melee, you can choose to inflict an additional d4 damage.
when you howl, all enemies within earshot must defy danger or become frightened.
your senses are enhanced in werewolf form, giving you +1 to Discern Realities and allowing you to see in complete darkness

Each time you change into werewolf form, you must roll+Con. On a 16-19, you retain control of your actions. On a 9-15, the GM will give you a choice: either you can retain control but mark a point of corruption, or you can lose control and the GM will take over your actions for the duration of the transformation. On a miss, you lose control and the GM takes over your actions indefinitely. When you reach 10 corruption points, you become a Feral Lycantrope that loses completely its humanity.
when you deal damage in melee, you can choose to heal 1d6 damage.
when you meet someone's gaze, roll+Cha. On a 16-19, they become transfixed and will do anything you ask (within reason). On a 9-15, they become transfixed but will ask you to do something in return.
you gain +1 to Hack and Slash and Volley.

However, your curse comes with great vulnerabilities. You take double damage from holy water, and can be destroyed by sunlight or a stake through the heart. Additionally, you cannot enter a dwelling without being invited.

deck_list.name: Evidence of Faith
deck_list.description: When you see the effects of divine magic, and you can ask the GM which deity granted the spell and its effects. You take +1 Forward to act on the answers.

deck_list.name: Apotheosis
deck_list.description: When you take this move and spend some time establishing a unique and potent connection to your deity, choose another option from the Ascension list. In recognition of your devotion and faith, your deity bestows this gift upon you.

deck_list.name: Anathema
deck_list.description:
When you would deal damage to an Enemy of your deity, you also choose one of the following.
Your attack is Brutal (you roll damage twice and take the best results).
Your attack ignores their armour or any other defenses.
You suppress one of its unnatural powers.
You force it from its host, if any.
When you strike down an Enemy of your deity, they are disintegrated, obliterated wholly by the power of your faith.

deck_list.name: Faithful Defender
deck_list.description: Your faith in your deity is unshakeable, and it serves as your greatest protection. When you wear no armour and bear no shield, you get 2-armour.

deck_list.name: Serenity
deck_list.description: You have learned to move calmly and deliberately through dangerous situations, relying on your faith to guide and protect you. When you Defy Danger, take +1 to the roll.

deck_list.name: Heavens Weaving
deck_list.description: Your faith grants you insight into others, allowing you to make deals and broker alliances with greater success. When you Parley with or otherwise broker a deal with someone, you may ask them up to two questions from the Discern Realities list.

deck_list.name: Holy Beacon
deck_list.description: Your faith draws the attention of those around you, allowing you to command their attention and hold their gaze. When you draw attention to yourself by word or deed, roll+CHA. On a 7+, everyone turns and looks. On a 16-19, you hold their gaze so long as you continue giving them reason to watch.

deck_list.name: Cheat Death
deck_list.description:
When you have 0 HP, instead of taking your Last Breath, roll+WIS. On a 16-19, you live and choose one:

  • You discover one of Death’s dark secrets.
  • You have a moment with a soul of the deceased.
  • You manage to stay beneath Death’s notice.

On a 9-15, you live, but Death takes notice and you make a terrible discovery. On a 1-8, in addition to whatever the GM says, you can cheat Death no longer and you must pass through the Black Gates now and forever.

deck_list.name: Thaumaturgy
deck_list.description:
When you petition your deity to perform a miracle that pertains to their Domains, tell the GM what you desire. Miracles are always possible, but the GM will give you 1 to 4 of the following conditions (separated by “ANDs” and “ORs”):

  • In return you will have to ________.
  • You’ll need help from ________.
  • It will require ________.
  • The effect will be unfocused or flawed.
  • You’ll have to satiate your deity’s Demands.
  • Your deity will be left weakened or vulnerable.
  • It will attract, summon, or empower your deity’s Enemies.

Miracle examples: Raising someone from the dead; restoring someone’s missing limbs, eyes, horns, etc; unravelling the assorted dangers, threats, and grim portents of a front

deck_list.name: Cloistered Wisdom
deck_list.description: You possess an extensive knowledge of your deity's Domains. When you Spout Lore or Discern Realities about something pertaining to your deity's Domains, you may roll +WIS instead of +INT.

deck_list.name: The Scales of Life and Death
deck_list.description: You possess knowledge of the delicate balance between life and death. You can Aid and Interfere with an ally's Last Breath roll, and your allies can Aid and Interfere with your Last Breath rolls. However, be aware that Death will gladly rope you (or your allies) into its bargains.
deck_list.header_image: The Scales of Life and Death.png

deck_list.name: Priest of Vulcan
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Fire card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are a Priest of Vulcan you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Water, Ice, Air, Moon domain cards.

deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Fire card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are a Priest of Hephaestus you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Water, Ice, Air, Arcane domain cards.

deck_list.name: Priest of Poseidon
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Water card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are a Priest of Poseidon you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Fire, Electricity, Mind, Moon domain cards.

deck_list.name: Priest of Skadi
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Ice card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are a Priest of Skadi you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Fire, Electricity, Beasts, Death domain cards.

deck_list.name: Priest of Gaia
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Earth card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are a Priest of Gaia you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Electricity, Beasts, Mind, Arcane domain cards.

deck_list.name: Priest of Zeus
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Air card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are a Priest of Zeus you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Fire, Water, Electricity, Beasts domain cards.

deck_list.name: Priest of Zeus
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Electricity card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are a Priest of Zeus you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Fire, Water, Ice, Death domain cards.

deck_list.name: Priest of Anubis
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Death card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are a Priest of Anubis you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Fire, Electricity, Life, Arcane domain cards.

deck_list.name: Priest of Hathor
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Life card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are a Priest of Hathor you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Electricity, Beasts, Death, Mind domain cards.

deck_list.name: Priest of Thoth
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Mind card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are a Priest of Thoth you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Fire, Ice, Beasts, Death domain cards.

deck_list.name: Priest of Isis
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Arcane card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are a Priest of Isis you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Fire, Water, Electricity, Beasts domain cards.

deck_list.name: Priest of Artemis
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Moon card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are a Priest of Artemis you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Fire, Electricity, Beasts, Death domain cards.

deck_list.name: Priest of Khepri
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Sun card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are a Priest of Khepri you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Ice, Electricity, Beasts, Death domain cards.

deck_list.name: Priest of Prometheus
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Fire card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are a Priest of Prometheus you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Water, Ice, Air, Arcane domain cards.

deck_list.name: Priest of Lir
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Water card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are a Priest of Lir you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Fire, Electricity, Mind, Moon domain cards.

deck_list.name: Priest of Boreas
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Ice card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are a Priest of Boreas you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Fire, Electricity, Beasts, Death domain cards.

deck_list.name: Priest of Terra
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Earth card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are a Priest of Terra you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Electricity, Beasts, Mind, Arcane domain cards.

deck_list.name: Priest of Odin
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Air card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are a Priest of Odin you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Fire, Water, Electricity, Beasts domain cards.

deck_list.name: Priest of Ares
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Sun card. While you are a Priest of Ares you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Domain of Death, Domain of Arcane, Domain of Moon and Domain of Mind cards in your deck.

deck_list.name: Priest of Allah
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Sun card. While you are a Priest of Allah, you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Domain of Death, Domain of Arcane, Domain of Moon and Domain of Mind cards in your deck.

deck_list.name: Priest of Ra
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Sun card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are a Priest of Ra you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Domain of Death, Domain of Mind, Domain of Arcane and Domain of Moon cards in your deck.

deck_list.name: Priest of Christ
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Sun card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are Priest of Christ you are also forbidden to wear armors and to have in your deck the Domain of Death, Domain of Arcane, Domain of Moon and Domain of Mind cards in your deck.

deck_list.name: Priest of Thor
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Electricity card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are Priest of Thor to have in your deck, you are forbidden fromm having the Domain of Water, Domain of Beasts, Domain of Ice and Domain of Mind cards in your deck.

deck_list.name: Priest of Beelzebub
deck_list.description: When you acquire this card in your deck, you can also get for free the Domain of Death card. You still need to meet its requirements to use it. While you are Priest of Beelzebub you are also forbidden to have in your deck the Domain of Life, Domain of Sun, Domain of Water and Domain of Air cards in your deck.

deck_list.name: Zealot
deck_list.description: Your faith was tempered upon the battlefield and wrought by trial and tribulation. You take +1 to Defend or Defy Danger against the Enemies of your deity, and when you Discern Realities you can always ask 'are there any signs of my Enemy's influence here?' in addition to your other questions.

deck_list.name: Healer
deck_list.description: You have long strived to help others, no matter how grave their wounds or how grim the price. You ignore the Slow tag on Bandages and on Herbs and Poultices, and whenever you like, you can spend 1 use of Adventuring Gear to produce 1-use of Bandages.

deck_list.name: Wayfarer
deck_list.description: You have traveled far and wide in the name of your faith, and your experience shows. You always know the fastest and most direct route to the nearest holy site, and when you Chart a Course or Undertake a Perilous Journey you always get to Keep Company (even if you're not the one rolling).

deck_list.name: Divine Agent
deck_list.description: You were trained in a temple of a certain deity to become their religious enforcers. When you condemn someone for their words or deeds according to the precepts of your religion, they feel true shame. They may deny it or try to hide it, but your conviction always cuts deep; you take +1 Forward with them.

deck_list.name: Divine Preacher
deck_list.description: You were trained in a temple of a certain deity to become their religious recruiters. When you instruct someone in their conduct or beliefs according to the precepts of your religion, they will genuinely consider your counsel. If they end up following your advice, they take +1 Forward.

deck_list.name: Divine Body
deck_list.description: You were trained in a temple of a certain deity to become their religious incarnation. Choose a feature associated with your deity (rending claws, wings of sapphire feathers, an all-seeing eye, etc.); your deity has bestowed you with this auspicious boon.

deck_list.name: Divine Aura
deck_list.description: You were trained in a temple of a certain deity to become their religious informant. Choose a type of energy (divine influence, powerful emotions, necrotic taint, etc.); you can sense this type of energy as if it were tangible and visible, and you can always tell when it is nearby.

deck_list.name: Moon Domain
deck_list.description:
You can only have 2 Domains in your deck, beside the Universal Domain.

When you draw the Moon Domain circle on the ground perform the ritual, roll+Wis and spend 1 mp. On a 16-19, choose three from the list below. On a 9-15, choose two:

  • Acid Spray: You can release a spray of acid that damages and corrodes objects and creatures.
  • Acid Armor: You can create a protective armor made of acid for yourself or others.
  • Insect Form or Familiar: You can transform into an insect or summon a familiar made of insects to aid you.
  • Darkness Area: You can create an area of darkness that blinds creatures within it.
  • Darkvision: You can see in the dark as if it were daylight.
  • Spider Climb: You can climb surfaces like a spider.
  • Web: You can create sticky webs to trap and immobilize creatures.
  • Induce Sadness: You can make creatures within the circle feel overwhelming sadness.
  • Moon Divination: You can ask the moon for guidance and receive insight or knowledge about a specific subject or situation.
  • Moonlight Burst: You can release a burst of moonlight that damages and blinds creatures within it.

Weakness: Being in a location with strong solar influence or being in a location where lunar influence is strongly suppressed.

deck_list.name: Arcane Domain
deck_list.description:
You can only have 2 Domains in your deck, beside the Universal Domain.

When you draw the Arcane Domain circle on the ground perform the ritual, roll+Int and spend 1 Mp. On a 16-19, choose three from the list below. On a 9-15, choose two:

  • Arcane Circle: You can create a Domain of arcane energy that provides magical protection and boosts spellcasting.
  • Alarm: You can set up a magical alarm that alerts you to the presence of creatures within a certain radius.
  • Identify: You can identify the magical properties of a creature, object, or spell.
  • Invisibility: You can make yourself or others invisible for a short period of time.
  • Unseen Servant: You can summon an invisible, magical servant to perform tasks for you.
  • Magic Circle: You can create a Domain of protection that prevents creatures of a certain type from entering or leaving.
  • Magic Missile: You can launch a bolt of magical energy at a target.
  • Force Wall: You can create a wall of force to block off an area or protect yourself or others.
  • Mage Armor: You can create a magical armor that provides protection against physical and magical attacks.
  • Short Distance Teleport: You can teleport yourself or others a short distance.
  • Blink: You can blink in and out of existence, making it difficult for creatures to target you.
  • Astral Bodies Divination: You can read the stars and planets to gain insight or knowledge about a specific subject or situation.

Weakness: Being in a location with counter-arcane properties or being in a location where arcane attacks are strongly suppressed.

deck_list.name: Death Domain
deck_list.description:
You can only have 2 Domain in your deck, beside the Universal Domain.

When you draw the Death Domain circle on the ground perform the ritual, roll+Wis and spend 1 mp. On a 16-19, choose three from the list below. On a 9-15, choose two:

  • Death Circle: You can create a circle that inflicts damage and weakens living creatures within it.
  • Raise Zombie: You can raise a zombie from a nearby corpse to fight for you.
  • Decay: You can cause organic material to quickly decompose and rot.
  • Cause Fear: You can cause fear in a creature, making it unable to move or act.
  • Ray of Sickness: You can shoot a beam of sickness that weakens and poisons a creature.
  • Inflict Wounds: You can cause severe wounds to a creature with a touch.
  • Vampiric Touch: You can drain the life force of a creature to heal yourself.
  • Human Corpse Divination: You can ask a question to a corpse and receive an answer from its memories.

Weakness: Being in a location with a strong presence of life or being in a location where life-restoring magic is strongly supported.

deck_list.name: Mind Domain
deck_list.description:
You can only have 2 Domains in your deck, beside the Universal Domain.

When you draw the Mind Domain circle on the ground perform the ritual, roll+Wis and spend 1 mp. On a 16-19, choose three from the list below. On a 9-15, choose two:

  • Color Spray: You can create a spray of colors that blinds and disorients creatures.
  • Telekinesis: You can move objects and creatures with your mind.
  • Charm Person: You can make a person friendly and obedient to you.
  • Comprehend Languages: You can understand and speak any language.
  • Disguise Self: You can change your appearance to look like someone else.
  • Sense Emotion: You can sense the emotions of nearby creatures.
  • Silent Image: You can create a visual illusion that looks and sounds real.
  • Sleep: You can make a creature fall asleep.
  • Mirror Image: You can create illusory duplicates of yourself to confuse enemies.
  • Erase Memory: You can remove a specific memory from a person's mind.

Weakness: Being without other intelligent creatures close to you.

deck_list.name: Life Domain
deck_list.description:
You can only have 2 Domains in your deck, beside the Universal Domain.

When you draw the Life Domain circle on the ground perform the ritual, roll+Wis and spend 1 mp. On a 16-19, choose three from the list below. On a 9-15, choose two:

  • Growth Size: You can cause plants and creatures within the circle to grow to an immense size, granting them increased strength and resilience.
  • Create Saplings: You can create a group of saplings that will grow into a dense forest over time.
  • Resurrect Body as Plants: You can bring a dead body back to life as a plant creature.
  • Bark Armor: You can create a protective armor made of bark for yourself or others.
  • Dispel Magic: You can dispel any magical effects within the circle.
  • Plant Divination: You can ask the plants for guidance and receive insight or knowledge about a specific subject or situation.

Weakness: Being in a location with a strong presence of death or being in a location where resurrection is strongly suppressed

deck_list.name: Beasts Domain
deck_list.description:
You can only have 2 Domains in your deck, beside the Universal Domain.

When you draw the Beasts Domain circle on the ground perform the ritual, roll+Wis and spend 1 mp. On a 16-19, choose three from the list below. On a 9-15, choose two:

  • Mammal form or familiar: You can transform into a mammal or summon a beast familiar to aid you.
  • Enhance senses: You can heighten your senses, gaining improved vision, hearing, and smell.
  • Entrails divination: You can read the entrails of a slain beast to gain insight or knowledge about a specific subject or situation.
  • Induce Rage: You can cause a nearby beast to become enraged and attack a target of your choice.

Weakness: Being in a location with strong animal repellents or being in a location with no beasts nearby.

deck_list.name: Electricity Domain
deck_list.description:
You can only have 2 Domains in your deck, beside the Universal Domain.

When you draw the Electricity Domain circle on the ground perform the ritual, roll+Wis and spend 1 mp. On a 16-19, choose three from the list below. On a 9-15, choose two:

  • Jump: You can jump to a faraway location with the power of electricity.
  • Magnify Gravity: You can increase the gravity in a specific area, making it difficult for creatures to move.
  • Thunderwave: You can create a powerful shockwave that damages and pushes back nearby creatures.
  • Lightning Bolt: You can shoot a bolt of lightning that damages a target.
  • Hasten: You can move faster than the eye can see, allowing you to dodge attacks or move quickly to another location.

Weakness: Being in a location with metal walls or floors that conduct electricity.

deck_list.name: Air Domain
deck_list.description:
You can only have 2 Domains in your deck, beside the Universal Domain.

When you draw the Air Domain circle on the ground speak the words of power, roll+Wis. On a 16-19, choose three from the list below. On a 9-15, choose two:

  • Wind Slash: You can unleash a powerful gust of wind that damages all creatures within its path.
  • Bird Form/Familiar: You can transform into a bird or summon a bird familiar to aid you.
  • Levitation: You can levitate yourself or others within the circle, allowing you to move through the air or avoid obstacles.
  • Misty Step: You can teleport a short distance within the circle, appearing in a cloud of mist.
  • Cloud Divination: You can read the signs and shapes of the clouds, gaining insight or knowledge about a specific subject or situation.

Weakness: Being in a sealed, airtight environment

deck_list.name: Earth Domain
deck_list.description:
You can only have 2 Domains in your deck, beside the Universal Domain.

When you draw the Earth Domain circle on the ground perform the ritual, roll+Wis and spend 1 mp. On a 16-19, choose three from the list below. On a 9-15, choose two:

  • Grease: You can create a slippery surface in an area, causing creatures to slip and fall.
  • Earthbind: You can root creatures to the ground, immobilizing them.
  • Rock Armor: You can create a protective armor made of stone for yourself or others.
  • Tremorsense: You can sense vibrations and movements in the earth within a certain radius.
  • Slow: You can slow down creatures within the circle, making them move and act sluggishly.
  • Wall of Sand: You can create a wall of sand to block off an area or protect yourself or others.
  • Earth Divination: You can ask the earth for guidance and receive insight or knowledge about a specific subject or situation.

Weakness: Being in a location with no solid ground or being in a building made of non-earth materials

deck_list.name: Ice Domain
deck_list.description:
You can only have 2 Domains in your deck, beside the Universal Domain.

When you draw the Ice Domain circle on the ground speak the words of power, roll+Int. On a 16-19, choose three from the list below. On a 9-15, choose two:

  • Ice Storm: You can summon a storm of ice and hail from within the circle, damaging all creatures within its radius.
  • Ice Armor: You can surround yourself or a creature within the circle with a protective armor made of ice, increasing their defense.
  • Frost Fingers: You can shoot icy projectiles from your fingertips, damaging one or more creatures within the circle.
  • Crustacean Form or Familiar: You can transform into a giant crab or summon a crustacean familiar to aid you within the circle.
  • Ice Conjuration: You can create an object made of ice within the circle, resistant or very sharp but brittle.
  • Ice Reflection: You can create mirrors made of ice within the circle, reflecting spells or projectiles back at their caster.

Weakness: Being in a room with a fireplace or other source of strong infrared heat

deck_list.name: Water Domain
deck_list.description:
You can only have 2 Domains in your deck, beside the Universal Domain.

When you draw the Water Domain circle on the ground speak the words of power, roll+Wis. On a 16-19, choose three from the list below. On a 9-15, choose two:

  • Frog Form: You can transform yourself into a chosen amphibian or summon a familiar of the same type to aid you in battle.
  • Water Cannon: You can shoot a high-pressure stream of water, dealing damage to a single target.
  • Fog Cloud: You can summon a cloud of fog, reducing visibility and making it easier to sneak past enemies or escape.
  • Water Walk/Breath: You can walk on water or breathe underwater for a limited time.
  • Wall of Water: You can create a wall of water, providing cover or blocking enemy attacks.
  • Super Jump: You can jump high into the air or across long distances, reaching otherwise inaccessible places.
  • Water Divination: You can use water to gain insight or knowledge about a specific subject or situation.

Weakness: Being in a location with a strong source of heat or being in a dry environment.

deck_list.name: Fire Domain
deck_list.description:
You can only have 2 Domains in your deck, beside the Universal Domain.

When you draw the Fire Domain circle on the ground speak the words of power, roll+Wis. On a 16-19, choose three from the list below. On a 9-15, choose two:

  • Lizard/Crocodile form (choose 1 animal) or familiar.
  • Fire Blasts: You can unleash a series of powerful fire blasts that deal damage to a target or area.
  • Wall of Fire: You can create a wall of flames that damages anyone who tries to pass through it.
  • Reptile Familiar: You can summon a reptile familiar to assist you in battle or aid you in other ways.
  • Fire Divination: You can ask the flames for insight or knowledge about a specific subject or situation.

Weakness: Being in a location with a lack of oxygen or being in a location with strong sources of water or other fire-extinguishing substances.

deck_list.name: Sun Domain
deck_list.description:
You can only have 2 Domains in your deck, beside the Universal Domain.

When you draw the Sun Domain circle on the ground speak the words of power, roll+Wis. On a 16-19, choose three from the list below. On a 9-15, choose two:

  • Heal Wounds: You can heal one or more creatures within the Domain of wounds or afflictions they may have.
  • Absorb Spells: You can absorb a spell or magical effect within the circle, neutralizing it or gaining its energy for yourself.
  • Silence: You can silence one or more creatures or objects within the circle, rendering them unable to make noise or cast spells with verbal components.
  • Blind/Deafness: You can blind or deafen one or more creatures or objects within the circle, rendering them unable to see or hear.
  • Sun Burst: You can unleash a burst of sunlight from within the circle, blinding and damaging all creatures within its radius.
  • Sunlight Divination: You can ask the sun for guidance and receive insight or knowledge about a specific subject or situation.

Weakness. Lack of access to sunlight or intense darkness

deck_list.name: Universal Domain
deck_list.description:
When you draw the Universal Domain circle on the ground speak the words of power, roll+Wis. On a 16-19, choose three from the list below. On a 9-15, choose two:

  • You detect magic within the circle's bounds
  • You create a shield that protects those within the circle from magical attacks
  • You dispel a magical effect within the circle's bounds
  • You summon an elemental weapon to aid you in battle
  • You summon an elemental spirit to aid you outside of battle

On a miss, the circle's power backfires, causing harm to those within its bounds.

Weakness: Being in a crowded, chaotic environment where many spells are being cast.

deck_list.name: Bewitching Performance
deck_list.description:
When you give a performance instilled with raw emotion to an audience of sentient, living creatures, choose one and roll+CHA. On a 7+, your magic will affect them as long as your performance lasts. On a 20+, the effects will linger after it ends.

  • Torpor: On a 9-15, they become lethargic and inattentive. On a 16-19, they fall asleep for a few minutes.
  • Dread: On a 9-15, they become fearful and desperate. On a 16-19, they cower, run, or hide, seeking safety.
  • Fury: On a 9-15, they become riotous and violent. On a 16-19, they form an armed and dangerous mob.
  • Hope: On a 9-15, they become fearless and resolute. On a 16-19, they take significant, lasting action.

deck_list.name: Reputation
deck_list.description: When you first meet someone who’s heard tales about you, roll+CHA. On a 16-19, tell the GM two things they’ve heard about you. On a 9-15, tell the GM one thing they’ve heard, and the GM will tell you another thing they’ve heard.

deck_list.name: A Knight in Shining Armour Appears
deck_list.description:
When you dramatically appear in the middle of a tense situation, deliver a quick speech and roll+CHA. On a 16-19, all three. On a 9-15, choose two.

  • You defuse or intensify a situation, your choice.
  • You draw attention away from any number of your allies.
  • Your speech isn’t interrupted, by word or by violence.
deck_list.header_image: A Knight in Shining Armour Appears.png

deck_list.name: Fashion Matters
deck_list.description: When you use your impeccable good-looks and considerable charms to your advantage, take +1 forward to Parley with anyone who respects your appearance.

deck_list.name: Throw Down the Gauntlet
deck_list.description: When your honour is insulted and you demand a duel, your opponent cannot decline. They may propose conditions and ask to use a substitute, but they cannot decline.

deck_list.name: Eldritch Tones
deck_list.description: When you weave magic into words or a performance, you may choose to use two cards at the same or have your magic effect a second valid target.

deck_list.name: Anything You Can Do, I Can Do Better
deck_list.description:
When you Make Camp, you can choose to spend some time with another player character. If you do, choose one:

  • They choose a card you have. They can spend 1 Hold to use that card.
  • You choose a card they have. You can spend 1 Hold to use that move.

When either of you next Make Camp, you both lose any remaining Hold from this move.
deck_list.header_image: Anything You Can Do, I Can Do Better.png

deck_list.name: Song of Rest
deck_list.description: When you Make Camp, those who listen to your soothing songs and stories either heal an additional 1d6 damage or take +1 Forward the next day.

deck_list.name: Litany of Curses
deck_list.description: When you taunt an enemy with insult after insult, roll+CHA. On a 16-19, they are either left open and exposed or make a rash decision to get back at you, the GM will say. On a 9-15, you also strike a chord; from now on and whenever possible, they’ll go after you with extreme prejudice.

deck_list.name: Parry and Riposte
deck_list.description:
When you attempt to deflect and dodge a melee attack while unarmed or wielding a precise weapon, roll+DEX. On a 7+, you avoid the attack. On a 16-19, you also choose 1:

  • You change up the distance, closing in or disengaging.
  • You deal half your damage (rounded up) to the attacker.

On a miss, you are vulnerable to the attacker's next move.

deck_list.name: Duellante
deck_list.description:
Requires: Parry and Riposte

Add these to your choices for Parry and Riposte:

  • You disarm your attacker.
  • You trip, hamper, or embarrass your attacker.
  • You redirect their blow into someone or something else.

When you Parry and Riposte, on a 20+, choose 2 (not 1).

deck_list.name: With a Little Help..
deck_list.description: You can Aid or Interfere with just a few impactful words. You also take +1 forward and your allies take +1 forward. You still risk the consequences of their action.

deck_list.name: For My Friends
deck_list.description:
Requires: With a Little Help..

When you Aid an ally, you act together in perfect harmony. Instead of aiding, you can roll 2d6 + CHA and your ally can use that result in place of one of their rolls until the rest of the session. You still risk the consequences of their action.

deck_list.name: Enchanting Artist
deck_list.description:
When you perform in front of an audience, describe the story you tell, the song you sing, or the details of your performance and roll+CHA. On a 7+, you hold the attention of all sentient, living creatures for as long as you perform and as long as nothing distracts them. On a 16-19, you also choose 2. On a 9-15, choose 1.

  • A member of the audience becomes enraptured with you; the GM will say who.
  • Someone comes to you afterwards, requesting your services or bearing news of an opportunity.
  • One or more members of the audience will give you gifts - the GM will say what.

deck_list.name: I Heard About It
deck_list.description: When you Spout Lore about someone or something you’ve heard tales, songs, or legends about, you may roll +CHA instead of +INT. On a 16-19, you may also ask the GM any one question about the subject; they will answer truthfully.

deck_list.name: Countersong
deck_list.description: When you weave magic into your words or into a performance, You drown out the magical incantations of a spellcaster you can hear, causing their spell to fail. Roll +CHA, on a 16-19, you achieve it On a 9-15, your spell still works, but you also draw unwanted attention or your magic reverberates to other targets affecting them as well, GM’s choice.

deck_list.name: Whelming Blast
deck_list.description: When you weave magic into your words or into a performance, you can have a foe becomes temporarily confused, causing them to lash out and attack anyone nearby. Roll +CHA, on a 16-19, you achieve it On a 9-15, your spell still works, but you also draw unwanted attention or your magic reverberates to other targets affecting them as well, GM’s choice. An ally takes +1 armor Forward and +2 damage Forward.

deck_list.name: Breaker of Chains
deck_list.description: When you weave magic into your words or into a performance, you can have an ally freed of all physical restraints and roll+CHA. On a 16-19, you achieve it. On a 9-15, your spell still works, but you also draw unwanted attention or your magic reverberates to other targets affecting them as well, GM’s choice. An ally takes +1 armour Forward and +2 damage Forward.

deck_list.name: Invigorating Chorus
deck_list.description: When you weave magic into your words or into a performance, an ally heals 1d6+1 damage and roll+CHA. On a 16-19, you achieve it. On a 9-15, your spell still works, but you also draw unwanted attention or your magic reverberates to other targets affecting them as well, GM’s choice.

deck_list.name: Metal Hurlant
deck_list.description: When you weave magic into your words or into a performance, you can have a foe takes 1d6+1 damage and is deafened for a few minutes and roll+CHA. On a 16-19, you achieve it. On a 9-15, your spell still works, but you also draw unwanted attention or your magic reverberates to other targets affecting them as well, GM’s choice.

deck_list.name: Inspire Greatness
deck_list.description: When you weave magic into your words or into a performance, you can have an ally takes +1 armour Forward and +2 damage Forward and roll+CHA. On a 16-19, you achieve it On a 9-15, your spell still works, but you also draw unwanted attention or your magic reverberates to other targets affecting them as well, GM’s choice. An ally takes +1 armour Forward and +2 damage Forward.

deck_list.name: Dirge of Doom
deck_list.description: When you weave magic into your words or into a performance, A foe takes -1 armour Forward and -2 damage Forward. and roll+CHA and roll+CHA. On a 16-19, you achieve it On a 9-15, your spell still works, but you also draw unwanted attention or your magic reverberates to other targets affecting them as well, GM’s choice.

deck_list.name: Inspire Courage
deck_list.description: When you weave magic into your words or into a performance, you can have An ally’s mind is cleared of fear and enchantment and roll+CHA and roll+CHA. On a 16-19, you achieve it. On a 9-15, your spell still works, but you also draw unwanted attention or your magic reverberates to other targets affecting them as well, GM’s choice.

deck_list.name: College of Percussions
deck_list.description: The College of Percussions, Drumming Rally is a renowned institution located in the city of Seville, Spain. Here, the bards learn to play the powerful and inspiring rhythms that can clear an ally's mind of fear and grant them +1 armor Forward. Roll +CHA, on a 16-19, you achieve it On a 9-15, your spell still works, but you also draw unwanted attention or your magic reverberates to other targets affecting them as well, GM’s choice. An ally takes +1 armour Forward and +2 damage Forward.

deck_list.name: College of Woodwinds
deck_list.description: The College of Woodwinds is situated in the city of Edinburgh, Scotland. The bards here are trained to play a tune on their woodwind instruments that creates a gust of wind, blocking a single incoming attack and dealing 1d6 damage to the attacker. Roll +CHA, on a 16-19, you achieve it On a 9-15, your spell still works, but you also draw unwanted attention or your magic reverberates to other targets affecting them as well, GM’s choice.

deck_list.name: College of Brass
deck_list.description: The College of Brass and Accordions, Fanfare of Fury is a prestigious institution located in the city of Paris, France. The bards here are taught to play a bold and commanding tune on their brass instruments, inspiring their allies to greatness and granting them +1 damage Forward and +1 armor Forward. Roll +CHA, on a 16-19, you achieve it On a 9-15, your spell still works, but you also draw unwanted attention or your magic reverberates to other targets affecting them as well, GM’s choice.

deck_list.name: College of Voice
deck_list.description: The College of Voice, Siren's Song is located in the city of Athens, Greece. The bards here are skilled in singing a mesmerizing and seductive tune that lures a single foe in, causing them to become entranced and more vulnerable to further attacks. Roll +CHA, on a 16-19, you achieve it On a 9-15, your spell still works, but you also draw unwanted attention or your magic reverberates to other targets affecting them as well, GM’s choice.

deck_list.name: College of Lute and Strings
deck_list.description:
The College of Lute and Strings: Melody of Madness is located in the bustling city of Venice, renowned for its rich artistic heritage. The college is housed in a grand Venetian palace, where students of music come to hone their craft.

When you play a frenetic and chaotic tune on your lute, roll+Cha. On a 16-19, choose two from the list below. On a 9-15, choose one:

  • A single foe becomes confused and attacks anyone nearby
  • Other foes are momentarily stunned by the power of your music
  • All allies within earshot are inspired and gain +1 forward

On a miss, the melody of madness backfires, causing harm to yourself or your allies.

deck_list.name: College of Sculpting
deck_list.description:
The College of Sculpting: Golem's Grasp is located in the remote mountain village of Carrara, where the finest marble in the land is mined. The college is housed in a grand marble temple, where students of sculpture come to learn the secrets of animating stone.

When you animate a stone golem that grasps and crushes a single foe, roll+Int. On a 16-19, the golem deals 1d6 damage and restrains the foe. On a 9-15, choose one from the list below:

  • The golem deals damage but does not restrain the foe
  • The golem is not fully under your control and may act on its own accord
  • The golem is slow to react and may take a moment to carry out your command

On a miss, the golem goes out of control and harms you or your allies.

deck_list.name: College of Painting
deck_list.description: The College of Painting: Mightier than the Sword is located in Florence, Italy, a city known for its art and culture in the year 1444. As a student of this college, you have mastered the ability to bring your paintings to life, allowing you to summon shadowy figures that attack your enemies. When you use this feature, roll+Int. On a 16-19, your painting springs to life and deals 1d6+1 damage to a single foe. On a 9-15, your painting attacks but also attracts unwanted attention or complications. On a miss, your painting may turn against you or cause unintended harm.

deck_list.name: College of Cooking
deck_list.description: The College of Cooking: Healing Stew is located in Lyon, France, a city renowned for its culinary traditions in the year 1444. As a student of this college, you have learned to prepare nourishing stews that can heal your allies and grant them extra protection. When you use this feature, roll+Wis. On a 16-19, your stew restores 1d6+1 health to a single ally and grants them +1 armor forward. On a 9-15, your stew still heals but attracts unwanted attention or complications. On a miss, your stew may have unintended consequences, such as making your allies sick or attracting unwanted attention.

deck_list.name: College of Blacksmithing
deck_list.description: The College of Blacksmithing: Repairer is located in Nuremberg, Germany, a city famous for its skilled blacksmiths in the year 1444. As a student of this college, you have honed your skills in repairing and maintaining weapons and armor. When you use this feature, roll+Str. On a 16-19, you repair and maintain all of your companions' weapons and armor, granting them +1 forward for using a weapon and +1 forward for using a shield or an armor. On a 9-15, you still repair and maintain, but attract unwanted attention or complications. On a miss, your repairs may be subpar, causing harm or failure during battle.

deck_list.name: College of Dancing
deck_list.description: The College of Dancing: Dance of Love is located in the city of Venice, Italy. The college is known for teaching students how to perform seductive dances that can influence their foes. When you perform the Dance of Love, choose a single foe and roll +CHA, on a 16-19, you achieve it. They become infatuated with you and are distracted, making them vulnerable to further attacks. This effect lasts for a few moments before wearing off. On a 9-15, your spell still works, but you also draw unwanted attention or your magic reverberates to other targets affecting them as well, GM’s choice.

deck_list.name: College of Brewing
deck_list.description: The College of Tea and Coffee Brewing: Elixir of Energy is located in the region of Bavaria, Germany. This college specializes in creating invigorating potions that grant temporary bursts of energy. When you brew an Elixir of Energy and give it to an ally, they gain +1 forward to any dice roll for the next 24 hours and increased energy. The elixir can be used only once per 24 hours.

deck_list.name: Wanderer
deck_list.description:
You are a skilled traveler and cart driver, and you know the trade routes and markets like the back of your hand. You own a cart, choose from these options:

  • Big and bulky
  • Small and fast
  • Drawn by 4 horses
  • 1 elephant-sized beast
  • magical-engine powered

Its wheels are built for:

  • stone roads
  • muddy roads
  • gravel roads

For 1000 coins you can choose to improve your cart with one following options:

  • Its inside is bigger than it seems
  • It can shrink to the size of a crate
  • Make your cart an intelligent being, your cart can fly as an airship
  • Your cart grows two mechanical legs
  • Your cart becomes airtight (everything inside its safe from water/void) and its immune to environmental damage like lava or acid
  • Your cart grows two mechanical arms.

deck_list.name: Expert Hunter
deck_list.description:
You have extensive knowledge about the history of hunting and various tactics used to track and take down prey. When you Spout Lore about creatures you're hunting or tracking, on a 16-19 you gain a useful piece of information about your quarry. On a 9-15, the GM will tell you something interesting, but it's up to you to make it useful.

In addition, you gain +1 ongoing when you Hunt and Track your quarry.

deck_list.name: Smuggler
deck_list.description: When you move something from one place to another, you get +3 to your rolls

deck_list.name: Soldier
deck_list.description: When you coordinate with somebody else in a tense situation, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Setup Strike
deck_list.description: When you deal damage to an enemy, you create an opening that an ally can capitalize on to either take +1 to their roll or take +2 damage to their attack.

deck_list.name: Well Organized
deck_list.description: When you use Tools of the Trade, you may choose to spend a Readiness to retrieve a specific weapon, tool, or substance you need from your arsenal at a moment’s notice instead of having to carefully unpack it first.

deck_list.name: Trackless Step
deck_list.description: When you move with care and calm, you make no noise and leave no sign of your passage.

deck_list.name: Camouflage
deck_list.description: When you keep still in a natural environment, you’re utterly undetectable until you do something that would reveal yourself (like attacking, moving, or speaking above a whisper).

deck_list.name: Armour Break
deck_list.description: When you attack a specific section of physical or natural armour, roll+STR. On a 16-19, the section is chipped away or broken entirely; any attack that manages to hit that spot ignores armour. On a 9-15, the effect is only temporary or the vulnerability is difficult to target, the GM will say.

deck_list.name: Relentless Harrier
deck_list.description:
When you assault and harass a foe to provoke or confuse them, roll+DEX. On a 16-19, choose 2. On a 9-15, choose 1.
You deal your damage to them.
You slip away before they can react.
You force them to break formation or expose themselves.

deck_list.name: Strider
deck_list.description: When you Undertake a Perilous Journey and you roll, you treat any result of a 1-8 as a 9-15.

deck_list.name: Turn the Tables
deck_list.description:
When you get into a tense situation in a location that you had the time and foresight to prepare accordingly, roll+INT. On a 16-19, hold 3. On a 9-15, hold 2. On a 1-8, in addition to whatever the GM says, hold 1. You can spend this hold, 1-for-1, to describe the preparations you activate to:
Deal your damage to someone in the area.
Open or seal a passage or escape route.
Deprive someone of a sense or known advantage.

deck_list.name: Know Your Enemy
deck_list.description: When you Spout Lore about an enemy’s abilities, habits, or weaknesses, take 1 Readiness against that enemy.

deck_list.name: Grisly Trophy
deck_list.description:
When you slay a dangerous creature, you may impart some of its power into a trophy (worn, 1 weight) - a horn, a claw, a skull, or some other body part. The GM will give you one nonmagical move the creature had; while you wear this trophy, you may perform that move by Defying Danger first.

You may only wear and benefit from one trophy at a time.

deck_list.name: Arcane Trophy
deck_list.description: When you fashion a Grisly Trophy from a magical creature, the GM will also give you one magical move the creature had (a freezing touch, a gaze that turns to stone, etc).

deck_list.name: Favoured Enemy
deck_list.description:
When you have downtime, you can declare a specific type of enemy (goblins, mages, etc) as your Favoured Enemy.

Your Favoured Enemy can never take you by surprise, and you may spend Preparation against your Favoured Enemy as if it were Readiness. When you Bolster against your Favoured Enemy, take an extra Preparation.

deck_list.name: Animal Companion
deck_list.description: You are accompanied by a beast of uncommon loyalty and cleverness. See the Animal Companion insert for details.

deck_list.name: A Safe Place
deck_list.description: When you choose and prepare the party’s campsite, whomever the GM chooses to Stay Sharp during the night takes +1 to their roll.

deck_list.name: Constant Vigilance
deck_list.description: You can always roll to Stay Sharp, even if you are asleep, distracted, or someone else is on watch. If someone else is on watch, you both roll, but only the best result applies.

deck_list.name: Tools of the Trade
deck_list.description:
When you know of a specific weapon, tool, or substance that will aid in the slaying of a creature, you can carefully unpack your arsenal and start searching. If it’s relatively cheap or common, you have it; if it’s expensive, rare, or unique, roll+INT. On a 16-19, the GM will say you either have it, or have something similarly useful. On a 9-15, the GM will pick one:

  • You have it, but it needs to be repaired, charged, or assembled first.
  • You have it, but there are serious drawbacks to using it.
  • You have it, but it’s not as you remembered it to be.
If you find what you’re looking for, the GM will ask you “why did you prepare for this?” Tell them.

deck_list.name: Hunt and Track
deck_list.description:
When you spend a few moments scanning your surroundings, you can ask the GM “What tracks or signs of passage are present here?”

When you Discern Realities by studying tracks or signs of passage, take +1 and add “Where did they go?” to the list of questions you can ask.

deck_list.name: Always Prepared
deck_list.description:
When you enter into a conflict, roll+INT. On a 16-19, take 3 Readiness. On a 9-15, take 2 Readiness. On a 1-8, in addition to whatever the GM says, take 1 Readiness; you’ll need it.

You may only ever have 3 Readiness at a time.

deck_list.name: Ruthless Slayer
deck_list.description:
While engaged in a conflict, you may spend a Readiness against an enemy, 1-for-1, to:

  • Predict their movements: Take the 16-19 result on Defy Danger.
  • Know their thoughts: Ask the GM “what’s my opponent’s next move?” and take +1 Forward to act on the answers.
  • Strike with precision: You deal half your damage (rounded up and ignoring armour) and physically maim them - sever a limb, shatter a bone, slash an artery.

deck_list.name: Bestiary Knowledge
deck_list.description:
You are learned about the world and its creatures; take +1 to Spout Lore about the wilds and its creatures, or about monsters. When you first encounter a beast or monster, you may ask the GM any one question about it; they will answer truthfully.

Also, if you take the Animal Companion move you can instead by accompanied by a ‘Fellow Ranger’, which is a humanoid creature of any size. It has the same starting equipment of a ranger and uses the same rules as an Animal Companion.

deck_list.name: Hunter
deck_list.description: You are a member of the Hunters of the Lunar Temple, a secretive organization that worships a Moon-like deity located in the Carpathian Mountains of Transylvania. You’ve lived with the critters and creatures of the wilds just as much, if not more, than your own kind. You can understand animals, and when you spend some time in the wilderness, you can change your Animal Companion by bonding with a creature with the area. Your previous Animal Companion returns to the wilderness but remains in the region. When you watch deeply the moon, you can summon any of your previous animal companions to exchange with your current one.

deck_list.name: Ranger
deck_list.description:
You are a member of the Guardians of the Wilds, an organization of rangers who protect the forests and mountains of the Swiss Alps. You mastered the world’s twisted paths, dense forests, and treacherous mountainscapes long before you picked up a weapon. When you Undertake a Perilous Journey, you may choose 1 extra option from the list, even on a 1-8. When you Forage, you treat any result of a 1-8 as a 9-15.

Also, if you take the Animal Companion move you can instead be accompanied by a ‘Fellow Ranger’, which is a humanoid creature of any size. It has the same starting equipment of a ranger and uses the same rules as an Animal Companion.

deck_list.name: Healthy Distrust
deck_list.description: Whenever the dark, corrupt, or chaotic magic wielded by your foes causes you to Defy Danger, treat any result of a 1-8 as a 9-15.

deck_list.name: Indomitable
deck_list.description: When you suffer a debility (even through Bloody Aegis), you take +1 Forward against whatever caused it.

deck_list.name: Stand Your Ground
deck_list.description: When you convince an ally to hold fast against incoming danger, you both gain +1 Ongoing as long as you stay right where you are.

deck_list.name: Smite Evil
deck_list.description: When you condemn an outlaw or evil creature for their misdeeds, your weapon is engulfed in a searing, magical light. Your attacks against them and their associates are Brutal (you roll damage twice and take the best results), and the light shed by your weapon is blinding to them.

deck_list.name: Judge and Jury
deck_list.description: When you use I Am the Law, on a 20+, you may choose an option from the list. The GM can’t choose that option.

deck_list.name: Indomitable
deck_list.description: When you suffer a debility (even through Bloody Aegis), you take +1 Forward against whatever caused it.

deck_list.name: Inspired Virtue
deck_list.description: Whenever something comes to your attention that opposes your virtues, you take +1 Forward to put an end to it.

deck_list.name: Shake it Off!
deck_list.description: When you order an ally to overcome their dire straits, roll+CHA. On a 16-19, they shake it off, break free, struggle through, or whatnot. On a 9-15, a PC will take +1 Forward to overcome it, while an NPC will take some time to overcome it.

deck_list.name: We Happy Few
deck_list.description:
When you give an inspiring speech to your allies before facing a dire threat, roll+CHA. On a 16-19, each ally takes 2 Inspiration. On a 9-15, each ally takes 1 Inspiration. On a 1-8, in addition to whatever the GM says, each ally takes 1 Inspiration, but you take -1 Ongoing until you share your plaguing doubts with someone else.

Once battle is joined, your allies can spend their Inspiration at any time, 1-for-1, to:

  • Act fearlessly against a terrifying foe or odds.
  • Keep themselves at 1 HP when they would be reduced to or below 0 HP.
  • Make their attack ignore armour and leave their target vulnerable.

deck_list.name: Divine Favour
deck_list.description: You serve a particular religion, order, or deity which grants you power beyond that provided by your own moral code. You gain a Cleric move of your choice. Treat your level for this move as if you were one level lower.

deck_list.name: Bloody Aegis
deck_list.description: When you take damage, you can grit your teeth and accept the blow. If you do, you take no damage but instead suffer a debility of your choice. The other effects of the attack (if any) still apply, and you can’t use this move if you already have all six debilities.

deck_list.name: Voice of Authority
deck_list.description: When you raise your voice, it carries far and cuts through even the din of heavy battle. You also take +1 to Recruit or to Order a Follower.

deck_list.name: Unquestioned Authority
deck_list.description: When you roll a 20+ to Order a Follower, they transcend their moment of fear and doubt and carry out your order with particular effectiveness and efficiency.

deck_list.name: Quest
deck_list.description: When you dedicate yourself to a mission through prayer and ritual cleansing, state what you set out to do (such as discover the truth about someone or something, or slay a blight on the land). The GM will give you a blessing (such as a voice that transcends language, or an invulnerability to bladed weapons); stay true to your goal, and this blessing remains yours. When you complete your Quest, mark XP.

deck_list.name: Charge!
deck_list.description: When you lead the charge into combat, those you lead take +1 Forward.

deck_list.name: Staunch Defender
deck_list.description: When you Defend, you take an additional 1 hold, even on a 1-8. Whenever you spend hold to Defend someone or something else, you also reduce the attacker’s damage by 1, if appropriate.

deck_list.name: Impervious Defender
deck_list.description: When you Defend, on a 20+, instead of taking any hold you may choose to instead thwart the attack entirely and put your attacker in a spot.

deck_list.name: I Am the Law
deck_list.description:
When you give an NPC an order based on your righteous authority, roll+CHA. On a 7+, the GM chooses one:

  • They’ll do what you say.
  • They’ll back away cautiously, then flee.
  • They’ll attack you.

On a 16-19, you also take +1 Forward against them. On a 1-8, in addition to whatever the GM says, you take -1 Forward against them.

deck_list.name: Lay On Hands
deck_list.description:
When you touch someone, skin to skin, and pray for their well-being, choose one of the following:

  • They heal 1d6+1 damage.
  • They are cured of one mundane poison or disease.

Then, roll+CHA. On a 16-19, they are healed or cured, as you wished it. On a 9-15, they are healed or cured, but the effect is taxing; you are either drained (taking 1d6+1 damage that ignores armour) or left exposed.

deck_list.name: Holy Order of St. Michael
deck_list.description: You have been trained in the Holy Order of St. Michael, a group of paladins dedicated to upholding justice and righteousness. When you question a defeated, captured, or willing individual, you can stare into their eyes to know if they are lying or not. Your oath demands that you never let a crime go unpunished and that you always seek to bring justice to the land.

deck_list.name: Sisters of Mercy
deck_list.description: You have been trained in the Sisters of Mercy, a religious order of healers and caretakers. Your oath demands that you let no innocent creature suffer in your presence. Whenever you heal someone else, you are healed for half the amount you healed them by. Your order believes in the sanctity of life and that all beings deserve compassion and care.

deck_list.name: Order of the Silver Shield
deck_list.description: You have been trained in the Order of the Silver Shield, a knightly order dedicated to protecting the weak and standing up against tyranny. Your oath demands that you refuse to let those who have power abuse it. Whenever you Defend another person and choose to damage the attacker, you deal full damage (not half). Your order believes in the chivalric virtues of bravery, honor, and selflessness.

deck_list.name: Order of the Pure Heart
deck_list.description: You have been trained in the Order of the Pure Heart, a monastic order that values asceticism and self-discipline. Your oath demands that you abstain from mortal pleasures and finery. You are immune to all mundane poisons and diseases. Your order believes in the pursuit of spiritual purity and detachment from worldly desires.

deck_list.name: Brotherhood of the Iron Fist
deck_list.description: You have been trained in the Brotherhood of the Iron Fist, a group of warriors who value loyalty and camaraderie above all else. Your oath demands that you remain true to your word and to your allies. When you speak the truth, none can doubt you; they might deny what you say, but in their hearts they recognise the truth. Your order believes in the importance of brotherhood and the bonds forged through battle.

deck_list.name: Oath of Penitence
deck_list.description:
You have been trained in a holy order of penitent clerics devoted to seeking redemption for past sins. Your order believes in avoiding needless violence and seeks to prevent conflicts whenever possible. When you try to prevent a conflict, take +1 to your roll.

To become a member of this order, you must undergo a rigorous initiation process that involves a pilgrimage to holy sites throughout Europe. Only those who have shown a true commitment to penance and a willingness to put the needs of others before their own are accepted as members.

deck_list.name: Monk training
deck_list.description:
You are a master of martial arts and have mastered the art of combat through discipline and meditation. Your training allows you to harness your inner energy to deliver powerful strikes, even when unarmed. When a Knight move asks you to roll +CHA or when you Parley on honest terms, you may roll +WIS instead. You also must follow this oath to gain these benefits:

  • Poverty: Don’t carry items that are more worth than a bottle of cheap wine.
  • While not carrying any armor, you gain Armor 2.
  • Peace: Don’t use weapons beside monk weapons (your body and wooden weapons).
  • When you Hack and Slash with Monk weapons, you gain this additional option: You deal damage and the enemy loses their reaction

deck_list.name: Paladin training
deck_list.description: You are a holy warrior, dedicated to upholding justice and righteousness. You are also trained in the art of the duel, and are skilled at facing off against a single opponent in combat. When you are engaged in a 1 vs 1 duel, you may ask the GM for information about your opponent's weaknesses or vulnerabilities, and take +1 forward when acting on the information.

deck_list.name: To Me, My Brothers!
deck_list.description:
When you attempt to rally warriors to your banner, roll+CHA. On a 7+, they will fight alongside you for one battle. On a 16-19, choose 3. On a 9-15, choose 2.

  • The warband is as large as you could hope for.
  • The warband will follow you into the jaws of hell itself.
  • The warband is well-equipped.
  • The warband is made up of veteran warriors.
  • The warband will not expect a great reward after the battle.

deck_list.name: Bend Bars, Lift Gates
deck_list.description:
When you use pure strength to destroy an inanimate obstacle, roll+STR. On a 16-19, choose 3. On a 9-15, choose 2:

  • It doesn’t take a very long time.
  • Nothing of value is damaged.
  • It doesn’t make an inordinate amount of noise.
  • You can fix the thing again without a lot of effort.

deck_list.name: Arcane Blacksmith
deck_list.description: Requires Signature Weapon. When you have access to a forge, you can graft the magical gem of a weapon onto your Signature Weapon. This process destroys the magical weapon, but your Signature Weapon gains all of its properties. Only one effect of those weapons can be active at a single time and can be switched at any time.

deck_list.name: Strength of Ten
deck_list.description: You always win one-on-one contests of strength. Also, choose 1: Every attack you make has the forceful tag. Every melee weapon you wield has the thrown and near tags. Every ranged weapon you wield has the far tag.

deck_list.name: Strength of a Hundred
deck_list.description: Anyone you carry counts as 1 weight, no matter how much they weigh or carry themselves. Also, either take another choice from the Strength of Ten list, or take this: Anyone you pick up has the thrown and near tags.

deck_list.name: Shield Mastery
deck_list.description:
When you enter combat with your shield at the ready, roll +STR. On a 10+, hold 3. On a 7-9, hold 1. You can spend your hold at any time during combat to:

  • Defend: Spend 1 hold to deflect an incoming attack or missile with your shield, reducing the damage you take by your shield's armor rating.
  • Bash: Spend 1 hold to make a powerful bash with your shield, dealing your shield's damage and stunning your target for a moment.
  • Push: Spend 1 hold to shove an opponent back, creating distance between you and them.
  • Protect: Spend 1 hold to interpose yourself between an ally and harm, taking the blow instead of them.

When you run out of hold, your shield is no longer at the ready and you lose the benefits of this move until you have a chance to prepare it again.

deck_list.name: Through Death’s Eyes
deck_list.description: When you go into battle, roll+WIS. On a 16-19, name one NPC who will live and one who will die. On a 9-15, name one or the other. The GM will make your vision come true, if it’s even remotely possible. On a 1-8,in addition to whatever the GM says, you see your own death; take -1 Ongoing throughout the battle.

deck_list.name: Thicket of Blades
deck_list.description: When you engage an enemy in melee combat, they are forced to acknowledge you. When an enemy you are engaged with makes a move against anyone other than you, you may attempt to stop them. If you do, roll+INT. On a 16-19, their move is cancelled - their attack is blocked, their escape route cut off, their spell interrupted. On a 9-15, you intercept their move - rather than who they were originally aiming for, they hit you.

deck_list.name: Sellsword
deck_list.description:
When you're looking for work, roll +CHA. On an 16-19, choose 3. On a 9-15, choose 2. On a 1-8, choose 1. You can choose the same option multiple times:

  • The pay is good: You get paid double the normal rate.
  • The job is simple: The task is straightforward and doesn't require much effort.
  • The employer is reputable: The employer has a good reputation and won't put you in unnecessary danger.
  • The job is legal: The task is within the bounds of the law.
  • The job is challenging: The task is difficult, but the pay is commensurate.
  • The job is exciting: The task is risky, but the potential reward is worth it.

deck_list.name: Field Engineer
deck_list.description:
You carry a unique siege weapon, a formidable tool of destruction that you have mastered and made your own. It can be collapsed into a backpack , such a portable ballista or a cannon. Unpacking and packing your siege weapon requires 1 minute. Your weapon is 5-weight; give it a name, describe it, and tell us how it came into your possession. The range of your weapon is Far (200 m), you start with 1 Siege Ammunition. Siege weapon ammunition (1 ammo, 10 coins, 1 weight).

Pick two enhancements it has:

  • Ranged: The range of your weapon becomes Very Far (500 m).
  • Explosive: It has the explosive tag, causing widespread destruction to those caught in its blast.
  • Precise: It has the precise tag, allowing for accurate shots even at long distances (can hit an apple from 200 meters).
  • Multi-shot: It can fire 3 multiple shots in quick succession.
  • Reinforced: It is made of sturdy materials, can withstand heavy damage and can provide cover.
  • Mobile: It can be easily moved and set up in different locations as it was a cart.

deck_list.name: Not to be Trifled With
deck_list.description: Your iron fist commands respect. When you Parley using threats of violence as leverage, you may roll +STR instead of +CHA.

deck_list.name: Deathless
deck_list.description: You’ve escaped Death’s grasp once before and lived to tell the tale; its embrace no longer fazes you. When you take your Last Breath, you may roll +CON.

deck_list.name: KeenEyed
deck_list.description: Nothing escapes your notice. When you Discern Realities, add the following question to the list: “How can I turn this situation to my advantage?”

deck_list.name: Impressive Poise
deck_list.description: Your grace and wit take people by surprise. When you catch someone off-guard with your quick reflexes or thinking, you take +1 Forward against them.

deck_list.name: Signature Weapon
deck_list.description:
Your weapon is 2-weight; give it a name, describe it, and tell us how it came into your possession.

Choose the most appropriate range for your weapon:

  • Hand
  • Close
  • Reach
  • Near

Then pick two enhancements it has:

  • It glows in the presence of ________ (goblins, mages, etc)
  • Grisly: It deals +1 damage and is vicious.
  • Sharp or Spiked: It has 2-piercing.
  • Versatile: It has an additional range.
  • Huge: It has the messy and forceful tags.
  • Well-Crafted: It has -1 weight.
  • Perfectly-Weighted: It has the precise tag.

deck_list.name: Riddle of Steel
deck_list.description:
When you Discern Realities in combat, take +1.

When you engage a sentient foe in combat, you may ask one of the following questions; the GM will answer you truthfully:

  • What do they expect to achieve?
  • What are they trying to hide?
  • What emotion drives them?

deck_list.name: Arcane Spellcaster
deck_list.description: You have extensive training in the arcane arts, and can draw upon your knowledge to gain insight into magical phenomena. When you encounter a magical effect or creature, you may roll+Int. On a 16-19, you understand the nature and origin of the magic, and gain +1 forward to discern realities or spout lore related to it. On a 9-15, you have some knowledge of the magic, but it is incomplete or outdated, and you only gain +1 forward if you act on the information immediately. On a miss, the magic overwhelms you, and you suffer -1 ongoing to all rolls related to magic until you receive a moment of rest or a counteracting spell.

deck_list.name: Pyromancy
deck_list.description:
When you call upon the power of fire to achieve your goals, roll+Cha. On a 16-19, choose three from the list below. On a 9-15, choose two:

  • You create an explosion, dealing damage to all creatures in the area
  • You shape flames to your will, directing them to move or change shape as you desire
  • You ignite a nearby object or surface, causing it to burst into flames
  • You intimidate or frighten others with displays of fiery power
  • You protect yourself from fire and heat

On a miss, the fire you call upon burns out of control, causing harm to yourself or your allies.

deck_list.name: Abjuration Specialist
deck_list.description: You can create and maintain one shield of force at a time; whoever wields it treats it as a shield (+1 armour).

deck_list.name: Connections
deck_list.description: When you put out word to the criminal underbelly about something you want or need, roll+CHA. On a 16-19, someone has it, just for you. On a 9-15, you’ll have to settle for something close or it comes with strings attached, your call.

deck_list.name: Escape Route
deck_list.description: When things go south and you need a way out, name your escape route and roll+DEX. On a 16-19, you’re gone. On a 9-15, you can stay or go, but if you go it will cost you; the GM will say what you leave behind or bring with you.

deck_list.name: Evasion
deck_list.description: When you Defy Danger, on a 20+, you transcend the danger. You not only do what you set out to do, but the GM will offer you a better outcome, a moment or true beauty, or a show of unearthly grace.

deck_list.name: Cunning Dilettante
deck_list.description: Gain one non-multiclass move of your choice from any class list. Treat your level for this move as if you were one level lower.

deck_list.name: Leave No Trace
deck_list.description:
You are preternaturally silent, and will never make noise unless you choose to. You never need to Defy Danger to act quietly.

Whenever you like, you may ask the GM “where’s the best hiding place?” and they’ll tell you the truth.

deck_list.name: Shoot First
deck_list.description: You’re never caught by surprise. When an enemy would get the drop on you, you get to act first instead.

deck_list.name: Conjuration Specialist
deck_list.description: You can conjure a simple invisible construct that can do nothing but carry 3 Load of items.

deck_list.name: Divination Specialist
deck_list.description: You can telepathically communicate with one person you can see within near range.

deck_list.name: Transmutation Specialist
deck_list.description: With a touch, you can temporarily change one fundamental feature of a willing person for about an hour. Lungs can become gills, arms can become wings, and so on.

deck_list.name: Tricks of the Trade
deck_list.description: When you pick locks or pockets or disable traps, roll+DEX. On a 16-19, you do it, no problem. On a 9-15, you still do it, but the GM will offer you two options between suspicion, danger, or cost.

deck_list.name: Poisoner
deck_list.description:
You’ve mastered the care and use of poisons; they are no longer dangerous for you to use. Choose a poison from the list below; you know the recipe for it.

  • Oil of Tagit: Applied. The target falls into a light sleep for INT minutes (Cost: 50)
  • Bloodweed: Touch. The target inflicts -2 Damage Ongoing for INT minutes (Cost: 20)
  • Goldenroot: Applied. The target treats the next creature they see as a trusted ally, until proved otherwise for INT minutes (Cost: 50)
  • Serpent’s Tears: Touch. Anyone dealing damage to the target deals +2 Damage for INT minutes (Cost: 20)

When you have time to dissect and analyze a poison, you learn its recipe. When you have time to gather materials and a safe space to brew, you can make three uses of any poison you know the recipe. Each potion has a cost for the raw materials which doesn’t include special and unique ingredients.

deck_list.name: Dirty Fighting
deck_list.description:
