When you and an ally flank an enemy and you make an attack against them, choose one:

  • You create an advantage or an opening; your ally takes +1 Forward to act on it.
  • You reduce their armour by 1 until they repair it.
  • You take something they’re carrying; now it’s yours.

deck_list.name: Cheap Shot
deck_list.description: When you Ambush someone with a hand or precise weapon, your attack is Brutal (you roll damage twice and take the best results) and you treat any result of a 1-8 as a 9-15.

deck_list.name: Initiate
deck_list.description: When you need to communicate with another religious figure, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Labourer
deck_list.description: When you need to do something and sweat a lot, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Marine
deck_list.description: When you do somethign while getting wet, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Mercenary
deck_list.description: When yon need to convince someone to pay you to do something, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Militiaman
deck_list.description: When you teach somebody how to defend themself, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Jailer
deck_list.description: When you watch out that nobody gets away, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Jester
deck_list.description: When you need to make laugh someone, you +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Miner
deck_list.description: When you do something dangerous in a dark and dusty place, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Shaman
deck_list.description: When you communicate with the spirits, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Heist
deck_list.description:
When you take time to make a plan to steal something, name the thing you want to steal and ask the GM these questions. You and your allies take +1 Forward when acting on the answers.

  • Who will notice it’s missing?
  • What’s its most powerful defense?
  • Who will come after it?
  • Who else wants it?

deck_list.name: Underdog
deck_list.description: When you’re outnumbered, you take +1 to Defy Danger or to even the odds.

deck_list.name: All in the Wrist
deck_list.description:
Daggers and knives you wield get the thrown and near tags, and you can always Ambush with them.
You also keep a brace of iron throwing knives (near, 2 ammo, 1 weight) on your person; When you Supply, you may restock it for free.

deck_list.name: Nothing Up My Sleeve
deck_list.description: When you conceal a small object (weight 0) on your person, no one can find it unless you are bound, stripped, and thoroughly searched. You can conceal up to DEX items this way.

deck_list.name: Wealth and Taste
deck_list.description: When you make a show of flashing a possession which appears valuable, name an NPC present. They will do anything to obtain your item, or one like it.

deck_list.name: Hideout
deck_list.description:
You have a headquarters, secret lair, or safe haven that you call your own - a decrepit library, perhaps, or an abandoned keep. Detail it, and choose 3 features it has.

  • It is carefully hidden, concealed from prying eyes.
  • It is laden with traps and secret passageways.
  • It has fortified or warded walls, windows, and doors.
  • A week’s worth of food and water.
  • A workshop and tools.
  • A library of old books and tomes.
  • A few uses each of Adventuring Gear and Bandages.
  • A handful of skilled assistants or associates.

When you utilise your Hideout’s features, take +1 to your roll.

deck_list.name: Envenom
deck_list.description: When you apply a poison that you’ve used before to your weapon, it’s touch instead of applied. When you discreetly apply a poison to a target, such as with a pinprick, they won’t even notice.

deck_list.name: Brewer
deck_list.description:
When you have time to gather materials and a safe place to brew, you can describe the effects of a poison you’d like to create; the GM will tell you that you can create it, but with one or more caveats:

  • It will only work under specific circumstances.
  • The best you can manage is a weaker version.
  • It’ll take a while for the effects to manifest.
  • It’ll have obvious side effects.

deck_list.name: Danger Sense
deck_list.description:
You can always ask the GM, ‘’Is there an ambush or trap here?’’. If they say ‘’ yes,’’ roll +INT: on a 16-19, ask the GM both questions; on a 9-15, ask 1:

  • What will trigger the trap or ambush?
  • What will happen once it’s triggered?

On a 1-8, don’t mark XP, but nothing bad happens just yet.

deck_list.name: Sneak Attack
deck_list.description:
When you attack someone up close and personal and they don’t see it coming, you deal your damage (as normal) and may choose to push your luck. If you do, roll+DEX. On a 16-19, choose 2. On a 9-15, choose 1.

  • You deal +1d6 damage
  • They don’t cry out, make noise, or draw attention.
  • You stun or hamper them, at least for the moment. You gain 1 combo point. You can have to up to 5 combo points.
  • You slip away before they can react.
  • Strike a weak spot, ignoring their armor.
  • You create an opportunity; you or an ally gain advantage if you act on it.

deck_list.name: Eviscerate
deck_list.description:
When you attack with a melee weapon and try to strike a vital point on your enemy, causing them to bleed profusely, spend any number of combo points to deal additional damage to your target equal to the number of combo points spent. If you spend 3 or more combo points, you can choose one of the following additional effects:

  • Disable your target’s limb of your choice (GM’s choice of the details).
  • Your target suffers from a debility of your choice.
  • Your target loses their next turn.

deck_list.name: Illusion Specialist
deck_list.description: You can create and maintain one lifelike illusion at a time, for as long as you concentrate. A lifelike illusion either looks, sounds, feels, smells, or tastes real and authentic.

deck_list.name: Necromancy Specialist
deck_list.description: You can harm others with an agonizing touch (hand); if you damage them, heal 1 damage.

deck_list.name: Commune
deck_list.description:
When you call upon the power of fate to achieve your goals, roll+Wis. On a 16-19, choose three from the list below. On a 9-15, choose two:

  • You glimpse the future, gaining advantage on your next roll
  • You reveal a hidden truth, discerning realities about something or someone
  • You alter the odds, changing the outcome of a random event in your favor
  • You sense danger, avoiding a trap or an ambush
  • You protect yourself from psychic damage and mind-affecting effects

On a miss, the power of fate turns against you, causing you to suffer a -1 ongoing until you make amends.

deck_list.name: Enchantment Specialist
deck_list.description: With a touch, you can grant or revoke an emotion - affection, anger, sadness, fear - for a few minutes.

deck_list.name: Arcane Volley
deck_list.description: You can fire small, magical projectiles (near); when you use them to Volley, you may choose to take 2 damage (ignoring armour) instead of expending ammo on a 9-15.

deck_list.name: Evocation Specialist
deck_list.description: You may fire small magical projectiles without spending mp as if you were using a slingshot

deck_list.name: Wild Shape
deck_list.description:
When you touch a living animal or an organic piece of them (while they are stil alive), you can shapeshift into that creature. The animal can be as big as a bear or as small as a mice. Roll +WIS. On a 16-19, choose 3 and hold 3. On a 9-15, choose 2 and hold 2:
- You retain your mental faculties
- You gain the physical abilities of the animal (e.g., claws, wings, etc.)
- You gain the senses of the animal (e.g., night vision, acute hearing, etc.). On a miss, the GM chooses two options (you can't fail the shapeshifting).

The size of the animal can affect your health and damage. If the animal is larger than your humanoid form, your HP becomes 20 and your hit damage (HD) becomes 2d6. If the animal is smaller, your HP becomes 3 and your hit damage (HD) becomes 1. If the animal is faster than your humanoid form, you gain +3 to DEX rolls. While in animal form, on any failed roll you make you lose 1 hold. When you lose all holds, yu are unable to control the animal instincts and you remain stuck in animal form. When you go to 0 HP while in animal form, you regain your humanoid form. You can return to your normal form at any time (while you are still in control.

deck_list.name: Empower Item
deck_list.description: Requires time and safety with a magical item in a place of power. When you empower that item, the next time you use it its effects are amplified. The GM will tell you exactly how.

deck_list.name: Counterspell
deck_list.description:
When you attempt to counter an arcane spell targeting you as it is being cast, roll+INT. On a 16-19, choose 2. On a 9-15, choose 1.

  • The spell deals no damage.
  • The spell’s effects are superficial and temporary.
  • You take +1 Forward against the caster.

deck_list.name: Eidetic Spellcasting
deck_list.description: Whenever you spend time meditating over your spellbooks, choose two Words that you have memorized or have memorized in the past. Whenever you Channel a spell and create a sentence with those two words, you may automatically channel it as if you rolled a 7 (and you hold 1 focus).

deck_list.name: Spell Knowledge
deck_list.description: You can memorize an additional word.

deck_list.name: Sage Advice
deck_list.description: When a character comes to you for guidance and you tell them what you honestly think is best, they take +1 Forward to follow your advice and do as you say.

deck_list.name: Ritual
deck_list.description:
When you want to achieve a powerful magical effect, tell the GM what you’re trying to achieve. Ritual effects are always possible, but the GM will give you 1 to 4 of the following conditions (separated by ANDs and ORs):

  • It’s going to take days/weeks/months.
  • First you must ________.
  • You’ll need help from ________.
  • It will require ________.
  • The effect will be unreliable or limited.
  • You and your allies will risk danger from ________.
  • You’ll have to disenchant ________ to do it.

When you perform a Ritual while accessing a source of great magical power, you may ignore one requirement of your choice. Ritual examples: Teleporting to a distant location; dominating a weak-willed creature; communicating between the planes; locating or viewing items, creatures, or places from afar.

deck_list.name: Shoemaking Magic
deck_list.description:
This spell book contains powerful magic words for shoemaking. When you cast these spells, you can create perfect fitting shoes, increase durability, and provide comfort for the feet. The magic words in this book are:

  • Calceus: This spell allows you to create shoes that fit perfectly to the wearer's feet, eliminating discomfort and pain.
  • Aptus: This spell strengthens the shoes, making them more durable and resistant to wear and tear.
  • Durabilis: This spell creates shoes that are virtually indestructible, able to withstand extreme conditions and use for a long time.
  • Comfortable: This spell enhances the comfort of the shoes, providing cushioning and support to the wearer's feet.

deck_list.name: Winemaking Magic
deck_list.description:
Vitis:

When you cast this spell, you can control the growth of grapes. You can make them grow faster, slower, or even change their shape.

Fermentare:

When you cast this spell, you can control the fermentation process of wine. You can make it happen faster, slower, or even change its flavor.

Aetas:

When you cast this spell, you can control the aging process of wine. You can make it age faster or slower, and even change its taste and aroma.

Cellarius:

When you cast this spell, you can magically store wine in a cellar. The wine will remain fresh and perfectly preserved for as long as you wish.

deck_list.name: Blacksmithing Magic
deck_list.description:
This spell book contains spells for blacksmithing, such as creating durable weapons and tools, increasing the strength of the metal, and making intricate designs. It contains the magic words:

  • Ferrum: Cast this spell to manipulate iron and steel, shaping it into the desired form.
  • Robur: Use this spell to increase the strength and durability of metal objects.
  • Forma: Cast this spell to manipulate the shape and form of metal objects.
  • Durabilis: Use this spell to create incredibly durable metal objects.

deck_list.name: Elemental Magic
deck_list.description:
Ignis:

When you cast this spell, you can create fire out of thin air. You can use the fire to light torches, start campfires, or even attack enemies.

Aqua:

When you cast this spell, you can summon water from nearby sources. You can use the water to extinguish fires, create a barrier of water, or even heal wounds.

Ventus:

When you cast this spell, you can control the wind. You can use the wind to move objects, create a gust of wind to push enemies away, or even fly.

Terra:

When you cast this spell, you can manipulate the earth. You can use the earth to create walls, dig trenches, or even cause earthquakes.

deck_list.name: Illusionary Magic
deck_list.description:
Mentem:

When you cast this spell, you can create illusions that affect the mind of the target. You can make them see or hear things that aren't there or make them forget about something that just happened.

Visum:

When you cast this spell, you can create illusions that affect the sight of the target. You can make them see things that aren't there or hide things that are there.

Audium:

When you cast this spell, you can create illusions that affect the hearing of the target. You can make them hear things that aren't there or make them deaf to something that is there.

Tactus:

When you cast this spell, you can create illusions that affect the sense of touch of the target. You can make them feel something that isn't there or numb a part of their body.

deck_list.name: Divination Magic
deck_list.description:
Futurum:

When you cast this spell, you can see a possible future and gain insight into events that have not yet happened. This spell allows you to predict the outcome of an action, the success of a plan, or the consequences of a decision.

Praedicere:

When you cast this spell, you can see into the future and gain knowledge of events that will happen. This spell allows you to make accurate predictions about future events, such as the weather, the movements of armies, or the fate of a kingdom.

Scrutari:

When you cast this spell, you can see distant places or people as if you were there. This spell allows you to scry on enemies, allies, or unknown locations, and gather information about them without being detected.

Praevidere:

When you cast this spell, you can detect hidden dangers or traps that might harm you or your allies. This spell allows you to sense the presence of invisible creatures, cursed objects, or magical wards, and avoid them.

deck_list.name: Necromancy Magic
deck_list.description:
Mortuus:

When you cast this spell, you can speak with the dead. The spirit of a deceased creature will appear and answer your questions, but it may not be willing to cooperate.

Animus:

When you cast this spell, you can raise a dead body as an undead creature. The creature will obey your commands, but it will be hostile towards all other living creatures.

Manere:

When you cast this spell, you can control the movements of a dead body. You can make it walk, run, or even attack, but it will not be able to speak or think for itself.

Vigere:

When you cast this spell, you can control the spirit of a dead creature. You can make it perform specific actions, such as opening doors or moving objects, but it will not be able to speak or think for itself.

deck_list.name: Arcane Spellcasting
deck_list.description:
You can spend half-hour of your time studying a spellbook in order to memorize a Word contained in it. If it's an rare book, each words takes 1 week. If it's a mythic book, each word takes 1 month. When you sleep, you forget all of your memorized words. When you acquire this card, you can also acquire for free a Spellbook card of Common type of your choice.

Cantrip.

When you drink a dose of Quicksilver and you spell out a single Word that you have memorized, spend 1 mp and you cast a Cantrip, a simple spell which effect is determined by the word effect explained in the spellbook.

Spell Casting.

When you spell out the sentence of a spell that you are crafting (see Spell Crafting), interpret the combined words meaning to define a new effect, spend 1 mp and roll+Int. On a 16-19 it is cast. On a 9-15 choose one:

  • You draw unwelcome attention from a spellcaster or magical being or put yourself in a spot.
  • The spell also creates an unintended side effect.
  • You take damage equal to md
  • You spend 1 extra mp

deck_list.name: Spell Crafting
deck_list.description:
Requires Arcane Spellcasting

When you deeply meditate or drink a dose of Quicksilver and travel mentally to the astral plane, you start to craft a spell into your arcane focus. Choose two Words that you have ‘memorized’ to create a Sentence and roll+Con. On a 20+, hold 6 focus, on a 16-19, hold 3 Focus. On a 9-15, hold 2 Focus. Your spell will always have the Hand and Dangerous tag and its effects lasts for 6 seconds. Spend 1 focus for:

  • Add one extra memorized Word to the Sentence
  • Your spell does +1 damage, +2 if your arcane focus is a staff
  • Your spell effect lasts for 15 more seconds, or 1 minute seconds if your arcane focus is a sphere crystal
  • Take +1 on +INT checks to cast this spell, +2 if your arcane focus is a wand
  • Take +1 to defy danger while channeling this spell if you are not wearing armor or holding shields
  • Remove the Hand or Dangerous tag from your spell’s sentence

While one spell is ongoing, you can’t use another. You can end an ongoing spell whenever you wish.

deck_list.name: Bardic Lore
deck_list.description:
Choose an area of expertise:

  • Spells and Magicks
  • The Dead and Undead
  • Grand Histories of the Known World
  • A Bestiary of Creatures Unusual
  • The Planes of Existence
  • Legends of Heroes and Villains
  • Gods and Their Servants

When you first encounter an important creature, location, or item (your call) covered by your area of expertise, you can ask the GM any one question about it; the GM will answer truthfully. The GM may then ask you what tale, song, or legend you heard that information in.

deck_list.name: Security Magic
deck_list.description:
Tutela:

When you cast this spell, you create a magical shield that protects you from harm. The shield has 10 hit points and lasts for 1 hour or until it is destroyed.

Munire:

When you cast this spell, you create a magical barrier that blocks an entrance. The barrier is 10 feet wide, 10 feet tall, and 1 foot thick. It lasts for 1 hour or until it is destroyed.

Captare:

When you cast this spell, you create a magical trap that captures an intruder. The trap is invisible and can be placed on a door, chest, or other object. When triggered, the trap holds the intruder in place for 1 hour or until they break free.

Intrusus:

When you cast this spell, you sense the presence of an intruder within 100 feet of you. You know the general direction of the intruder but not their exact location.

deck_list.name: Baking Magic
deck_list.description:
Panis:

When you cast this spell, bread dough will rise perfectly every time. You can also use this spell to create bread that is soft and fluffy, or bread that is crusty and chewy.

Farina:

When you cast this spell, you can create the perfect flour for any recipe. You can also use this spell to make gluten-free flour, or flour with a specific texture or flavor.

Pasta:

When you cast this spell, you can make any type of pasta from scratch. You can also use this spell to create pasta with unique shapes and textures.

Calor:

When you cast this spell, you can control the temperature of your oven with your mind. You can also use this spell to create a perfect cooking environment for any recipe.

deck_list.name: Brewing Magic
deck_list.description:
Cervesia:

When you cast this spell, you can create a perfect recipe for any kind of beer or ale. This spell will guide you through the process of selecting the right ingredients, adding them in the correct proportions, and ensuring that the fermentation process is carried out properly.

Fermentare:

When you cast this spell, you can magically ferment any kind of beer or ale. This spell will ensure that the fermentation process is carried out at the right temperature, for the right duration, and with the right yeast.

Aetas:

When you cast this spell, you can age any kind of beer or ale to perfection. This spell will guide you through the process of selecting the right barrel, storing the beer in the right conditions, and monitoring the aging process.

Calor:

When you cast this spell, you can control the temperature of the brewing process. This spell will allow you to heat or cool the wort, mash, or fermenting beer to the desired temperature.

deck_list.name: Cooper Magic
deck_list.description:
This spell book contains magic words related to barrel making. When you speak the magic words, you can create tight seals, control the shape and size of the barrels, and increase the durability of the wood. The magic words are:

  • Tonneus:

    Use this word to create a tight seal on the barrel. The seal will prevent any leaks or spills.

  • Sigillum:

    Use this word to control the shape and size of the barrel. You can make the barrel taller, wider, or narrower as needed.

  • Forma:

    Use this word to shape the barrel. You can create different shapes, such as square or round barrels.

  • Durabilis:

    Use this word to increase the durability of the wood. The wood will become stronger and more resistant to damage.

deck_list.name: Farmhand Magic
deck_list.description:
Labor:

When you cast this spell, your stamina and strength increase by 50% for 1 hour. This can help you perform heavy physical labor without getting tired too quickly.

Robur:

When you cast this spell, your muscles become stronger and more resilient, giving you a +2 bonus to all Strength-related rolls for 1 hour.

Qualitas:

When you cast this spell, the quality of your work improves significantly. You gain a +2 bonus to all Craft-related rolls for 1 hour.

Fatigatio:

When you cast this spell, your fatigue is reduced and you feel more rested. You recover 1d4 hit points and remove one point of fatigue.

deck_list.name: Miller Magic
deck_list.description:
Mola:

When you cast this spell, the millstones within a 10-foot radius will grind with greater efficiency. This results in a higher yield of flour or other milled products.

Farina:

When you cast this spell, the flour produced by the millstones within a 10-foot radius will be of higher quality. This can result in a more flavorful and nutritious end product.

Calor:

When you cast this spell, you can control the temperature of the oven within a 10-foot radius. This can be useful for baking bread or other baked goods that require precise temperature control.

Optimum:

When you cast this spell, the milling process within a 10-foot radius will be optimized for the specific product being milled. This can result in a higher quality end product.

deck_list.name: Illumination Magic
deck_list.description:
Lux:

When you cast this spell, you create a bright light source within a 10-foot radius. The light can be any color you choose and can last for up to an hour.

Tenebrae:

When you cast this spell, you create a shadow within a 10-foot radius. The shadow can be any shape you choose and can last for up to an hour.

Illuminare:

When you cast this spell, you can manipulate the brightness of light sources within a 10-foot radius. For example, you can dim or brighten torches, lanterns, or even the sun.

Illudere:

When you cast this spell, you can create an illusion of light or darkness within a 10-foot radius. For example, you can make it appear as though a bright light is shining from an object, or that a shadow is cast where there is none.

deck_list.name: Thieves Guild
deck_list.description: You have risen through the ranks of the thieves' guild to become a master of their secret language, Thieves' Cant. When you spout lore or discern realities about something related to the criminal underworld, take +1 to your roll. Additionally, when speaking in Thieves' Cant, you are able to communicate covertly with other members of the guild, conveying hidden messages and information that outsiders would not understand.

deck_list.name: Arcane Algebra
deck_list.description:
Requires also Arcane Spellcasting

When you spend time studying your spellbooks you may decide to write down in a spellbook an Astral Word by combining other two words (the word doesn’t need to be a real one, for example combining Animus and Impulso could create the word ‘ Anipulso’ which means ‘Pushing the mind’.) The cost of the spellbook page and for the ink its equal to 100 coins.

deck_list.name: Royal Guard Soldier
deck_list.description:
When you encounter a situation involving military forces or warfare, roll +Intelligence.

  • On a 10+, you have extensive knowledge of the army's organization, tactics, and ranks. The GM will answer any three questions you have about the army or the war effort.
  • On a 7-9, you have some knowledge of the army and its tactics, but the GM will choose one question you ask and answer it truthfully while the other two are left unanswered or shrouded in uncertainty.
  • On a 6-, the GM will provide you with misinformation or false information, or you may attract unwanted attention from the army or its enemies.

deck_list.name: Charming and Open
deck_list.description:
When you speak frankly with someone, you can ask their player a question from the list below. They must answer it truthfully, then they may ask you a question from the list (which you must answer truthfully).

  • Whom do you serve?
  • What do you wish I'd do?
  • How can I get you to ___?
  • What are you really feeling right now?
  • What do you most desire?

deck_list.name: Seer
deck_list.description: When you need to calm someone with your words, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Servant
deck_list.description: When you need to make someone feel powerful, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Dwarf
deck_list.description:
Mountain-Born.

You are acclimated to high altitudes and cold climates. You take no penalties for elevation and are able to keep warm in cold environments without extra gear.

Unyielding.

When you take damage and would be knocked prone, you may instead remain standing and take +1 forward to your next attack.

Stonework.

When you discern realities or spout lore about stonework, take +1 to your roll. When you defy danger in a stonework environment, you may take +1 forward to your roll.

deck_list.name: Elf
deck_list.description:
Keen Senses.

You have advantage on perception checks that rely on sight or hearing.

Elven Grace.

When you defy danger by acting with grace or precision, you may roll +DEX instead of the usual stat.

Fey Ancestry.

You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic cannot put you to sleep.

moves.moves_description: As a human, you are a highly adaptable and versatile creature. When you make a roll using one of your advantages, mark it off. You may only mark each choice once per session. You gain six advantages: +3 to Discern Realities, +3 to Defy Danger, +3 to Hack and Slash, +3 to Spout Lore, +3 to Parley, +3 to Volley, +3 to Defend, +3 to Aid or Interferce

The gods have cursed humanity with a plethora of diseases that affect both body and mind. When you first contract a disease, you may take +1 Forward when attempting to Parley with someone who is also currently suffering from a disease. Your shared experience with illness creates a bond of empathy and understanding.

deck_list.name: In the military
deck_list.description:
Tactical Mind.

You are trained in the art of war and have a keen sense of strategy. When you discern realities or spout lore about a battle or war, you may roll +INT instead of the usual stat.

Cultural Heritage.

You have a rich history and cultural traditions that have been passed down through generations. When you parley with someone from your culture, you may roll +INT instead of the usual stat.

deck_list.name: No pain no gain
deck_list.description: You have endured many hardships and have developed a strong will to survive. When you defy danger (WIS), you get +3 to the roll.

deck_list.name: Personal Code
deck_list.description: You value your honor and reputation above all else. When you parley with someone while defending your honor or reputation, you may roll +STR instead of the usual stat.

deck_list.name: Halfling
deck_list.description:
Lucky.

When you roll a 1-8 on a move, you may reroll one of the dice once (but you must keep the new result).

Brave.

You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

Nimble.

You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

deck_list.name: A Port in the Storm
deck_list.description:
When you return to a civilized settlement you've visited before, tell the GM when you were last here. They'll tell you how it's changed since then.

When you first visit a civilized settlement, someone who respects the custom of hospitality to minstrels will take you in as their guest.

deck_list.name: Duelists Parry
deck_list.description:
When you hack and slash with a rapier, dagger, or other precise blade, you can choose to deal your damage or roll+Dex. On a 16-19 choose two. On a 7–9 choose one.

  • You avoid their attack, you don't have to roll for damage
  • You deal your damage+1d4
  • You create an advantage, +1 forward to you or an ally acting on it
  • You impress, dismay, or frighten your enemy

deck_list.name: Gnome
deck_list.description:
Clever.

When you spout lore or discern realities about something related to magic, technology, or nature, take +1 to your roll.

Tinker.

You can create small devices or gadgets that have minor magical or mechanical effects. You need access to tools and materials, and it takes some time and a roll to determine the quality and duration of your creation.

Small Stature.

You have disadvantage on strength checks and saving throws that involve brute force or size. You have advantage on stealth checks and saving throws that involve hiding or escaping.

deck_list.name: Tiefling
deck_list.description:
Infernal Legacy.

You know the prestidigitation cantrip. When you reach level 2, you can cast hellish rebuke once per day as a level 1 spell. When you reach level 4, you can cast darkness once per day as a level 2 spell. Your spellcasting ability is CHA for these spells.

Fiendish Resistance.

You have resistance to fire damage.

Dark Reputation.

You have disadvantage on charisma checks when dealing with people who are prejudiced or fearful of your fiendish heritage. You have advantage on intimidation checks when you reveal your true nature or make a threat.

deck_list.name: Samurai Warrior
deck_list.description:
Bushido Code.

You live by the strict code of the samurai, which emphasizes honor, loyalty, and bravery. You gain +1 to damage when attacking an opponent in single combat, and +1 to AC when defending against multiple foes.

Katana Mastery.

You are trained in the use of the katana, a deadly and elegant sword. You gain +1 to hack and slash rolls when wielding a katana.

Seppuku.

If you fail a roll and suffer a catastrophic failure, you may choose to perform seppuku (ritual suicide) instead. Your character dies, but the rest of the party gains a +1 forward.

deck_list.name: Viking Warrior
deck_list.description:
Berserker Rage.

When you enter a frenzied rage, you gain +1 to damage and +1 to hack and slash rolls. You also take +1 damage from all sources.

deck_list.name: Tribal Dance Warrior
deck_list.description: You can perform a Tribal Dange before battle to intimidate your enemies and bolster your allies. Roll+CHA to inspire your allies or frighten your foes.

deck_list.name: Savy businessman
deck_list.description: When you spout lore about the economy or business, roll +WIS instead of +INT.

deck_list.name: Flamenco Dancer
deck_list.description:
Flamenco Dance.

When you perform the flamenco dance, you and your allies gain +1 forward to parley or to any roll that involves persuasion or intimidation.

Hot-blooded.

When you attack an enemy, you may choose to deal extra damage but also expose yourself to their attack.

deck_list.name: Master of Improvisation
deck_list.description: When you use a piece of equipment or an object in a creative or unexpected way, you may roll +CAR instead of the usual stat.

deck_list.name: Metropolitan
deck_list.description:
Artistic Sensibility.

When you Discern Realities to study a work of art, you may ask one additional question about it.

Haute Cuisine.

You gain +1 ongoing when you Spout Lore about food or cooking.

deck_list.name: Stoic
deck_list.description:
Fearless.

You have +1 ongoing to defy danger or hack and slash when you are facing a powerful or intimidating foe.

Iron Will.

When you face mental or emotional stress, you may choose to endure it and gain +1 forward to your next action, but also mark experience if you fail.

deck_list.name: Clock-like Minded
deck_list.description:
Engineering Mindset.

When you Spout Lore about engineering or mechanics, you get +1.

Disciplined Training.

You have advantage on saving throws against being dazed or stunned.

deck_list.name: Alchemical Expertise
deck_list.description:
You are an alchemist, trained in the art of transmutation and the creation of magical potions. You start knowing the recipe for two of these potions:

  • Health Poison: Ingested or applied. The target regains 2d6 HP. (Cost: 30 to make)
  • Magic Potion: Ingested or inhaled. The target regains 1 MP but loses 1d6 HP. (Cost: 60)
    • . You can learn how to make other potions by finding new ingredients.

deck_list.name: Eye for Value
deck_list.description: You’ve got an eye for wealth and value. You can always tell if something is fake, and when you Discern Realities, you can always ask “What did I found and I’m holding in my hand that is useful or valuable for me?” in addition to your other questions. You always find something valuable, either hidden somewhere or by pickpocketing someone.

deck_list.name: Traveller
deck_list.description:
Nomadic.

You have advantage on discern realities or spout lore rolls that relate to survival or travel. You can easily navigate terrain and find food and water in arid environments. You also have disadvantage on charisma checks when dealing with settled folk who are not used to your ways.

deck_list.name: Catholic
deck_list.description:
Devout.

You have a deep connection to the divine and a strong sense of faith. When you perform a religious ceremony or ritual, take +1 to your roll.

Blessed by the Church.

You have the support and protection of the Roman Catholic Church. You can call upon the Church\'s resources to aid you in your quests or missions. However, you may also be called upon to perform tasks or missions for the Church.

Holy Sites.

You are familiar with the many holy sites and relics of Rome, and you know how to use them to your advantage. When you are in Rome or dealing with matters related to the Church, take +1 to your roll.

deck_list.name: Archeologist
deck_list.description:
Ancient History.

When you spout lore or discern realities about ancient magical artifacts or items, take +1 to your roll.

Ancient Artifacts.

You have a talent for identifying and understanding the magical properties of ancient artifacts and items. When you examine an ancient artifact or item, roll+Int. On a 16-19 you gain a useful insight into its powers and properties, on a 9-15 you gain some insight but also attract unwanted attention, and on a 1-8 the GM will tell you a hard truth about it.

deck_list.name: Diplomatic
deck_list.description: You gain +1 forward when you attempt to mediate a conflict or negotiate a treaty between different factions or people.

deck_list.name: Farm Boy
deck_list.description:
Skilled Farmers.

You have expertise in raising animals and growing crops. You can identify the best quality livestock and crops, and you can care for them to ensure they remain healthy and productive. You gain +1 forward when you act on information you have learned about animals or crops.

Livestock Trade.

You have connections in the livestock industry, and you can trade in high-quality meats. When you try to sell livestock, you gain +1 forward to your roll. You also have advantage on saving throws against attempts to steal your livestock.

deck_list.name: Chef
deck_list.description: You have a deep knowledge of the culinary traditions and can prepare delicious and nourishing meals from even the most meager of ingredients. When you make a campfire meal, take +3 to the roll.

deck_list.name: Weaver
deck_list.description:
Textile Industry.

You have extensive knowledge of the textile industry of Lucca and can identify the quality and properties of any fabric or clothing. When you spout lore or discern realities about textiles or clothing, take +1 to your roll.

deck_list.name: Mystical Mind
deck_list.description:
Mystical Artistry.

You are a master of the mystical arts, and your artistry reflects this. When you spout lore or discern realities about mystical or magical subjects, take +1 to your roll.

deck_list.name: Fruit Farmer
deck_list.description:
Fruitful Harvest.

You are a skilled farmer and have learned to cultivate delicious and nutritious fruits and vegetables. When you gather food in the wild, you always find enough for yourself and one other person, and it is always delicious and nutritious.

deck_list.name: Dragon Hunter
deck_list.description: You have been trained in the art of dragon hunting by the Milanesi Dragonslayers. When you face a dragon in combat, take +1 forward to your attack rolls and +1 to your damage rolls.

deck_list.name: Fashionable
deck_list.description:
Fashionable Gear.

You have access to the finest fabrics and the most skilled tailors in Milan. Your armor and weapons are always stylish and fashionable, giving you +1 forward to any move that involves impressing someone with your appearance.

deck_list.name: Les bonnes manieres
deck_list.description:
Elegance and Refinement.

You have learned to embody the elegance and refinement of the Parisian lifestyle. When you interact with nobility or high society, take +1 to your Charisma-based rolls.

deck_list.name: Spice Master
deck_list.description: You have a knack for finding and identifying exotic spices from all corners of the world. When you use spices in cooking or alchemy, take +3 to your roll.

deck_list.name: Sky Knight
deck_list.description: You have trained extensively with a certain flying mount. When you ride on the back of a flying creature, you take +3 ongoing to your rolls to spot, chase, or outmaneuver enemies and take +3 to your Defy Danger rolls made to avoid attacks and obstacles.

deck_list.name: Earth Knight
deck_list.description: You have been trained in the art of riding beasts on the land. When mounted, you take +3 ongoing to your rolls to spot, chase, or outmaneuver enemies and take +3 to your Defy Danger rolls made to avoid attacks and obstacles.

deck_list.name: Sea Knight
deck_list.description: You have been trained in the art of riding beasts on the water. When mounted, you take +3 ongoing to your rolls to spot, chase, or outmaneuver enemies and take +3 to your Defy Danger rolls made to avoid attacks and obstacles.

deck_list.name: Wine Expert
deck_list.description:
Wine Connoisseur.

You are an expert in the art of wine-making and have an extensive knowledge of the vintages produced all over the world. When you share a bottle of wine with someone, take +1 to your Parley roll.

deck_list.name: Rune scribe
deck_list.description:
Artisan.

You are skilled in the creation of magical artifacts. When you Craft a magical item, take +1 to your roll.

deck_list.name: Singer
deck_list.description:
Musical Talent.

You are known for your soothing and melodic voice, which is often sought after for singing or public speaking. When you Aid or interfere with someone using your voice, take +1 to your roll.

Opera Performance.

You are skilled in the art of opera performance. When you Perform an opera piece, take +1 to your roll.

deck_list.name: Stalker
deck_list.description: You are skilled at remaining unnoticed and blending into your surroundings. When you defy danger or parley while using stealth or camouflage, take +1 to your roll.

deck_list.name: Perfumer
deck_list.description:
Natural Perfumer.

You have a deep knowledge of plants and their fragrances, allowing you to create potent perfumes and natural remedies. When you use a perfume, you take +1 to your Defy Danger roll against being detected by smell.

deck_list.name: I know someone
deck_list.description: You have connections to the black market trade in illegal magical substances and underground fight clubs. When you Spout Lore about the black market or fight clubs, take +5 to your roll.

deck_list.name: I know where
deck_list.description: You have connections with the underworld and are skilled at smuggling goods across borders. When you Spout Lore about the location of a hidden stash or a secret smuggling route, take +5 to your roll.

deck_list.name: Canoa sailor
deck_list.description: You are skilled in the art of building canoes.  When you travel by water in your canoe, take +5 to any Defy Danger roll.

deck_list.name: Treasure Diver
deck_list.description:
Pearl Diver.

You are skilled in the art of diving for pearls and other valuable treasures. When you Defy Danger to navigate treacherous underwater environments, take +5 to your roll.

deck_list.name: Stiff Upper Lip
deck_list.description: You have a cool head under pressure. When you take damage, you may ignore the effects of the damage roll on a roll of 16-19 on a d20.

deck_list.name: Mysterious
deck_list.description: When you attempt to hide your true intentions or motives, you may roll +COS to do so.

deck_list.name: Climber
deck_list.description:
Alpinist.

You have advantage on rolls to climb or traverse mountainous terrain.

deck_list.name: Hot-headed
deck_list.description:
Ferocious Charge

When you charge into battle, you can choose to deal extra damage equal to your level, but suffer a -1 ongoing penalty to your damage rolls until you take a moment to catch your breath.

deck_list.name: Fishing
deck_list.description:
Skilled Fishers and Divers

You are skilled in the arts of fishing and diving, and can hold your own in any underwater environment. You have +1 ongoing to any move that involves fishing or diving.

deck_list.name: Magical Tatoos
deck_list.description: You have intricate tattoos on your body that glow when you use magic or you become strongly emotional

deck_list.name: Ironclad
deck_list.description: Armour and shields you wear or bear do not count against your Load (they weigh nothing). When you spend some time (about half an hour) to repair, maintain, and reinforce your armour, take +2 armour Forward.

deck_list.name: Merciless
deck_list.description: When you fight to kill and hold nothing back, your attacks are Brutal (you roll damage twice and take the best results) and you take +2 damage Forward.

deck_list.name: Save my Family
deck_list.description: Your family is in danger and you must rescue them. To complete this destiny, you must face the villain who threatens them and defeat them. Once you have saved your family, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, you can make everyone in the party gain 1 XP point each session by taking actions that protect or aid your family.

deck_list.name: Become a Hero
deck_list.description: You dream of becoming a hero and being admired by all. To complete this destiny, you must perform a heroic act that will earn you the respect and admiration of others. Once you have achieved this, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, you can make everyone in the party gain 1 XP point each session by taking actions that demonstrate your heroic nature or inspire others.

deck_list.name: Learn from Your Mistakes
deck_list.description: You have made mistakes in the past and are determined to learn from them. To complete this destiny, you must reflect on your past actions and use that insight to make better choices in the future. Once you have demonstrated this growth, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, you can make everyone in the party gain 1 XP point each session by reflecting on your actions and actively working to avoid repeating past mistakes.

deck_list.name: Learn About the World
deck_list.description: You are curious about the world and seek to learn all you can about it. To complete this destiny, you must discover a new fact or piece of knowledge that broadens your understanding of the world. Once you have done this, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, you can make everyone in the party gain 1 XP point each session by actively seeking out new information and asking questions to learn more about the world.

deck_list.name: Champion of the People
deck_list.description: You have always had a deep desire to help those in need, and you long to become a true champion of the people. To complete this destiny, you must perform a heroic act that inspires others and makes a positive impact on the world. Once you have done this, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, you can make everyone in the party gain 1 XP point each session by actively seeking out opportunities to help those in need and by taking actions that make the world a better place.

deck_list.name: Master of the Craft
deck_list.description: You are a true master of your craft, and you long to achieve the highest level of skill and expertise in your chosen field. To complete this destiny, you must create a masterpiece that showcases your skill and talent. Once you have done this, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, you can make everyone in the party gain 1 XP point each session by actively practicing your craft and by taking on new challenges that push your skills to the limit.

deck_list.name: Fated Savior
deck_list.description: You have been chosen by destiny to become the savior of a people or civilization. To complete this destiny, you must defeat a great evil or overcome a seemingly insurmountable obstacle. Once you have done this, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, you can make everyone in the party gain 1 XP point each session by actively seeking out information about your enemy and by making alliances with those who share your cause.

deck_list.name: Cursed Seeker
deck_list.description: You have been cursed by fate, and you must seek a way to break the curse before it destroys you. To complete this destiny, you must uncover the source of your curse and find a way to lift it. Once you have done this, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, you can make everyone in the party gain 1 XP point each session by actively searching for clues about your curse and by taking actions that bring you closer to breaking it.

deck_list.name: Ambitious Usurper
deck_list.description: You have always dreamed of power and glory, and you will stop at nothing to achieve it. To complete this destiny, you must overthrow a powerful ruler or conquer a land that is not rightfully yours. Once you have done this, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, you can make everyone in the party gain 1 XP point each session by actively seeking out opportunities to gain more power and by taking actions that further your ambitions.

deck_list.name: Eternal Wanderer
deck_list.description: You have always felt a deep longing to explore the world and discover its secrets, and you cannot imagine settling down in one place for too long. To complete this destiny, you must travel to a new and exciting location and uncover a hidden secret or treasure. Once you have done this, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, you can make everyone in the party gain 1 XP point each session by actively seeking out new places to explore and by taking risks that lead you to uncharted territory.

deck_list.name: Party Bonding
deck_list.description: You and your party have been through a lot together and you want to strengthen your bond. To complete this destiny, you must spend time bonding with your party members and doing something that brings you closer together. Once you have done this, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, you can make everyone in the party gain 1 XP point each session by taking actions that support your party members or by participating in activities that build camaraderie.

deck_list.name: Cool Action
deck_list.description: You are always looking for an opportunity to show off your skills and impress others. To complete this destiny, you must perform a cool action that leaves everyone in awe. Once you have done this, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, you can make everyone in the party gain 1 XP point each session by attempting to perform impressive feats or by using your skills in creative and unexpected ways.

deck_list.name: I Found a Friend
deck_list.description: You have been feeling lonely and isolated, but you long to connect with others. To complete this destiny, you must make a friend or ally who shares your values and interests. Once you have done this, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, you can make everyone in the party gain 1 XP point each session by actively seeking out opportunities to meet new people and by building relationships with those around you.

deck_list.name: Revenge Seeker
deck_list.description: You have a powerful enemy who has wronged you, and you will not rest until you have exacted revenge. To complete this destiny, you must confront your enemy and defeat them. Once you have done this, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, you can make everyone in the party gain 1 XP point each session by taking actions that further your goal of revenge, such as gathering information about your enemy or plotting their downfall.

deck_list.name: Lost Heir
deck_list.description: You are the last surviving member of a noble house that has been overthrown, and you seek to reclaim your birthright. To complete this destiny, you must rally allies to your cause, defeat those who stand in your way, and reclaim your rightful place as ruler. Once you have done this, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, you can make everyone in the party gain 1 XP point each session by taking actions that further your goal of reclaiming your birthright, such as searching for allies or plotting your next move.

deck_list.name: Haunted Survivor
deck_list.description: You have survived a traumatic event that has left you scarred, and you seek to overcome your past and find redemption. To complete this destiny, you must confront the demons that haunt you and find a way to move on. Once you have done this, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, you can make everyone in the party gain 1 XP point each session by taking actions that further your goal of overcoming your past, such as seeking therapy or confronting those who have wronged you.

deck_list.name: Legacy Keeper
deck_list.description: Your family has a long and storied history, and you seek to carry on their legacy. To complete this destiny, you must uncover and preserve artifacts, stories, and knowledge of your family's history. Once you have done this, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, you can make everyone in the party gain 1 XP point each session by taking actions that further your goal of preserving your family's legacy, such as researching your family's history or recovering lost artifacts.

deck_list.name: Wanderer
deck_list.description: You are a wanderer who seeks adventure and new experiences. To complete this destiny, you must travel to new lands, meet new people, and have new experiences. Once you have done this, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, you can make everyone in the party gain 1 XP point each session by taking actions that further your goal of experiencing new things, such as seeking out new cultures or trying new foods.

deck_list.name: Where is Love?
deck_list.description: You have been searching for love, but have yet to find it. To complete this destiny, you must find a romantic partner who you care deeply for. Once you have done this, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, you can make everyone in the party gain 1 XP point each session by actively pursuing romantic interests or by taking actions that bring you closer to finding love.

deck_list.name: Redeem Yourself
deck_list.description: You have made mistakes in the past and are now seeking redemption. To complete this destiny, you must right a wrong or make amends for a past misdeed. Once you have done this, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, you can make everyone in the party gain 1 XP point each session by taking actions that demonstrate your commitment to making amends or seeking forgiveness.

deck_list.name: Walk it Off
deck_list.description: You restore debilities at a rate of three days, even without extensive rest or medical care.

deck_list.name: Superior Warrior
deck_list.description: When you Hack and Slash or Volley, on a 20+, you may choose to also impress, dismay, or frighten your enemies.

deck_list.name: Whistler Knight
deck_list.description: The Whistling Cavalry is a special army unit made up of skilled riders and archers who use their musical abilities to command and control their mounts in battle. When you fight from horseback, you can use your musical abilities to give orders to your mount. Your mount will obey your commands to the best of its ability, and you can use it to make attacks or move around the battlefield.

deck_list.name: Sense of Unease
deck_list.description: Whenever the bizarre and magical powers wielded by supernatural entities cause you to Defy Danger, treat any result of a 1-8 as a 9-15.

deck_list.name: Weapon Soul Bounding
deck_list.description:
When you take this move and spend some uninterrupted time meditating with your Signature Weapon, choose a special power from the list below. Your weapon gains this power as long as it is held by you.

  • Bane: It kills ________ (a specific type of creature; your choice) with but a single wound.
  • Divine: It is blessed by the gods, and is immediately recognisable as such.
  • Returning: It always returns to your hand.
  • Clearcutting: It cuts through wood and stone like butter.
  • Vorpal: It ignores armour and causes profuse bleeding.

deck_list.name: Gatherer
deck_list.description: You are an expert in identifying and collecting rare herbs and plants that can be used for medicinal or magical purposes. You have a +2 bonus to Discern Realities rolls when looking for herbs or plants, and you can always find food and water for yourself and your companions, even in the most barren and desolate of places.

deck_list.name: Workaholic
deck_list.description:
Rare Work Ethic

You are known for your rare work ethic and your attention to detail. When you spend time working on a project, you may choose to take +3 ongoing to any rolls you make related to that project. However, you must also choose one of the following:

  • You work yourself to exhaustion, take -1 ongoing to all rolls until you rest
  • You neglect other duties or responsibilities, and may incur the wrath of someone who was counting on you

deck_list.name: Inventor
deck_list.description:
• Inventor: When you have time and materials to work with, you can invent a new device or gadget. Describe the device you want to create, and then roll+Int. On a 16-19 choose 2, on a 9-15 choose 1:
    • The device works as intended
    • The device is reliable and won\'t break down easily
    • The device has additional features beyond its intended purpose
    • The device is safe to use
    On a miss, the device has significant flaws or dangers that the GM will describe to you.

deck_list.name: Frogman
deck_list.description:
Swimming Expert:

You are a natural swimmer. When you Defy Danger while swimming, take +1.

Sticky Tongue:

Your tongue is incredibly sticky. You can use it to pull yourself towards an object, or to snatch an object from a distance.

Amphibious:

You can breathe both air and water, and you are immune to drowning.

deck_list.name: Natural Magic
deck_list.description:
Magic is as natural as breath to you. Whenever you channel a spell, you can treat your open hand as if it was a wand or both of your open hands as if they were an arcane staff. Also, silver is anathema to you: it burns your skin. You also gain these bonds:

  • I will teach my magical secrets to someone worthy of them
  • I seek to learn the true nature of magic, no matter the cost

deck_list.name: Muleskinner
deck_list.description: When you need to protect someone weaker, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Noble
deck_list.description: When you make someone feel less important than you, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Outlaw
deck_list.description: When you speak with another outlaw, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Physicians Student
deck_list.description: When you treat the human body, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Pilot
deck_list.description: When you drive a vehicle, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Pit Fighter
deck_list.description: When you fight in an enclosed area with a crows, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Scribe
deck_list.description: When you need to study or write a scroll or book, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Prospector
deck_list.description: When you need potential where might be none, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Protagonist
deck_list.description: When you need to move the plot forward, you take +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Raconteur
deck_list.description: When you tell a moving story, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Rat Catcher
deck_list.description: When you catch a verming that bothers others, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Roadwarden
deck_list.description: When you watch out for unexpected dangers, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Runner
deck_list.description: When you need to run for you life, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Rustler
deck_list.description: When you need to make a beast do something against its will, get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Outrider
deck_list.description: When you ride a beast in a dangerous situation, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Pedlar
deck_list.description: When you want to sell something that isn't valuable, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Pharmacist
deck_list.description: When you need to somministrate someone a drug, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Pact with the Otherworld
deck_list.description:
Your great power came with a price. You serve an otherworldly entity. When you Make Camp, you can commune with your patron and replace one of the words that you know with a random one. Also, when you want to achieve a powerful ritual, you can replace one of the requirements with “You have to sacrifice a certain creature”. You also gain these bonds:

  • I fear my patron, but I cannot resist their power
  • I will do whatever it takes to please my patron, even if it means betraying my allies

deck_list.name: Wizardry Training
deck_list.description:
When you have what you need, you can produce arcane raw chemicals and reagents, like lead dust or eye of newt. When you Cast a Spell, choose one:

  • Expend 1 use of Adventurer’s Gear to add +1 to your roll
  • Expend 1 use of Adventurer’s Gear to choose a different option from your spellcasting list

deck_list.name: Lizardfolk
deck_list.description:
Camouflage

When you stay still in a natural environment, you blend in with your surroundings and become nearly invisible.

Quick Reflexes:

You have lightning-fast reflexes. When you act under fire, take +1 ongoing.

Predator's Instinct:

You have an innate sense of your prey\'s movements. When you track a creature through the wilderness, take +3 ongoing to discern realities about it.

deck_list.name: Mercurial Blood
deck_list.description:
Requires also Arcane Spellcasting

When you Channel a spell, you no longer need to drink a dose of Quicksilver. You have made a ritual and now your blood has been replaced by quicksilver.

deck_list.name: Master Channeler
deck_list.description:
Requires also Arcane Spellcasting

When you successfully channel a spell, you can choose to keep channeling to make it even stronger. Roll CON again as if you channeled the spell for the first time. You can repeat this process as many times as you want. On a 1-8 choose one for each extra time you channeled the spell: You draw unwelcome attention from a chaos being or put yourself in a spot. You take 1d6 damage. The spell also creates an unintended side effect. Gain a debility to an ability score You take 1d6 damage.

deck_list.name: Sanctum
deck_list.description: When you have time, arcane materials, and a safe space, you can create your own place of power for the Ritual move. Describe to the GM what kind of power it is and how you’re binding it to this place. In return, the GM will tell you one kind of creature that will have an interest in your workings.

deck_list.name: Quick Study
deck_list.description: When you see the effects of an arcane spell, you can ask the GM the name of the spell and its effects. You take +3 Forward to act on the answers.

deck_list.name: Lurker
deck_list.description: You know just how to move quickly and quietly through the black and the gloom. When you stand in shadows or darkness without talking or moving, NPCs will never see you as long as they haven’t already spotted you. If you’re more than a few feet away from them, they won’t see you even if you move or attack, and even if they know you’re there.

deck_list.name: Scoundrel
deck_list.description: You have a way with words, a trustworthy face, a suave demeanor. When you tell a lie or half-truth, it will be accepted as fact by anyone who doesn’t know any better. As long as no one reveals hard evidence to the contrary, anything you say will be accepted as open honesty.

deck_list.name: Walker
deck_list.description: You can climb along solid walls and ceilings as quickly as you can walk or run, regardless of their texture or composition, as long as they could support your weight. When you are climbing, you only have one hand free to take actions with; you may carry one person with you, but you can’t use your hands at all while you have a passenger.

deck_list.name: Mercurial
deck_list.description: You’re forgettable, inscrutable, or maybe just generic; you don’t mind. Whenever you want, you can change any or all of your looks. Those who know you can still recognise you, but only if they look closely.

deck_list.name: Repeating Arrows
deck_list.description: When you say a message while holding the arrow-head close to your mouth, after you shoot the arrow with a bow the arrow will start repeating your message at the same volume and tone you used with your voice. The message repeats until the arrow lands or is destroyed. Common.

deck_list.name: Feathers of BirdShape
deck_list.description: When put in the mouth, these feathers allow the user to take the shape of a small bird for 12 hours. The transformation is not instant and takes about a minute to complete, during which the user will feel a tingling sensation throughout their body. The user retains their own intelligence and memories but gains the physical attributes and abilities of the bird form, including the ability to fly. Common.

deck_list.name: Venatio Magic
deck_list.description:
Insequor:

When you cast this spell, your senses become heightened, allowing you to track your prey with ease. You can see, hear, and smell things that would normally be imperceptible, such as a faint trail or the sound of rustling leaves.

Infectus:

When you cast this spell, your weapon becomes infused with magic, making it more effective against your prey. Your attacks will be more accurate, deal more damage, and may even have special effects, such as poison or fire damage.

Retinere:

When you cast this spell, your prey will be unable to escape your grasp. Whether it's a fleeing animal or a running opponent, they will be slowed down or even stopped in their tracks, allowing you to catch up to them.

Incarcerare:

When you cast this spell, your prey will be magically restrained, preventing them from escaping or attacking you. This can be useful for capturing animals alive or immobilizing dangerous beasts.

deck_list.name: Transportation Magic
deck_list.description:
Moveri:

When you cast this spell, you can move an object up to 10 feet away from you in any direction. The object must weigh no more than 50 pounds.

Levitare:

When you cast this spell, you can make an object float in mid-air. The object must weigh no more than 25 pounds.

Teleportare:

When you cast this spell, you can instantly transport yourself to a location you can see within 30 feet. You cannot teleport through solid objects or barriers.

Porta:

When you cast this spell, you can create a portal to another location. The portal must be within 30 feet of you and you must be able to see the location. You can only use this spell once per day.

deck_list.name: Weather Magic
deck_list.description:
Tempestas:

When you cast this spell, you can control the wind and lightning within a 10-foot radius. You can create gusts of wind, direct lightning strikes, or even summon a tornado.

Pluvia:

When you cast this spell, you can control precipitation within a 10-foot radius. You can create rain, hail, or snow, or even stop existing precipitation.

Calor:

When you cast this spell, you can control temperature within a 10-foot radius. You can create heat waves or cold snaps, or even change the temperature of specific objects or areas.

Frigus:

When you cast this spell, you can create frost and ice within a 10-foot radius. You can freeze objects or areas, or even create ice constructs.

deck_list.name: Navigation Magic
deck_list.description:
Navigatio:

When you cast this spell, you can navigate any terrain as if you were familiar with it. You can accurately determine your location, direction, and distance traveled. You also gain a +1 forward when Defying Danger to navigate or find your way through unfamiliar territory.

Charta:

When you cast this spell, you can create a map of the surrounding area. The map is detailed and accurate, including landmarks, roads, and other features. You can also use this spell to add notes and annotations to the map.

Temporis:

When you cast this spell, you can predict the weather for the next 24 hours. You know the temperature, wind direction and speed, and any precipitation that will occur. You also gain a +1 forward when Defying Danger to travel or operate in adverse weather conditions.

Explorare:

When you cast this spell, you gain the ability to sense nearby landmarks, resources, or points of interest. You can also ask the GM one question about the area, and they will answer truthfully.

deck_list.name: Cooking Magic
deck_list.description:
Coquere:

When you cast this spell, ingredients within a 10-foot radius will chop themselves into small pieces. This spell works on fruits, vegetables, meat, and other food items.

Cibum:

When you cast this spell, you can create a delicious meal out of any ingredients within a 10-foot radius. The meal will be perfectly cooked and seasoned to your liking.

Recens:

When you cast this spell, food items within a 10-foot radius will stay fresh for longer than usual. This spell is especially useful for preserving leftovers and preventing food waste.

Mancare:

When you cast this spell, you can make any food item within a 10-foot radius taste exactly as you want it to. This spell is especially useful for making bland or unappetizing food more enjoyable.

deck_list.name: Gardening Magic
deck_list.description:
Crescere:

When you cast this spell, plants within a 10-foot radius will grow at an accelerated rate. This can be used to create beautiful gardens, speed up the growth of crops, or even make a tree grow in a specific shape.

Hortus:

When you cast this spell, you can control the behavior of plants within a 10-foot radius. You can use this to command plants to move, entangle enemies, or even create a shield of thorns.

Temporis:

When you cast this spell, you can control the weather within a 10-foot radius. This can be used to create rain to water plants, create a fog to obscure vision, or even call down lightning to strike enemies.

Clima:

When you cast this spell, you can change the temperature within a 10-foot radius. This can be used to create a cool breeze on a hot day, warm up a cold room, or even cause a sudden frost to freeze enemies.

deck_list.name: Repairing Magic
deck_list.description:
Reparare:

When you cast this spell, broken objects within a 10-foot radius are magically repaired. The object is restored to its original state as if it had never been damaged. This spell can be used on objects made of any material, including metal, wood, and fabric.

Objectum:

When you cast this spell, you can create a new object from an old one. The original object is consumed in the process, and the new object takes on a similar form and function. This spell can be used to create objects made of any material, including metal, wood, and fabric.

Novus:

When you cast this spell, you can create a new object from scratch. The new object takes on a form and function of your choosing, but it must be made of materials that are available in the environment. This spell can be used to create objects made of any material, including metal, wood, and fabric.

Vetus:

When you cast this spell, you can transform an old object into a new one. The original object is consumed in the process, and the new object takes on a similar form and function. This spell can be used to transform objects made of any material, including metal, wood, and fabric.

deck_list.name: Entertainment Magic
deck_list.description:
Ludus:

When you cast this spell, you can create a variety of games and toys. These games can range from simple puzzles to complex board games.

Risus:

When you cast this spell, you can create illusions and jokes. These illusions can range from harmless pranks to elaborate hoaxes.

Musica:

When you cast this spell, you can create musical instruments and melodies. These instruments can range from simple flutes to complex orchestras.

Illusio:

When you cast this spell, you can create illusions of objects and people. These illusions can range from simple mirages to lifelike replicas.

moves.moves_description: When you Hack and Slash, you get an additional option: If the enemy wearing chain armor with your battleaxe, your attack has 2 piercing.

deck_list.name: Worm of Revivification
deck_list.description: The Worm of Revivification is a small, wriggling creature that can bring the dead back to life as zombies. To use it, simply place the worm in the ears of a fresh corpse and wait for it to work its magic. However, be warned - the zombie it creates will be mindless and uncontrollable, and the worm will eventually devour the victim's brain completely. Use with caution. Uncommon.

deck_list.name: Personal Care Magic
deck_list.description:
Pulchritudo:

When you cast this spell, you can enhance your natural beauty. Your hair, skin, and nails will look radiant and perfect. This spell will also give you a boost of confidence and self-esteem.

Cutis:

When you cast this spell, you can heal any skin condition, such as acne, dryness, or wrinkles. Your skin will become soft, smooth, and glowing.

Unghia:

When you cast this spell, you can strengthen and grow your nails. Your nails will become healthy, strong, and beautiful.

Pectus:

When you cast this spell, you can enhance your chest area. Your breasts will become larger, firmer, and more attractive. This spell can also boost your sexual appeal and charm.

deck_list.name: Protection Magic
deck_list.description:
Protegere:

When you cast this spell, a magical shield forms around you, providing protection against physical and magical attacks.

Malum:

When you cast this spell, evil spirits within a 10-foot radius are banished or repelled.

Spiritus:

When you cast this spell, you can detect the presence and location of spirits within a 10-foot radius.

Periculum:

When you cast this spell, you are warned of any impending danger within a 10-foot radius.

deck_list.name: Communication Magic
deck_list.description:
Lingua:

When you cast this spell, you can understand and speak any language fluently for 1 hour.

Intelligere:

When you cast this spell, you can understand any spoken language for 1 hour, even if you do not speak it.

Loqui:

When you cast this spell, you can speak any language fluently for 1 hour, even if you do not know the language.

Mittere:

When you cast this spell, you can send a message to a specific person over any distance. The message can be up to 25 words long and will be delivered instantly.

deck_list.name: Enchantment Magic
deck_list.description:
Objetum:

When you cast this spell, you can imbue an object with magical properties. The object will gain magical powers, such as the ability to emit light, the power to repel evil spirits, or the ability to fly.

Magia:

When you cast this spell, you can create magical effects. For example, you can create a wall of fire, a shield that repels arrows, or a cloud of darkness that blinds your enemies.

Imbuere:

When you cast this spell, you can imbue an object with specific properties. For example, you can imbue a sword with the power to slay dragons, a cloak with the power of invisibility, or a ring with the power to summon elementals.

Creare:

When you cast this spell, you can create magical items. For example, you can create a magic wand, a potion of healing, or a talisman of protection.

deck_list.name: Healing Magic  The Medicine of Magic by Professor Elvira Healer
deck_list.description:
Sanare:

When you cast this spell, wounds are healed and closed. The target creature regains a number of hit points equal to your level.

Vita:

When you cast this spell, you cure a disease or neutralize a poison affecting the target creature. If the spell removes a curse, it has a 100% chance of success.

Curare:

When you cast this spell, you cure a target creature of one of the following conditions: blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned.

Restituere:

When you cast this spell, you restore a target creature's vitality. The target creature regains a number of hit points equal to your level, plus an additional 1d4 hit points.
deck_list.header_image: Healing Magic  The Medicine of Magic by Professor Elvira Healer.png

deck_list.name: Commerce Magic
deck_list.description:
Mercator:

When you cast this spell, you can find potential customers within a 5-mile radius. The spell will reveal their location, name, and some basic information about their interests and needs.

Pretium:

When you cast this spell, you can negotiate prices more effectively. The spell will give you a +1 bonus to your next Charisma roll related to bargaining or haggling.

Emere:

When you cast this spell, you can create a deal that is favorable to you. The spell will give you a +1 bonus to your next Intelligence roll related to crafting, buying, or selling items.

Vindicare:

When you cast this spell, you can protect your business from competitors or thieves. The spell will create an invisible shield around your store or office that will repel any unauthorized access or theft attempts.

deck_list.name: Metamorphosis Magic
deck_list.description:
Mutationem:

When you cast this spell, you can change your body shape and appearance to any other form you choose. You retain your own mind and memories, but your physical abilities may be altered depending on your new form. The transformation lasts until you choose to change back, or until the spell is dispelled.

Figura:

When you cast this spell, you can alter your body shape and size, but not your appearance. You can become taller, shorter, thinner, or thicker, but you still look like yourself. The transformation lasts for one hour.

Transformare:

When you cast this spell, you can change your appearance, but not your body shape or size. You can make yourself look like someone else, or give yourself a specific appearance, such as a disguise. The transformation lasts for one hour.

Mutare:

When you cast this spell, you can transform an object into something else. The new object must be of a similar size and shape to the original, and you must have a clear idea of what you want it to become. The transformation is permanent, unless the spell is dispelled.

deck_list.name: Forensic Magic
deck_list.description:
Investigatio:

When you cast this spell, you gain enhanced senses to detect evidence or hidden objects within a 10-foot radius. You can also use this spell to locate individuals or clues related to a specific crime or investigation.

Veritas:

When you cast this spell, you can detect if a person is lying or telling the truth. You can also use this spell to uncover hidden motives or agendas of individuals involved in an investigation.

Evidence:

When you cast this spell, you can analyze and collect evidence from a crime scene or suspect. You can also use this spell to identify the origin or nature of evidence, such as the type of weapon used in a crime or the source of a poison.

Mendacium:

When you cast this spell, you can detect and expose falsehoods or illusions. You can also use this spell to dispel magical disguises or illusions that are obstructing an investigation.

deck_list.name: Love Magic
deck_list.description:
Effringo:

When you cast this spell, a wave of energy flows from your hand and infuses a creature within 30 feet with the emotion of love. The target creature will feel an intense desire to please and be with the caster. However, the spell only lasts for a short period of time, and once it wears off, the target will return to their previous mindset.

Attrahere:

When you cast this spell, you can attract a creature towards you with an irresistible force. This can be used to pull a target towards you, or to repel them away. However, the spell has its limitations - it can only affect creatures that are not too large or too heavy, and the caster must have a clear line of sight to the target.

Meliorare:

When you cast this spell, you can improve the physical appearance or qualities of a creature. This can be used to enhance the target's attractiveness, charisma, or physical abilities. However, the spell has its limitations - it can only affect creatures that are not too powerful, and the effects are temporary.

Illudo:

When you cast this spell, you can create a powerful illusion in the mind of the target creature.
