This can be used to deceive the target, make them believe something that is not true, or to create a false sense of reality. However, the spell has its limitations - it can only affect creatures that have a mind to be affected, and the caster must be able to communicate with the target.

deck_list.name: Book of Demonology
deck_list.description:
Demonus:

When you cast this spell, a random demon will be summoned to do your bidding. The demon is uncontrollable and may cause harm to the user and others.

Invocatio:

When you cast this spell, a specific demon will be summoned to do your bidding. The demon is uncontrollable and may cause harm to the user and others.

Exorcismus:

When you cast this spell, a demon that possesses a person or an object will be exorcised. This spell is dangerous and requires extreme caution.

deck_list.name: Book of Necropolitics
deck_list.description:
This spell book contains powerful magic for controlling the dead, but its use is considered illegal in most countries. The book contains the following spells:

  • Necropolitia: This spell allows the caster to control one undead creature within sight for a short period of time. The caster can give the creature simple commands, such as attacking a specific target or moving in a certain direction. The spell lasts for one minute per caster level.
  • Resurrectio: This spell allows the caster to bring a dead creature back to life as an undead creature under their control. The caster must have the body of the creature and perform a ritual that takes 24 hours. The resurrected creature retains some of its memories and abilities, but also gains weaknesses and vulnerabilities as an undead creature.
  • Anima: This spell allows the caster to steal the life force of a living creature and transfer it to an undead creature under their control. The living creature suffers permanent damage, and the undead creature gains temporary hit points.

Using the book and its spells can have serious consequences, such as harming the souls of the dead and attracting the attention of powerful necromancers.

deck_list.name: Book of Mind Control
deck_list.description:
Mens:

When you cast this spell, you can read the surface thoughts of a creature within 30 feet. You can ask them questions, and they will answer truthfully, but they will be aware that you are reading their thoughts.

Manipulatio:

When you cast this spell, you can suggest a course of action to a creature within 30 feet. The creature must make a Will saving throw or be compelled to follow your suggestion for a short period of time.

Subjugatio:

When you cast this spell, you can take control of a creature's mind within 30 feet. The creature must make a Will saving throw or become completely subservient to your will. You can issue commands to the creature, and it will obey them to the best of its ability.

deck_list.name: Nature Magic
deck_list.description:
Natura:

When you cast this spell, you can communicate with nature and understand the natural world. You can talk to animals, control plants, and gain knowledge about the environment around you.

Animalia:

When you cast this spell, you can communicate with animals and understand their language. You can use this to gain information, ask for help, or persuade them to do your bidding.

Herba:

When you cast this spell, you can control plants and make them do your bidding. You can use this to create barriers, attack enemies, or manipulate the environment.

Intelligere:

When you cast this spell, you gain knowledge about the natural world. You can use this to gain insights about the environment, find hidden resources, or track creatures.

moves.moves_description: When you roll for hack and Slash, you can choose an additiona option: If your target is not wearing armor, you wound them. At the beginning of their turns, they receive damage equal to 1/10 of the damage you did until they receive medical help.

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and this weapon can release a force push in a cone in front of it in a 3 metres range, pushing any human sized being by 1 metre. If used faced to the ground, it allows the user to make a 3 metres high jump and 10 metres long, without the risk of taking damage during the fall. This effect can be used once every 10 seconds.

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and two phantom images of yourself using the weapon are created alongside you. Those phantom mirror your movements during the attack, except that the phantom can be facing any direction you choose. The phantoms are able to deal physical damage as yourself and after doing that they disappear. If a ranged weapon its used, the phantom are also able to shoot an ammunition before disappearing. This effect can be used once every 1 minute. When you could increase this enchantments frequency use by 1 step, you can instead choose to create two additional phantoms. This enchantment can be applied multiple times on a single item, each enchantment has its own frequency use.

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and the weapon becomes indestructible for once every 10 minutes (the effect activates if the weapon is about to break and prevents it from breaking. Therefore, if someone tries to break it multiple times with a hammer, the first hit does nothing, but the others do).

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and once every 12 hours, you can see the trajectory of your weapon if you were to shoot it. The trajectory takes into account wind, gravity, and other variables. Essentially, this makes your shot 100% accurate without needing to roll.

You can apply this Glyph to any item. When you use this enchantment, the item bursts into flames and deals an additional 1d6 fire damage on hit. The flames last for 1 minute before extinguishing. Requires materials from a Fire Elemental.

You can apply this Glyph to any item. When you use this enchantment, the item becomes covered in a layer of ice and deals an additional 1d6 cold damage on hit. The ice lasts for 1 minute before melting. Requires materials from an Ice Elemental.

You can apply this Glyph to any item. When you use this enchantment, the item glows with a soft light and heals the user for 1d6 hit points. This effect can be used once every hour. Requires materials from a Healing Herb.
You can apply this Glyph to any item. When you use this enchantment, the user becomes invisible for 1 minute. This effect can be used once every hour. Requires materials from an Invisible Eye.

You can apply this Glyph to any item. When you use this enchantment, the user gains the ability to levitate up to 3 metres off the ground for 1 minute. This effect can be used once every hour. Requires materials from a Levitation Feather.

You can apply this Glyph to any item. When you use this enchantment, the user gains a +5 bonus to stealth checks for 1 hour. This effect can be used once every hour. Requires materials from a Shadow Plant.

You can apply this Glyph to any item. When you use this enchantment, the user can teleport up to 10 metres to a location they can see within range. This effect can be used once every hour. Requires materials from a Teleportation Crystal.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and the armament releases a faint light that can be used to see in the darkness as a torch for a few minutes. This effect can be used once every 1 hour.

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and the armament can absorb a ranged spell that hits it and hold its energy inside it. Until the weapon has a spell inside it, the holder can cast the spell by using the weapon. This effect can be used once every 10 minutes.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and add +1 to your Strength for the next 10 minutes.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and add +1 to your Agility for the next 10 minutes.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and add +1 to your Intelligence for the next 10 minutes.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and add +1 to your Charisma for the next 10 minutes.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and add +1 to your Constitution for the next 10 minutes.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and add +1 to your Wisdom for the next 10 minutes.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and add +5 feet to your movement speed for the next 10 minutes.

deck_list.name: Minor Glyph of the Rams Strength

moves.moves_description: When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and charge forward with the force of a ram. Roll +STR. On a 16-19, deal your weapon's damage to a single target and push them back. On a 9-15, deal your weapon's damage to a single target, but they also deal their damage to you.

deck_list.header_image: Minor Glyph of the Rams Strength.png

deck_list.name: Minor Glyph of the Bulls Endurance

moves.moves_description: When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and charge forward with the endurance of a bull. Roll +CON. On a 16-19, deal your weapon's damage to a single target and gain 2 armor until the end of your next turn. On a 9-15, deal your weapon's damage to a single target and take 1 damage yourself.

deck_list.header_image: Minor Glyph of the Bulls Endurance.png

deck_list.name: Minor Glyph of the Twins Agility

moves.moves_description: When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and strike with the agility of the twins. Roll +DEX. On a 16-19, deal your weapon's damage to two separate targets. On a 9-15, deal your weapon's damage to one target and take 1 damage yourself.

deck_list.header_image: Minor Glyph of the Twins Agility.png

deck_list.name: Minor Glyph of the Crabs Protection

moves.moves_description: When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and gain the protection of the crab's shell. Roll +WIS. On a 16-19, gain 3 armor until the end of your next turn. On a 9-15, gain 2 armor until the end of your next turn.

deck_list.header_image: Minor Glyph of the Crabs Protection.png

deck_list.name: Minor Glyph of the Lions Fury

moves.moves_description: When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and roar with the fury of the lion. Roll +CHA. On a 16-19, deal your weapon's damage to a single target and intimidate them. On a 9-15, deal your weapon's damage to a single target and draw their attention.

deck_list.header_image: Minor Glyph of the Lions Fury.png

deck_list.name: Minor Glyph of the Maidens Grace

moves.moves_description: When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and move with the grace of the maiden. Roll +DEX. On a 16-19, move to any location within your sight without triggering any traps or hazards. On a 9-15, move to any location within your sight, but trigger any traps or hazards that may be in your path.

deck_list.header_image: Minor Glyph of the Maidens Grace.png

deck_list.name: Minor Glyph of the Scales Balance

moves.moves_description: When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and balance with the precision of the scales. Roll +WIS. On a 16-19, gain +1 forward to your next move. On a 9-15, maintain your balance, but suffer -1 ongoing until you rest.

deck_list.header_image: Minor Glyph of the Scales Balance.png

deck_list.name: Minor Glyph of the Scorpions Sting

moves.moves_description: When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and strike with the deadly sting of the scorpion. Roll +STR. On a 16-19, deal your weapon's damage and poison the target, dealing 1d4 damage per turn until cured. On a 9-15, deal your weapon's damage and poison the target, but the poison only lasts for 1 turn.

deck_list.header_image: Minor Glyph of the Scorpions Sting.png

deck_list.name: Minor Glyph of the Archers Aim

moves.moves_description: When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and take aim with the precision of the archer. Roll +DEX. On a 16-19, deal your weapon's damage and ignore any armor the target may have. On a 9-15, deal your weapon's damage, but the target's armor is only reduced by half.

deck_list.header_image: Minor Glyph of the Archers Aim.png

deck_list.name: Minor Glyph of the Fishes Agility

moves.moves_description: When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and leap with the agility of the fishes. Roll +DEX. On a 16-19, jump to any location within your sight and gain +1 forward to your next move. On a 9-15, jump to any location within your sight, but take 1 damage from the impact.

deck_list.header_image: Minor Glyph of the Fishes Agility.png

moves.moves_description: When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and the armament becomes sticky and when swung, it flies attached to its handle by a long and slimy tongue. This effect can be used once every 1 minute.

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and the shape of this item changes to resemble that of a giant mouth able to swallow whole a human sized being. While swallowed, a creature is trapped inside a metal cage until it can pry open the mouth or pierce its metal walls. The item needs to be hold by the user otherwise it returns to its original shape freeing whoever is inside it. This effect can be used once every 1 hour.

deck_list.name: Staff of Thunders
deck_list.description: A staff built by ...

moves.moves_description: When you wield the staff of thunders and cast a spell that deals damage, you can choose to add the lightning tag to it. If you do, roll +Int and spend 1 mp. On a 16-19, you deal your damage as normal and the target is deafened and stunned for a few moments. On a 9-15, you deal your damage as normal but the spell also affects you or an ally nearby, your choice. On a miss, the spell backfires and you take 1d6 damage.

When you slam the staff of thunders on the ground, you can spend one charge to create a loud thunderclap that can be heard for miles around. Anyone nearby who is not prepared for the noise must defy danger or be deafened and stunned for a few moments. The staff has 3 charges and regains one charge at dawn.

When you strap the shield of the gryphon on your arm and leap into the air, you can spend one charge to fly for a short distance. You can carry up to your load while flying. You can use this ability to cross gaps, reach high places, or escape danger. The shield has 3 charges and regains one charge at dawn.

When you hold the shield of the gryphon in front of you and shout a challenge, you can spend one charge to unleash a fearsome roar that echoes from the shield. Anyone who hears it must defy danger or flee in terror. The shield has 3 charges and regains one charge at dawn.
When you wear the helmet of courage, you and your allies nearby are immune to fear effects. You also gain +3 ongoing to defy danger when you act despite danger or fear.

When you wear the helmet of courage and rally your allies with a speech or a gesture, roll +Cha. On a 16-19, you and your allies take +3 forward to your next roll. On a 9-15, you or one ally of your choice takes +3 forward to their next roll.

deck_list.name: Whistle of the Eagles
deck_list.description:
Eagle’s Call:

When you blow the whistle of the eagles, you can summon an eagle to aid you. The eagle is loyal to you and will follow your commands as best as it can. You can communicate with it telepathically as long as it is within sight. The eagle has these stats: HP 6, Armor 1, Damage d6, Instinct: To soar.

Eagle’s Eye:

When you blow the whistle of the eagles and look through its eyes, you can see what it sees as if you were there. You can use this ability to scout ahead, spy on enemies, or find hidden things. You cannot see or hear anything else while using this ability.

deck_list.name: Potion of Heroism
deck_list.description:
Heroic Boost:

When you drink the potion of heroism, you feel a surge of courage and strength. For the next hour, you gain +1 to all your rolls and you can mark one additional option when you hack and slash or volley. You also ignore the effects of fear, pain, and exhaustion. However, after the hour is over, you suffer a -1 ongoing to all your rolls until you rest.

deck_list.name: Potion of Invisibility
deck_list.description:
Vanish from Sight:

When you drink the potion of invisibility, you turn invisible for the next hour. You can move without being seen or heard, and you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. However, any attack or spell you make will end the effect. Also, the potion has a bitter taste that might make you gag and break your stealth.

deck_list.name: Endure Elements Potion
deck_list.description:
Endure Elements:

Drinking this potion grants the imbiber the ability to endure extreme natural elements. The imbiber gains the Endure Elements effect for 1 hour, which allows them to endure extreme heat, extreme cold, severe wind, heavy precipitation, or any combination of these, without suffering any harm. This does not protect against magical effects or extreme environmental hazards such as lava or acid.

deck_list.name: Potion of Levitation
deck_list.description:
Float in the Air:

When you drink the potion of levitation, you can float in the air for the next hour. You can move at a speed of 20 feet per round and you have advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks. However, you cannot fly higher than 30 feet above the ground and any attack or spell you make will end the effect.

moves.moves_description: When you roll for Volley, you can pick an additional option: your attack hits a specific body part and pierces armor, ignoring 2 point of armor.
You can reload the crossbow with ease, taking only a few instant using sheer strenght. If you don't have this ability, the crossbow takes 1 action to reload.
When you roll for Volley, you can pick an additional option: Your attack pins your target to a wall or the ground, preventing them from moving until they free themselves.
When you roll for Volley, you can pick an additional option: Your attack deals damage again and the target is off-balance and gets pushed 1 meter for each 5 damage received.
You can reload the crossbow with ease, taking only 1 action using sheer strenght. If you don't have this ability, the crossbow takes 3 actions to reload.
You can use it with only one hand. If you don't have this ability, it requires 2 hands to be handled.

deck_list.name: Natures Chosen
deck_list.description: Your bond with the wilds influences you in strange ways. Choose a Tell - a physical attribute that marks you as an avatar of nature. It remains with you, no matter what shape you take. You also have no need to eat or drink; if a move tells you to mark off a ration, just ignore it.

deck_list.name: Communion of Whispers
deck_list.description: When you spend time in a place, making note of its resident spirits and calling on the spirits of the land, roll+WIS. You will be granted a vision of significance to you, your allies, and the spirits around you. On a 16-19, the vision will be clear and helpful to you. On a 9-15, the vision is unclear, its meaning murky. On a 1-8, in addition to whatever the GM says, the vision is upsetting, frightening, or traumatizing; take -1 Forward.

moves.moves_description: When you Volley, you gain an additional option: Your attack deals an additional HD damage if you have the high ground or surprise

deck_list.name: Druid
deck_list.description: Your training in your Druidic Circle has given you the ability to communicate with animals and plants. When you parley with an animal or plant, roll+WIS instead of +CHA. On a 16-19, the creature will do what you ask if you offer some appropriate gift, service, or information in return. On a 9-15, the creature requires something else first, but doing it will get you what you want. On a miss, the creature is offended, and you have made an enemy.

deck_list.name: Shaman
deck_list.description: You have been taught to channel the power of the spirits of the air, water, fire, and earth. When you consult the spirits, roll+WIS. On a 16-19, you can ask the GM any three questions, and they will answer you truthfully. On a 9-15, you can ask any one question, and the GM will answer it truthfully. On a miss, the spirits are offended, and you have made an enemy.

deck_list.name: Mystic
deck_list.description: You have been trained in a mystical, which has taught you to speak with the spirits of the dead. When you commune with the spirits, roll+WIS. On a 16-19, you can ask the GM any three questions about a deceased spirit, and they will answer you truthfully. On a 9-15, you can ask any one question, and the GM will answer it truthfully. On a miss, the spirits are offended, and you have made an enemy.

moves.moves_description: Your attack deals an additional HD damage if you have the high ground or surprise.
When you roll for Volley, you can pick an additional option: Your attack hits an additional target behind the original one.

deck_list.name: Summon Atarir, the Air Spirit
deck_list.description: When you call the Atarir Spirit to temporarily possess you, your body changes to adapt to it: ability to control and generate air, including creating gusts of wind and manipulating the direction and intensity of existing winds. Weakness: earth is deadly. Instinct: prone to arrogance and vanity. Roll+WIS. On a 16-19, the spirit quickly possesses you and without issue. On a 9-15, it still possesses you, but you are put in a spot or draw unwanted attention. While the spirit is possessing you, you gain any innate abilities and weaknesses of the spirit. You also gain the Instinct of your spirit; if you try and ignore this primal urge or keep it in check, you must Defy Danger. You may stop the summoning at any time.

deck_list.name: Summon Bumir, the Earth Spirit
deck_list.description: When you call the Bumir Spirit to temporarily possess you, your body changes to adapt to it: Ability to control and generate earth, including shaping and moving earth and stone and creating small tremors or earthquakes. Weakness: air is deadly. Instinct: prone to greed and possessiveness. Roll+WIS. On a 16-19, the spirit quickly possesses you and without issue. On a 9-15, you it still possesses you, but you are put in a spot or draw unwanted attention. While the spirit is possessing you, you gain any innate abilities and weaknesses of the spirit. You also gain the Instinct of your spirit; if you try and ignore this primal urge or keep it in check, you must Defy Danger. You may stop the summoning at any time.

deck_list.name: Summon Mawur, the Light Spirit
deck_list.description: When you call the Mawur Spirit to temporarily possess you, your body changes to adapt to it: ability to control and generate light, including creating small sources of light or amplifying existing light sources. Weakness: darkness is deadly. Instinct: prone to optimism and naivety. Roll+WIS. On a 16-19, the spirit quickly possesses you and without issue. On a 9-15, you it still possesses you, but you are put in a spot or draw unwanted attention. While the spirit is possessing you, you gain any innate abilities and weaknesses of the spirit. You also gain the Instinct of your spirit; if you try and ignore this primal urge or keep it in check, you must Defy Danger. You may stop the summoning at any time.

deck_list.name: Summon Xanther, the Dark Spirit
deck_list.description: When you call the Xanther Spirit to temporarily possess you, your body changes to adapt to it: Ability to control and generate darkness, including creating small sources of darkness or blocking out existing light sources. Weakness: light is deadly. Instinct: prone to pessimism and distrust. Roll+WIS. On a 16-19, the spirit quickly possesses you and without issue. On a 9-15, you it still possesses you, but you are put in a spot or draw unwanted attention. While the spirit is possessing you, you gain any innate abilities and weaknesses of the spirit. You also gain the Instinct of your spirit; if you try and ignore this primal urge or keep it in check, you must Defy Danger. You may stop the summoning at any time.

deck_list.name: Summon Taner, the Forest Spirit
deck_list.description:
When you call the Taner Spirit to temporarily possess you, your body changes to adapt to it:

  • Ability to control and protect plants, including accelerating their growth and healing their injuries.
  • Weakness: pollution is deadly.
  • Instinct: prone to pacifism and passiveness.
Roll+WIS. On a 16-19, the spirit quickly possesses you and without issue. On a 9-15, you it still possesses you, but you are put in a spot or draw unwanted attention. While the spirit is possessing you, you gain any innate abilities and weaknesses of the spirit. You also gain the Instinct of your spirit; if you try and ignore this primal urge or keep it in check, you must Defy Danger. You may stop the summoning at any time.

deck_list.name: Summon Nyassir, the Sea Spirit
deck_list.description: When you call the Nyassir Spirit to temporarily possess you, your body changes to adapt to it. You gain the ability to control and protect marine life, including communicating with and controlling the behavior of aquatic animals. However, you are weak against pollution which can be deadly. Your instinct is prone to curiosity and adventurousness. Roll+WIS. On a 16-19, the spirit quickly possesses you and without issue. On a 9-15, you it still possesses you, but you are put in a spot or draw unwanted attention. While the spirit is possessing you, you gain any innate abilities and weaknesses of the spirit. You also gain the Instinct of your spirit; if you try and ignore this primal urge or keep it in check, you must Defy Danger. You may stop the summoning at any time.

deck_list.name: Summon Apollor, the Mountain Spirit
deck_list.description: When you call the Apollor Spirit to temporarily possess you, your body changes to adapt to it. You gain the ability to control and protect mountains, including strengthening their structures and stabilizing them against earthquakes. However, you are weak against earthquakes which can be deadly. Your instinct is prone to stubbornness and rigidity. Roll+WIS. On a 16-19, the spirit quickly possesses you and without issue. On a 9-15, you it still possesses you, but you are put in a spot or draw unwanted attention. While the spirit is possessing you, you gain any innate abilities and weaknesses of the spirit. You also gain the Instinct of your spirit; if you try and ignore this primal urge or keep it in check, you must Defy Danger. You may stop the summoning at any time.

deck_list.name: Summon Kapka, the Sky Spirit
deck_list.description: When you call the Kapka Spirit to temporarily possess you, your body changes to adapt to it. You gain the ability to fly and see over long distances, including sensing prey from afar and diving at high speeds. However, you are sensitive to loud noises. Your instinct is prone to hunting and preying on weaker beings. Roll+WIS. On a 16-19, the spirit quickly possesses you and without issue. On a 9-15, you it still possesses you, but you are put in a spot or draw unwanted attention. While the spirit is possessing you, you gain any innate abilities and weaknesses of the spirit. You also gain the Instinct of your spirit; if you try and ignore this primal urge or keep it in check, you must Defy Danger. You may stop the summoning at any time.

moves.moves_description: When you roll for Volley, you can pick an additional option: Your attack has extreme range, reaching targets far beyond normal sight and deals +HD damage and pushes the target 1 meter away for each 5 damage done
When you roll for Volley, you can pick an additional option: Your attack hits an additional target behind the original one.
When you shot with the Longbow, you don't need to rest for the next shot. If you don't have this ability, each time you shot you need 1 action to rest before shooting again.
When you Volley, you can choose this additiona option: Deal your damage two more times and the target loses its reaction.
You can use it with only one hand. If you don't have this ability, it requires 2 hands to be handled.
You can reload the blunderbuss with ease, taking only 15 seconds using sheer speed. If you don't have this ability, it takes 1 minutes to reload.

When you Volley, you can choose this additiona loption: your attack pierces armor, your attack creates a loud bang and a flash of fire, stunning or scaring anyone nearby who is not prepared for it and sets your target and anything nearby on fire
When you Volley, you can choose this additiona option: Deal your damage two more times, ignore 3 points of armor and the target loses its reaction.
You can use it with only one hand. If you don't have this ability, it requires 2 hands to be handled.
You can reload the blunderbuss with ease, taking only 1 minute using sheer speed. If you don't have this ability, it  takes 3 minutes to reload.

When you Hack and Slash, you get an additional option: your attack breaks or damages something your target is holding or wearing, your attack sends your target flying or sprawling, giving you or an ally an opportunity to quickly act before they can recover, your attack dazes or disorients your target, giving them -1 forward to their next roll.

deck_list.name: Invisibility Magic
deck_list.description:
Invisible:

When you cast this spell, you become invisible for 10 minutes. You cannot attack or cast spells while invisible, but you can move quietly and avoid detection.

Celare:

When you cast this spell, one object of your choice becomes invisible for 1 hour. The object must be no larger than a chair and must be within 10 feet of you.

Illudere:

When you cast this spell, you create an illusion of yourself that lasts for 1 minute. The illusion can move and speak, but it cannot interact with the environment.

Objectum:

When you cast this spell, you can see invisible objects within a 10-foot radius of you. This effect lasts for 1 minute.

deck_list.name: Summoning Magic
deck_list.description:
Invocare:

When you cast this spell, you can summon a creature from the astral realm to do your bidding. The creature must be of a type you have previously encountered, and the spell requires a high level of magical knowledge to cast. The creature will remain under your control for a limited time, and failure to maintain control can have severe consequences.

Creatura:

When you cast this spell, you can create a creature from the astral realm to serve you. The creature will be loyal to you and can perform a variety of tasks, but the spell requires a high level of magical knowledge to cast. The creature will remain in existence for a limited time, and failure to properly dismiss it can have severe consequences.

Astralis:

When you cast this spell, you can travel to the astral realm yourself. This can be useful for obtaining rare ingredients or communicating with astral beings, but the spell requires a high level of magical knowledge to cast. You will be vulnerable while in the astral realm and failure to properly return can have severe consequences.

Daemonium:

When you cast this spell, you can summon a powerful demon from the astral realm to do your bidding. The demon will be extremely powerful, but the spell requires an immense level of magical knowledge to cast. The demon will remain under your control for a limited time, and failure to maintain control can have severe consequences.

moves.moves_description: When you attack, roll +Dex instead of +Str.
When you Hack and Slash, you get an additional option:  If you are hidden or invisible, you can choose to reveal yourself after the attack to deal the damage again.
When you Hack and Slash, you get an additional option: If you are grappling the target, push the blade slowly through a gap in the armor. You bypass the armor and deal your damage.
When you attack with the Elven Shortsword while performing an acrobatic maneuver, roll +Dex instead of +Str.
When you Hack and Slash, you get an additional option: Thrust the Estoc with both hands into an enemy wearing mail or plate armor, deal your damage again and your attack has 3 piercing.
When you Hack and Slash, you get an additional option: Push the blade inside their body, inflicting at the begginiing of ther turn damage equal to your Strenght score until the Estoc is removed.

When you roll for Hack and Slash, you can pick an additional option: Use the hook of your halberd to trip, disarm, or otherwise impede a foe's movement, they fall prone or drop their weapon, your choice.
When you roll for Hack and Slash, you can pick an additional option: Swing your halberd in a wide arc to deliver a powerful strike against multiple foes, you deal your damage to all foes in reach
You can use it with only one hand. If you don't have this ability, it requires 2 hands to be handled.
When you roll for Hack and Slash, you can pick an additional option: >You create an opportunity for an ally to strike the target with an advantage during their next attack.

When you roll for Hack and Slash, you can pick an additional option: If your enemy is the size of an ogre or less, you force the enemy to back off: you and ally of your choice gain back their reaction.
You can use it with only one hand. If you don't have this ability, it requires 2 hands to be handled.
When you roll for Hack and Slash, you can pick an additional option: You deal damage (again).
When you use 1 Defense hold, you have an additional option: you deal damage to the attacker in melee range.
You can use it with only one hand. If you don't have this ability, it requires 2 hands to be handled.

When you spend 1 magic point and use the Elven Greatsword to strike a target, you can teleport yourself to any location within sight. Roll+Int. On a 16-19, you appear exactly where you want. On a 9-15, choose one: you appear in a risky position or you appear in a safe position but your sword is left behind.

When you use the Elven Greatsword with both hands and fall down onto an enemy, roll+Str. On a 16-19, you deal your damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 9-15, you deal your damage but your enemy makes an attack against you. On a miss, you fall prone and your enemy makes an attack against you.

  • Your attack deals extra damage
  • Your attack causes the enemy to be stunned or knocked prone
  • Your attack creates an opening, giving you or an ally +1 forward to their next attack against the target

When you attack with a Dwarven Greatsword, roll +Str. On a 16-19, you deal your damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 9-15, you deal your damage but also take damage in return. On a miss, your attack leaves you vulnerable to counterattacks.

  • You cleave through your enemy's defenses, ignoring their armor
  • You strike with such force that your enemy is pushed back or knocked prone
  • You strike with deadly accuracy, dealing an additional 1d6 damage
When you strike with a Dwarven Greatsword, you can infuse your weapon with the lightning element by spending 1 mp. Your attack deals an additional md lightning damage.
When you roll for Hack and Slash, you can pick an additional option: your attack hits all the enemies in front of you in range, dealing equal damage to all fo them.
When you roll for Hack and Slash, you can pick an additional option: You deal damage (again).
You can use the greataxe with only one hand. If you don't have this ability, the greataxe requires 2 hands to be handled.
When you roll for Hack and Slash, you can pick an additional option: You deal damage (again).
When you roll for Hack and Slash, you can pick an additional option: Destroy a magical barrier or defense for a few seconds.
You can use the greataxe with only one hand. If you don't have this ability, the greataxe requires 2 hands to be handled.
When you use a shortsword, you can use Dex instead of Str for the rolls.
When you roll for Hack and Slash, you can choose an additional option: Your enemy will lose an extra 1d4 damage at the start of each of their turns until they receive healing or medical attention.
When you strike with the Infernal Longsword, deal your damage plus 1d6 fire damage but your blade is now coated in infernal flames and you take -1 ongoing until you either sheathe or stow the sword.

Once per day, when you score a  16-19 with the Infernal Longsword, you may choose to deal an additional 1d6 fire damage and take -1 ongoing for the rest of the session. If you do, the demon bound within the sword whispers terrible secrets to you about your companions or your quest, and the GM will offer you a devilish bargain to fulfill its dark desires. If you refuse, the demon will be bound and you will take -1 forward to all rolls until the end of the session.

When you hack and slash with the Orcish Longsword, you may deal +1d10 damage but you must choose one:

  • The orcish rage takes over and the next turn you attack the nearest ally instead of your intended target.
  • The orcish bloodlust demands you keep fighting. You cannot disengage until either you or your opponent are taken out of the fight.
  • The orcish spirits demand a sacrifice. Take -1 forward to all rolls until you make an offering to the spirits.

When you kill with the Orcish Longsword, you may choose to spill blood onto the blade as an offering to the orcish spirits. If you do, you gain +1 forward to your next attack and the spirits will guide your hand in combat.
When you attack with the Elven Shortsword while performing an acrobatic maneuver, roll +Dex instead of +Str.

When you spend 1 magic point to channel enchantment magic into the Elven Shortsword, choose one of the following:

  • Deal an additional 1d4 arcane damage on your next successful attack.
  • Disarm your opponent on your next successful attack.
  • Teleport behind your opponent on your next successful attack.
When you use a Dwarven Shortsword to parry an attack from a creature larger than yourself, you get +5 to the roll.

When you shoot an explosive shot from your Dwarven Shortsword, spend 1 magic point and roll+Int. On a 16-19, you deal your damage to a single target and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 9-15, you deal your damage but also choose one drawback from the list below. On a 6-, the explosive shot misfires and causes you harm.

  • Your attack hits an additional target nearby
  • Your attack inflicts a burning effect, dealing 1d6 additional damage each turn until the target receives healing or medical attention
  • Your attack creates a loud noise, stunning your target and any nearby enemies for a moment

When you wear the Sylvan Gauntlet, roll +Con. On a 9-15, you gain +1 armor. On a 16-19, you gain +2 armor and you can choose to create a shield of foliage that provides additional protection. On a 20+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your shield of foliage provides +2 armor
  • Your shield of foliage causes enemies that attack you to suffer damage
  • You can heal 1d6 damage when you create your shield of foliage
The Sylvan Gauntlet is made of a natural material that seems to be a combination of wood and leaves. When you wear this gauntlet, you gain the ability to communicate with plants and animals.
By spending 1 magic point, you can gain animal-like senses that allow you to track creatures, detect hidden objects, and sense danger more acutely. These senses last for an hour.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and your next attack deals additional radiant damage equal to your WIS modifier. On a 20+, the target is blinded until the end of their next turn.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and gain advantage on your next WIS-based check. On a 20+, you also gain advantage on your next attack roll or saving throw.

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and the next time you plant a seed or sapling, it grows instantly into a mature plant or tree. On a 20+, you also gain temporary hit points equal to your level.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and teleport up to your movement speed to an unoccupied space in dim light or darkness. On a 20+, you also gain advantage on your next attack roll.

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and choose a target within 30 feet. They gain temporary hit points equal to your level. On a 20+, they also gain advantage on their next attack roll or saving throw.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and your movement speed is doubled until the end of your turn. On a 20+, you can also take the Dash action as a bonus action.

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and create a 30-foot cone of water that deals bludgeoning damage equal to your level. On a 20+, the targets must also make a DEX saving throw or be knocked prone.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and your next attack deals additional lightning damage equal to your WIS modifier. On a 20+, the target is stunned until the end of their next turn.

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and choose a target within 30 feet. They must make a WIS saving throw or be charmed by you until the end of their next turn. On a 20+, you also gain advantage on your next social interaction with the target.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and gain proficiency with any artisan's tools for the next hour. On a 20+, you also gain advantage on your next crafting check with the chosen tools.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 MP and gain the power of Ra. You gain +1 forward to all rolls for the next hour.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 MP and invoke the protection of Anubis. You gain +2 armor for the next encounter.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 MP and call upon Set's trickery. You become invisible for the next 10 minutes.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 MP and channel the healing power of Isis. You heal 1d6+1 damage.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 MP and invoke the strength of Horus. You gain +1 forward to all rolls that involve physical strength for the next hour.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 MP and tap into Thoth's knowledge. You gain +2 forward to any one roll that involves knowledge or information gathering.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 MP and invoke Hathor's beauty. You gain +1 forward to all social rolls for the next hour.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 MP and tap into Sobek's ferocity. You gain +1 forward to all attack rolls for the next hour
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 MP and invoke the grace of Bastet. You gain +1 forward to all rolls that involve agility or balance for the next hour.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 MP and channel the power of Osiris. You can resurrect a dead character with 1 HP, as long as their death occurred no more than 24 hours ago.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and gain advantage on all Wisdom (Perception) checks for the next hour.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and your attacks deal an extra 1d6 lightning damage for the next minute.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and gain advantage on all Charisma (Persuasion) checks for the next hour.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and gain advantage on all Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks for the next hour.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and gain advantage on all Wisdom (Insight) checks for the next hour.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and gain resistance to all damage for the next minute.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and the next creature that damages you takes 1d6 necrotic damage.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and your attacks have a +2 bonus to hit against creatures that have attacked you within the last round for the next minute.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and gain resistance to all magical damage for the next minute.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and call on Archangel Michael's protection. You gain +1 armor for the next hour.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and call on Archangel Raphael's healing. You or a nearby ally heal 1d4+1 HP.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and call on Archangel Gabriel's message. You can communicate telepathically with a willing creature for the next hour.
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and call on Archangel Uriel's flame. Your weapon becomes wreathed in holy fire and deals +1d4 damage to undead or evil creatures for the next hour.

deck_list.name: Minor Glyph of St. Josephs Blessing

moves.moves_description: When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and call on St. Joseph's blessing. You gain +1 forward to any roll related to building or repairing structures for the next hour.

deck_list.header_image: Minor Glyph of St. Josephs Blessing.png

deck_list.name: Minor Glyph of St. Thereses Rose

moves.moves_description: When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and call on St. Therese's rose. A single rose blooms before you, filling you with calm and serenity. You gain +1 forward to any roll related to social interactions for the next hour.

deck_list.header_image: Minor Glyph of St. Thereses Rose.png

deck_list.name: Minor Glyph of St. Francis Blessing

moves.moves_description: When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and call on St. Francis' blessing. Animals become friendly and docile in your presence. You gain +1 forward to any roll related to animal handling for the next hour.

deck_list.header_image: Minor Glyph of St. Francis Blessing.png

deck_list.name: Minor Glyph of St. Judes Hope

moves.moves_description: When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and call on St. Jude's hope. You or a nearby ally gain +1 forward to any roll related to overcoming a seemingly impossible or hopeless situation for the next hour.

deck_list.header_image: Minor Glyph of St. Judes Hope.png

deck_list.name: Minor Glyph of St. Marthas Hospitality

moves.moves_description: When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and call on St. Martha's hospitality. You or a nearby ally gain +1 forward to any roll related to providing hospitality, such as cooking or hosting guests, for the next hour.

deck_list.header_image: Minor Glyph of St. Marthas Hospitality.png

moves.moves_description:
When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and roll +STR. On a 16-19, deal +2d6 damage. On a 9-15, deal +1d6 damage but also choose one from the following:
  • You take damage equal to your level
  • You must mark a debility
  • You trigger a nearby enemy's move

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and roll +DEX. On a 16-19, choose three from the following. On a 9-15, choose two.
  • You are not noticed
  • You create a diversion
  • You leave no trace
  • You gain an advantageous position
  • You confuse your target

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and roll +INT. On a 16-19, the target takes -1d4 ongoing damage until they get out of your reach. On a 9-15, the target takes -1 ongoing damage but you must expose yourself to danger.

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and roll +WIS. On a 16-19, deal +1d10 damage and the target catches fire, taking +1d6 damage ongoing until they put it out. On a 9-15, deal +1d6 damage and choose one from the following:
  • You put yourself in a spot
  • You expose someone to danger
  • You must mark a debility

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and roll +CHA. On a 16-19, heal 2d6 damage. On a 9-15, heal 1d6 damage but choose one from the following:
  • You expose yourself to danger
  • You draw unwanted attention
  • You must give something in return

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and roll +CHA. On a 16-19, the target takes -1 ongoing until the curse is lifted. On a 9-15, the target takes -1 forward and you must choose one from the following:
  • You expose yourself to danger
  • You draw unwanted attention
  • You must mark a debility

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and roll +WIS. On a 16-19, you and your allies gain +1 forward. On a 9-15, you and your allies gain +1 forward but choose one from the following:
  • You attract unwanted attention
  • You reveal something you shouldn't
  • You expose yourself to danger

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and roll +CON. On a 16-19, you and your allies take -1 ongoing damage until you stop protecting them. On a 9-15, you and your allies take -1 forward but you choose one from the following:
  • You push yourself too hard and take damage
  • You expose yourself to danger
  • You must give something in return

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and roll +DEX. On a 16-19, you and your allies are hidden from sight until you move or make noise. On a 9-15, you and your allies are hidden but choose one from the following:
  • You reveal something you shouldn't
  • You attract unwanted attention
  • You expose yourself to danger

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and make an attack with the enchanted weapon. On a hit, deal +1d4 damage and choose one of the following:
  • The target's armor is reduced by 1 until repaired
  • The target's shield is destroyed if they fail a DEX save (DC equal to your STR or DEX modifier, your choice)
  • The target is pushed back 5 feet

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and make an attack with the enchanted weapon. On a hit, deal +1d6 thunder damage and choose one of the following:
  • The target is deafened for 1 minute
  • All creatures within 5 feet of the target take 1d4 thunder damage
  • The target is pushed back 10 feet and knocked prone

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and activate it as a reaction when you are hit by an attack. You gain resistance to the damage type of the attack and are pushed back 5 feet. You also gain advantage on your next attack roll against the attacker.

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and make an attack with the enchanted weapon. On a hit, deal +1d4 poison damage and the target must succeed on a CON save (DC equal to your STR or DEX modifier, your choice) or be poisoned for 1 minute.

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and make an attack with the enchanted weapon. On a hit, deal +1d6 fire damage and the target must succeed on a DEX save (DC equal to your STR or DEX modifier, your choice) or catch on fire, taking 1d6 fire damage at the start of each of its turns until it extinguishes the flames.

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and make an attack with the enchanted weapon. On a hit, deal +1d6 damage and choose one of the following:
  • You can move up to your speed without provoking opportunity attacks
  • You can make an additional attack against a creature within 5 feet of the target
  • You can push the target and all creatures within 5 feet of it 10 feet away from you

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and make an attack with the enchanted weapon. On a hit, deal +1d4 cold damage and the target is covered in water, making it vulnerable to lightning damage until it dries off. If the target is already wet, it takes an additional +1d4 cold damage and is knocked prone.

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and make an attack with the enchanted weapon. On a hit, deal +1d6 damage and choose one of the following:
  • You can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see
  • You can turn invisible until the end of your next turn
  • You can force the target to make a WIS save (DC equal to your STR or DEX modifier, your choice) or be frightened of you until the end of your next turn

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and make an attack with the enchanted weapon. On a hit, deal +1d6 damage and the target must succeed on a CON save (DC equal to your STR or DEX modifier, your choice) or take an additional +1d6 poison damage at the start of each of its turns for 1 minute.

When you use this enchantment, spend 1 mp and make an attack with the enchanted weapon. On a hit, deal +1d4 damage and the target must succeed on a CON save (DC equal to your STR or DEX modifier, your choice) or be blinded for 1 minute. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
When you Hack and Slash, you get an additional option: Your attack severs a magical connection, causing the target to lose access to one of their magical abilities or spells for 1d6 minutes
You may spend 1 mp to reveal a hidden path or secret door in the environment
When you volley, you have an additional option: Your shot ricochets off a nearby object and hits a second enemy nearby, dealing your damage to them as well
When you volley, you have an additional option: Your shot deals an extra HD damage to targets that are wearing metal armor or are otherwise heavily armored.

When you study this treasure map or scroll, roll +Int. On a 16-19, hold 3. On a 9-15, hold 1. Spend your hold to ask the GM any one question about the location of the treasure, such as 'What is the terrain like around the treasure?' or 'What kind of guardians protect the treasure?' On a miss, the GM will provide false information.
When you discover and claim the treasure indicated on this map or scroll, you gain an additional 3d100 coins worth of treasure.

When you show off your flawless diamond to someone with an eye for valuable goods, roll +Cha. On a 16-19, they recognize its worth and offer to pay double the standard price. On a 9-15, they're interested, but they'll need some time to gather the funds. On a miss, they scoff and dismiss it as a fake, and any future attempts to sell it to them will be even more difficult.

When you hold your flawless diamond up to the light and focus your energy, roll +Wis. On a 16-19, you create a dazzling array of colored light that illuminates the area around you, distracting and dazzling your enemies. Choose 1 option from the list below:

  • Choose a target within range. They are momentarily stunned, and their next attack suffers a -1 penalty.
  • All allies within range gain +1 forward to their next attack.
  • Heal yourself or an ally within range for 1d8 HP.

On a 9-15, you still create the light show, but choose 1 option from the list above and 1 from the list below:

  • You attract unwanted attention. The GM will tell you what kind of danger presents itself.
  • The diamond loses its luster and is now worth half its original value.
  • You become disoriented and suffer a -1 penalty to your next move.

When you try to sell the stolen artwork to a fence, roll +Cha. On a 16-19, you successfully sell it for a good price. On a 9-15, you sell it for a lower price, or the fence offers you a job in exchange. On a 6 or less, the fence turns you away or turns you over to the authorities.

When you attempt to appraise the stolen artwork, roll +Int. On a 16-19, you accurately determine its true value and history. On a 9-15, you get some useful information, but not the whole picture. On a 6 or less, you misinterpret the value or history and could make a costly mistake.

When you gaze into the Orb of Prophecy, roll +Wis. On a 16-19, you can ask the GM any question about the future, and they will answer truthfully. On a 9-15, the GM will answer, but the answer may be vague or cryptic. On a miss, the GM will give you a false answer or an unwelcome truth.

When you hold the Orb of Prophecy and concentrate, roll +Int. On a 16-19, you and your allies are protected from evil for a time. Choose one effect from the list below. On a 9-15, the effect is temporary or limited in scope. On a miss, you attract the attention of evil forces.

  • Your enemies are repelled or driven away from you and your allies
  • Your allies are healed of any curses or ailments caused by dark magic
  • Your senses are enhanced, allowing you to detect hidden or secret dangers

When you consult the Amulet of the Ancients for knowledge, roll +Int. On a 16-19, the Amulet provides you with useful information about your current situation or a relevant historical event. On a 9-15, the Amulet provides you with limited or cryptic information, leaving room for interpretation. On a miss, the Amulet either remains silent or provides you with misleading information.

When you unleash the power of the Amulet to create an elemental blast, roll +Wis. On a 16-19, choose two options from the list below. On a 9-15, choose one. On a miss, you lose control of the blast, causing unintended damage or harm.

  • The blast deals extra damage to your target
  • The blast affects an additional target or area
  • The blast inflicts a negative status effect on your target, such as burning, freezing, or stunning
  • The blast creates an obstacle or hazard for your target, such as a wall of fire or a pool of acid

When you cast a spell while wearing the Amulet of Arcane Might, roll +Int. On a 16-19, you can cast the spell at a higher level than usual (up to the maximum level you can cast). On a 9-15, the spell is cast normally, but you take -1 ongoing to cast spells until you take a short rest. On a 6-, the spell backfires, and you take 1d6 damage per level of the spell.

When you cast a spell that deals elemental damage (fire, ice, lightning, etc.) while wearing the Amulet of Arcane Might, roll +Int. On a 16-19, the spell deals an extra d6 damage of the same type. On a 9-15, the spell deals the extra damage, but also causes collateral damage to the surroundings. The GM will describe what this entails. On a 6-, the spell backfires, and you take 1d6 damage of the same type.

When you spend time studying the Amulet of Mysteries, roll +Int. On a 16-19, ask the GM any three questions about the current situation or history of the area. On a 9-15, ask one question and the GM will ask you one in return.

When you use the Amulet of Mysteries in conjunction with another magical artifact, roll +Wis. On a 16-19, both artifacts activate at full strength. On a 9-15, both activate but one will malfunction or become unstable. On a 6 or less, both artifacts become inert.
When you rest in the wilderness, you can avoid using a campfire in order to rest properly

When you share your sleeping bag with someone, you can roll +Cha. On a 16-19, you both get some extra rest and choose one from the list below. On a 9-15, you both rest, but choose only one. On a miss, you both have trouble sleeping.

  • You both heal an additional amount of damage or recover an additional spell
  • You both gain a +1 forward to your next roll
  • You both share a moment of intimacy or bonding

When you set up the lightweight tent in a natural environment, you may spend 1 mp and you and your allies gain +5 ongoing to Defy Danger rolls made to avoid damage from natural elements (such as rain, wind, or extreme temperatures) while inside the tent.
When you take the time to set up the lightweight tent properly, you can make it even more durable and stable. You and your allies can heal an additional +1d4 HP when they take a rest inside the tent.

When you study the ancient runes using magical means, roll +Int. On a 16-19, ask the GM two questions from the list below. On a 9-15, ask one question. The GM will answer truthfully and provide any additional relevant information.

  • What magical properties or effects does this script describe or enable?
  • What is the historical significance of this script or what event does it describe?
  • What kind of ritual or spell can be performed using this script?
  • What kind of magical creature or entity is mentioned in this script?

When you seek the guidance of a divine entity to understand the ancient runes, spend 1 mp and roll +Wis. On a 16-19, the divine entity provides you with a clear and unambiguous answer to your question. On a 9-15, the divine entity answers truthfully, but may also ask you to perform a task or service in return for its help.
When you Hack and Slash, you get an additional option: If the enemy is wearing plate armor, your attack has 2 piercing.
When you attack with the Spear, roll +Dex instead of +Str.

When you deal damage with a mace, choose one: your attack shatters or crushes something your target is holding or wearing, your attack sends a shockwave, knocking down or stunning nearby enemies, your attack deals +1d4 damage.

When you roll for Hack and Slash, you can pick an additional option: If your enemy is the size of an human or less, you force the enemy to back off: you and ally of your choice gain back their reaction.
When you take damage from a blunt weapon or an arrow while wearing gambeson armor, you can choose to damage your armor (reduce its armor value by 1) to reduce the damage by half.
When you wear gambeson armor, you get +1 armor (armor reduces the damage you receive) on the torso and arms.

When you take damage from a slashing or piercing weapon while wearing the breastplate, you can roll a d6. On a 6, you ignore the damage completely. On a 1-5, you can choose to damage your armor (reduce its armor value by 1) to reduce the damage by half.

If you don't have this ability, when you use plate armor to defy danger by being stealthy, agile, or swimming, you get -5 to the roll. When you take damage from electricity or magnetism while wearing plate armor, you take +1d8 damage and must defy danger to avoid being stunned.
When you wear the breastplate, you get +3 armor (armor reduces the damage you receive) when you are hit on the torso.
When you take damage from a slashing weapon, fire or acid, you can choose to damage your armor (reduce its armor value by 1) to reduce the damage by half.
If you don't have this ability, when you use chainmail armor to defy danger by being stealthy or agile, you get -1 to the roll. This armor is noisy and heavy, making you more noticeable and slower.
You get +2 armor (armor reduces the damage you receive) when receiving damage on the torso or arms.
When you Hack and Slash, you get an additional option: If your target is of your size or smaller, your attack knocks it off balance. You and an ally of your choice gain back their reaction
When you take damage that would harm or kill you, you can choose to break your round shield and ignore the damage. You can only do this once per shield.
While holding this shield in one hand, you gain 1 Armor (you reduce by 1 all the damage you receive)
When you Defend, you get an additional option when using holds: You negate all damage from a ranged attack coming from one direction
When you take damage that would harm or kill you, you can choose to break your kite shield and ignore the damage. You can only do this once per shield.
While holding this shield in one hand, you gain 1 Armor (you reduce by 1 all the damage you receive)

When you set up a pavise shield as a cover, roll +Con. On a 9-15, you and anyone behind the shield gain +1 armor against ranged attacks. On a 16-19, you and anyone behind the shield gain +2 armor against ranged attacks and are immune to explosions. On a 20+, you also also regain your reaction.
When you take damage that would harm or kill you, you can choose to break your kite shield and ignore the damage. You can only do this once per shield.
While holding this shield in one hand, you gain 1 Armor (you reduce by 1 all the damage you receive)
When you Hack and Slash, you get an additiona option: Your attack disarms your target.
When you Defy Danger againt a melee attack using this shield, you get an additional option: You regain your reaction.

deck_list.name: Adventuring Gear
deck_list.description:
Have What You Need:

When you rummage through your adventuring gear for some useful mundane item, mark off a use and you have it. The GM might ask you what it looks like or how you got it.

deck_list.name: Bag of Books
deck_list.description:
Bookworm:

When you spout lore about something and your bag of books contains just the right book for the subject, mark off a use and take +3 to your roll.

deck_list.name: Halfling Pipeleaf
deck_list.description:
Friendly Smoke:

When you share halfling pipeleaf with someone, expend two uses and take +3 forward to parley with them. The GM might also tell you something interesting or useful that they reveal during the conversation.

deck_list.name: Bandages
deck_list.description:
Patch Up:

When you have a few minutes to bandage someone else’s wounds, mark off a use and heal them 4 damage.

Tender Care:

When you carefully treat someone else’s wounds with bandages and rest, mark off a use and heal them 7 damage.

deck_list.name: Large Backpack
deck_list.description:
Carry On:

A large backpack or bag can hold up to 25 load of items. You can access any item in your backpack or bag with ease.

deck_list.name: Small Container
deck_list.description:
Store Away:

A small crate, sack or chest can hold up to 20 load of items. You need to spend some time to find a specific item in your crate, sack or chest.

deck_list.name: Big Container
deck_list.description:
Store Away:

A big crate, sack or chest can hold up to 40 load of items. You need to spend some time to find a specific item in your crate, sack or chest.

deck_list.name: Antitoxin
deck_list.description:
Poison Cure:

When you drink antitoxin, cure one poison affecting you. The GM will tell you what effects the poison had and how you feel after taking the antitoxin.

deck_list.name: Small Backpack
deck_list.description:
Carry On:

A small backpack or bag can hold up to 6 load of items. You can access any item in your backpack or bag with ease.

deck_list.name: Medium Backpack
deck_list.description:
Carry On:

A medium backpack or bag can hold up to 13 load of items. You can access any item in your backpack or bag with ease.

deck_list.name: Dungeon Rations
deck_list.description:
Sustenance:

When you consume a ration, mark off a use and you don’t need to eat for a day. Dungeon rations are bland but nourishing.

deck_list.name: Dwarven Hardtack Ration
deck_list.description:
Sustenance:

When you consume a ration, mark off a use and you don’t need to eat for a day. Dwarven hardtack rations are tough and dry but filling.

Stout Heart:

When you consume a ration, you can also choose to take +3 forward to your next defy danger roll with CON.

deck_list.name: Rope
deck_list.description:
Climbing:

When you use this rope to climb a vertical surface, you get +5 to the roll.

deck_list.name: Oil
deck_list.description:
Ignite:

When you pour this oil on a surface and then light it on fire, deal 1d6 damage to all creatures in the area.

deck_list.name: Holy Symbol
deck_list.description:
Sacred Energy:

When you present this holy symbol to undead creatures, roll+WIS. On a 16-19, they are destroyed or driven off. On a 9-15, they are repelled or weakened, but you suffer a setback or cost.

deck_list.name: Lockpicks
deck_list.description:
Unlock:

When you use these lockpicks to try and open a locked door or container, roll+DEX. On a 16-19, the lock opens. On a 9-15, the lock opens but you leave evidence of your tampering behind.

deck_list.name: Antitoxin
deck_list.description:
Poison Immunity:

When you drink this antitoxin, you become immune to all poisons for the next hour.

moves.moves_description: When you Hack and Slash, you get an additional option: The enemy is temporarly blinded by the brightness of your torch, you regain your reaction.
When you Discern Realities, you gain an additional question: Is there any magical aura that my torch will reveal if I look through its smoke?

deck_list.name: Healing Poultice
deck_list.description:
Apply:

When you apply this poultice to someone’s wounds, heal them 6 damage.

deck_list.name: Grappling Hook
deck_list.description:
Hook On:

When you throw this grappling hook to catch onto a high surface, roll+STR. On a 16-19, you catch it and can climb up. On a 9-15, you catch it but something bad happens.

deck_list.name: Elven Bread Ration
deck_list.description:
Sustenance:

When you consume a ration, mark off a use and you don’t need to eat for a day. Elven bread rations are light and sweet but satisfying.

Graceful Step:

When you consume a ration, you can also choose to take +3 forward to your next defy danger roll with DEX.

deck_list.name: A Hearty Meal for One
deck_list.description:
Nourishment:

When you enjoy a hearty meal for one, you heal 2 damage and remove one debility of your choice.

Comfort:

When you enjoy a hearty meal for one, you can also choose to take +3 forward to your next parley or discern realities roll.

deck_list.name: A Poor Meal for a Family
deck_list.description:
Sustenance:

When you share a poor meal for a family, you and up to three others don’t need to eat for a day. A poor meal for a family is meager and bland but enough to survive.

Hardship:

When you share a poor meal for a family, you can also choose to take +5 forward to your next defy danger roll with WIS.
deck_list.header_image: A Poor Meal for a Family.png

deck_list.name: A Feast
deck_list.description:
Nourishment:

When you partake in a feast, you heal 4 damage and remove two debilities of your choice.

Celebration:

When you partake in a feast, you can also choose to take +5 forward to your next carouse or aid or interfere roll.

deck_list.name: Sack of Wheat
deck_list.description:
Bread and Butter:

When you use 1 kg of wheat to make bread or other food, mark off the wheat and you have enough food for one person for a day.

Barter Goods:

When you trade 1 kg of wheat with someone who needs it, mark off the wheat and take +1 forward to your next parley roll with them.

deck_list.name: Steel bars
deck_list.description:
Material:

When you use 1 kg of steel to craft or repair a weapon or armor, mark off the steel and you have enough material for the job.

Barter Goods:

When you trade 1 kg of steel with someone who needs it, mark off the steel and take +1 forward to your next parley roll with them.

deck_list.name: Gold bars
deck_list.description:
Money:

When you use 1 kg of gold to buy something, mark off the gold and you have enough money for the purchase. 1 kg of gold is equivalent to 1000 coins

deck_list.name: Basic Moves
deck_list.description: When a move is triggered, roll 1d20 plus the appropriate modifier, and follow the stated outcomes. On a miss (8 or less), something bad happens. On 9-15 you succeed with a but … On a 18-19 it’s a full success and on 20+ its a critical success. On advantage, roll 2d20 and pick the best result. On disadvantage, roll 2d20 and pick the worst result.

deck_list.name: Roll for Initiative
deck_list.description: When you start to get into a timed scene where each second matters, roll a 1d20. This number sets up the order in which the participants of the scene will act. A round is a period of time of 6 seconds during which all participants will have time to do one or more actions in that period of time. When a round is ended, a new one starts again until the timed scene ends.

deck_list.name: Delay Action
deck_list.description: When during a timed scene its your turn but you want to delay your action, you can state a condition for which you are waiting to happen. When that condition happens, you can do your action. If that conditions doesn’t happen before the round ends, you lose your action.

deck_list.name: I go first
deck_list.description: When during a timed scene round its not your turn but you want still to act in reaction to somebody’s else action, roll +DEX or +INT. On a  16-19, you move permanently move your turn order before somebody’s else turn and you make your action. On a 9-15 you permanently move your turn after somebody’s else turn and you make your action.

deck_list.name: Reaction
deck_list.description: When during a timed scene round during somebody else's turn you want to react and do something, the GM will ask you ‘What do you do?’, you spend a reaction and you do something (even attacking an opponent).  You have one single reaction per round and you regain it at the start of a new round. If something happens and you don’t have more reactions, it is assumed that your character is remaining still or is caught unaware.

deck_list.name: Damage
deck_list.description: When you deal damage, the damage its equal to your class damage die + the stat used for attacking + other modifiers. The enemy reduces the damage by its armor value. When you receive damage, the damage it’s equal to enemy damage - your armor value.

deck_list.name: Hack and Slash
deck_list.description:
When you attack with a melee weapon a single enemy, roll +STR: on a 20+ pick 3, on a 16-19, and pick 2, on a 9-15 pick 1:
  • You deal your damage
  • Your target loses their action for this round
  • You regain your reaction if you already used it

deck_list.name: Volley
deck_list.description:
When you launch a ranged attack, roll +DEX. On a 20+, pick 2. On a 16-19, pick 1:
  • You deal your damage
  • Your target loses their action for this round.
. On a 9-15, pick 1 but choose 1 from the list below
  • You have to move to get the shot, placing you in danger of the GM's choice
  • You have to take time to aim and reduce ammo by one
  • You hit an unintended target, such as an ally, for half damage

deck_list.name: Fire PointBlank
deck_list.description: When you use a ranged weapon against someone close enough to hurt you, roll+DEX. On a 16-19, you deal your damage. On a 9-15, also choose one: reduce ammo by one, they counterattack or deal damage, they take something away from you.

deck_list.name: Defy Danger (CHA)
deck_list.description: When you use your charisma to charm, bluff, or fit in with a dangerous situation, roll+CHA. On a 20+, you are able to sway the situation to your favor and gain an advantage. On a 9-15, you can navigate the danger, but only if you make a difficult choice: give up a valuable item, reveal a personal secret, or make a dangerous promise. On a miss, you are exposed as a fraud and the danger turns against you.

deck_list.name: Defy Danger (WILL)
deck_list.description: When you rely on your senses and exert your willpower to defy a danger, roll+WIS. On a 20+, you are able to overcome the danger and gain a deeper understanding of the situation. On a 9-15, you can resist the danger, but only if you make a risky choice: mark an experience, face a fear, or reveal a secret. On a miss, the danger overwhelms you.

deck_list.name: Defy Danger (INT)
deck_list.description: When you use your expertise to outsmart a danger, roll+INT. On a 20+, you are able to anticipate the danger and turn it to your advantage, learning something new and valuable in the process. On a 9-15, you can overcome the danger, but only if you make a difficult choice: sacrifice resources, reveal a weakness, or leave something behind. On a miss, your plan backfires and makes things worse.

deck_list.name: Defy Danger (CON)
deck_list.description: When you need to endure a danger and hold steady, roll+CON. On a 20+, you are able to push through the danger and come out on top, gaining an unexpected advantage. On a 9-15, you can endure the danger, but only if you make a hard choice: mark a debility, reveal a vulnerability, or expose someone else to danger. On a miss, you buckle under the pressure.

deck_list.name: Defy Danger (DEX)
deck_list.description: When you use your speed, agility, or finesse to avoid a danger, roll+DEX. On a 20+, you defy the danger and gain the upper hand in the situation. On a 9-15, you can avoid the danger, but only if you make a tough choice: leave something important behind, take harm or a debility, or reveal your position to a new threat. On a miss, the danger catches up with you.

deck_list.name: Defy Danger (STR)
deck_list.description: When you attempt to use brute force to defy a danger, roll+STR. On a 20+, you succeed with ease and gain an advantage in the situation. On a 9-15, you face a tough choice: suffer damage, end up in a bad spot, or put someone else in danger in order to overcome the danger. On a miss, the danger overcomes you.

deck_list.name: Aid
deck_list.description:
When you help or assist someone in a task, make a Defy Danger check. On a 16-19, they take +3 forward on their next action, and you take +3 forward against anyone who opposes them. On a 9-15, you succeed but you must choose one of the following:

You expose yourself to danger or complication.
You sacrifice something valuable to help them.
You make a mistake or miss something important, putting them in danger.

Choose one and describe how you aid them. On a miss, you still choose one, but the GM will also make a move.

deck_list.name: Defend
deck_list.description:
When you stand in defense of a person, item, or location under attack, roll+CON. ✴On a  16-19, hold 3. ✴On a 7–9, hold 1. So long as you stand in defense, when you or the thing you defend is attacked you may spend hold, 1 for 1, to choose an option:

Redirect an attack from the thing you defend, to yourself
Halve the attack’s effect or damage
Open up the attacker to an ally giving that ally +1 forward against the attacker
Deal damage to the attacker equal to your Strenght

deck_list.name: Discern Realities
deck_list.description:
When you hold on to a sensory impression or insight about a certain environment, roll +WIS: on a  16-19, hold 3; on a 9-15, hold 1. Spend your hold on any of the following questions, and take advantage on your next move that acts on the answers. On a failure, the GM will give you misleading information, or you will miss something important.

What went down here that someone is trying to cover up?
Who's the big player behind the scenes?
What are they planning to do next?
Who's got something to gain here?
What's the weakest point of this place?
What does this place smell like that nobody else seems to notice?
What here doesn't belong or match up with the rest?

deck_list.name: Spout Lore
deck_list.description:
When you hold on to a piece of knowledge or insight about a certain topic, roll+INT. On a  16-19 hold 3; on a 9-15 hold 1. Spend your hold on any of the following choices:

- You anticipate a danger related to the topic at hand, and gain +1 forward when acting on it.
- You remember a useful fact or detail that can help you in your current situation.
- You recognize a symbol or clue related to the topic, and gain +1 forward when investigating it.

On a failure, the GM will give you misleading information or you will forget something important that you thought you knew.

deck_list.name: Miss
deck_list.description: When you roll a miss, mark XP.

deck_list.name: Order Hirelings
deck_list.description:
Hirelings do what you tell them to, so long as it isn’t obviously dangerous, degrading, or stupid, and their cost is met. When a hireling finds themselves in a dangerous, degrading, or just flat-out crazy situation due to your orders roll+loyalty. 
On a  16-19 they stand firm and carry out the order. 
On a 7–9 they do it for now, but come back with serious demands later. Meet them or the hireling quits on the worst terms.

deck_list.name: Reality Check
deck_list.description:
When you study a situation or a person, trying to understand if it’s a reality or only an hallucination caused by your insanity, roll +INT. On a  16-19, hold 3. On a 9-15, hold 1. Spend your hold to ask the GM questions from the list below. 

- What here is real, and what is only in my mind?
- What will happen next, and is it a product of my delusion or an actual event?
- What should I do, to maintain my grip on reality?
- How can I tell if what I’m experiencing is real or just a hallucination?

On a 1-8, the GM chooses a hallucination that seems real and can manipulate the fiction accordingly. You also lose 1 sanity.

deck_list.name: Witness Horror
deck_list.description:
When you witness an otherworldly horror, learn a truth that shatters your reality or see an abhorrent act of brutality, roll +WIS. On a  16-19, the GM will tell you something interesting and you choose 1. On a 9-15, you choose 2. On a miss, you suffer all 3.

- You suffer a major emotional trauma and take -1 ongoing until you can come to terms with what you've seen.
- Fear takes hold of you and you hesitate, stumble, or freeze.
- You lose 1d6 / 1d12 / 1d20 morale depending on the gravity of the event. When it gets to 0, the character goes permanently insane.

When you try to understand rationally what just happened, roll +INT. On a  16-19, you fully understand what you have seen and go temporarily insane for 1d10 hours.

deck_list.name: Encumbrance
