deck_list.description:
Your load is 10 (which means 10 kgs). When you make a move while carrying weight equal to load+1 or load+2, you take -1. When you make a move while carrying weight greater than load+2, you have a choice: 
- drop at least 1 weight and roll at -1, or 
- automatically fail.

deck_list.name: Take a Rest
deck_list.description:
When you settle in to rest, answer the GMs questions about where and how are you resting. Then, each player (including the GM) asks one of the following questions of a character; that character’s player must answer honestly:
- What do you do during this rest that is so annoying/endearing?
- What do I do that you find so annoying/endearing?
- Who or what seems to be on your mind?
- What do we find ourselves talking about?
- What do you do to pass the time?
- What do you reveal about yourself that I/we hadn’t realized before?

The GM will decide what, if anything, happens during the rest (possibly asking you to roll the Die of Fate). When you’ve eaten something, drunk your fill, and gotten at least a few hours of rest, if you have enough XP you may level up. Then pick 1. If your rest was particularly comfortable, peaceful, or enjoyable, pick 1 more:
- Regain half Hit Points (HP)
- Regain half Magic Points (MP)
- Regain half Sanity Point (SP)
- Expend 1 use of an appropriate resource (rations, whisky, remedies, etc.) to clear a debility; everyone must agree that the resource makes sense
- Take +1 forward

deck_list.name: Level Up
deck_list.description:
In any moment, even during a combat, you can spend xp points for:
  • 3 xp: You receive 3 random feature cards of any color, choose one of them and acquire it. You can immediately use it.
  • 5 xp : Choose one crystal color. You receive 3 random feature cards of that color, choose one of them and acquire it. You can immediately use it.
  • 7 xp: Choose any feature card that requires one crystal and acquire it
  • 10 xp Choose any feature card that requires two crystal and acquire it.
  • 13 xp: Choose any feature card that requires three crystal and acquire it.

moves.moves_description: The War of the Dragons was a catastrophic event that shook the world in the 14th century, in which two factions of dragons, the Flamebreathers and the Frostwings, rose up against humanity and sparked a worldwide conflict that lasted for over a decade. The dragons were incredibly powerful, with a variety of abilities including fire and ice breath, flight, and immense physical strength. They were able to lay waste to entire cities and armies with ease, and even other fantasy races such as elves and dwarves were unable to withstand their power. The Flamebreathers were led by the great red dragon, Zephyros, and controlled much of southern Europe including the Iberian Peninsula and Italy, while the Frostwings were led by the powerful white dragon, Boreas, and dominated much of northern Europe including Scandinavia and Russia. The dragons had enslaved the orcs, using them as soldiers in their armies and forcing them to do their bidding. Humanity was led by a coalition of nations including England, France, and the Holy Roman Empire, and was supported by the elves of the Germanic regions and the dwarves of the Alpine region. Despite being vastly outnumbered and outmatched by the dragons, humanity was able to mount a formidable defense due to their ingenuity and tenacity. They employed a variety of tactics including the use of ballistae and trebuchets to take down the dragons in flight, and the use of enchanted weapons to penetrate their tough hides. The War of the Dragons was a turning point in the history of Europe and the world, with the dragons being defeated by humanity in the year 1378, thanks to the combined efforts of the various factions. The orcs were freed from their slavery, and the dragons were forced to retreat to their respective regions, where they remained for centuries to come.
You get +1 ongoing to spout lore and discern reality checks related to the War of the Dragons.

The Angels and Demon War was a cataclysmic conflict that took place in the year 0, according to legend. The war was fought between two powerful factions, the angels of heaven and the demons of hell. The conflict is said to have been sparked by a disagreement over the creation of humanity, with the angels believing that humans were created in the image of God, while the demons believed that humans were inferior creatures not worthy of God's love. The war lasted for centuries and devastated the entire world. Angels and demons alike waged fierce battles across the skies and on the earth, with entire cities and civilizations being destroyed in the process. The war ended in a stalemate, with neither side emerging as the clear victor. However, it is said that the angels and demons agreed to a truce, with the angels being given dominion over the heavens and the demons being confined to hell.
You get +1 ongoing to spout lore and discern reality checks related to the Angels and Demon War.

The Discovery of Magic was a pivotal moment in the history of the world, occurring around the year -3000. Prior to this event, magic was not known to exist and the world was much different than it is today. However, everything changed when a group of scholars stumbled upon an ancient text that revealed the existence of magic and how to harness its power.

The scholars were from different parts of the world, including Sumeria, Egypt, and India, and each brought their own knowledge and skills to the table. Together, they deciphered the text and began to experiment with the techniques and formulas described within. Over time, they were able to develop a system of magic that allowed them to wield incredible power, from summoning elemental creatures to manipulating time and space.

The Discovery of Magic had a profound impact on the world, leading to the rise of powerful empires and kingdoms that were able to dominate their rivals thanks to their mastery of magic. It also led to the creation of magical artifacts, such as enchanted swords and amulets, that could grant their wielders incredible abilities. However, the discovery also led to conflicts between those who wielded magic and those who did not, with some fearing the power of the magic-users and seeking to suppress or destroy them.
You get +1 ongoing to spout lore and discern reality checks related to magic and magical artifacts.

deck_list.name: Time Off
deck_list.description:
When the party spends 1 month in a certain area, choose one
  • You receive one training
    • ,
  • You receive an amount of gold equal to (CAR + Another ability of your choice) x 1d10 x 10
    • ,
  • Restore your HP to maximum and clear all your debilities

deck_list.name: Time Skip
deck_list.description:
When the party spends 1 year don't adventuring, choose one:
  • Receive one core training card
  • Receive 5 training cards

deck_list.name: Character Deck
deck_list.description: Each character has a deck with character, feature, background, destiny, and item cards. Character cards define their role and skills. Decks must have one active character card which defines the stats (hp,mp,sp,hd,md,sd) and abilities (str, dex, cos, int, wis, car) used. Feature cards describe special traits and in order to be usable you need to have at least a certain number of 'colored crystals', shown in the required field. If a feature card is being used, its called 'Active', if a card its not being used because you don't meet the requirements or you don't want it, its called 'Non-active'. Background cards describe training or heritages and are usually those cards that provide the bigger number of colored crystals. Destiny cards earn XP. Item cards represent equipment and they also could require colored crystals in order to use their abilities, but remember that not meeting the requirements doesn't mean that your character can't hold and try to use the item.

deck_list.name: Character Creation
deck_list.description: During character creation you start with a Starter Deck which is made of: 1 character card, 1 core training, 1 training, 2 features, 1 background, 1 species, 1 destiny, 5 common item cards. Starter Deck can be created randomly or you can create your own from all cards available.

deck_list.name: Last Breath
deck_list.description:
Last Breath
When you’re dying you catch a glimpse of what lies beyond the Black Gates of Death’s Kingdom (the GM will describe it). Then roll+Cos. 
On a  16-19 you’ve cheated death— you’re in a bad spot but you’re still alive. 
On a 7–9 Death will offer you a bargain. Take it and stabilize or refuse and pass beyond the Black Gates into whatever fate awaits you. On a miss, your fate is sealed. You’re marked as Death’s own and you’ll cross the threshold soon. The GM will tell you when. If you die, destroy all the cards in your character deck. When creating a new character, you get a new booster pack and you can use all the cards from your side deck acquired with previous characters.

deck_list.name: Summon Lupi, the Wolf Spirit
deck_list.description: When you call the Lupi Spirit to temporarily possess you, your body changes to adapt to it. You gain the ability to run and sense prey over long distances, including communicating with other wolves and regenerating from injuries. Your weakness is that silver is deadly. Your instinct is prone to pack mentality and loyalty. Roll+WIS. On a 16-19, the spirit quickly possesses you and without issue. On a 9-15, you it still possesses you, but you are put in a spot or draw unwanted attention. While the spirit is possessing you, you gain any innate abilities and weaknesses of the spirit. You also gain the Instinct of your spirit; if you try and ignore this primal urge or keep it in check, you must Defy Danger. You may stop the summoning at any time.

deck_list.name: Summon Arana, the Spider Spirit
deck_list.description: When you call the Arana Spirit to temporarily possess you, your body changes to adapt to it. You gain the ability to spin webs and climb, including injecting poison into prey and sensing vibrations. Your weakness is that fire is deadly. Your instinct is prone to trickery and manipulation. Roll+WIS. On a 16-19, the spirit quickly possesses you and without issue. On a 9-15, you it still possesses you, but you are put in a spot or draw unwanted attention. While the spirit is possessing you, you gain any innate abilities and weaknesses of the spirit. You also gain the Instinct of your spirit; if you try and ignore this primal urge or keep it in check, you must Defy Danger. You may stop the summoning at any time.

deck_list.name: Summon Panthera, the Cat spirit
deck_list.description: When you call the Panthera Spirit to temporarily possess you, your body changes to adapt to it. You gain the ability to stealthily hunt and pounce on prey, including seeing in the dark and regenerating from injuries. Your weakness is that silver is deadly. Your instinct is prone to territoriality and protectiveness. Roll+WIS. On a 16-19, the spirit quickly possesses you and without issue. On a 9-15, you it still possesses you, but you are put in a spot or draw unwanted attention. While the spirit is possessing you, you gain any innate abilities and weaknesses of the spirit. You also gain the Instinct of your spirit; if you try and ignore this primal urge or keep it in check, you must Defy Danger. You may stop the summoning at any time.

deck_list.name: Summon Oso, the Bear Spirit
deck_list.description: When you call the Oso Spirit to temporarily possess you, your body changes to adapt to it. You gain the ability to run and sense prey over long distances, including communicating with other bears and regenerating from injuries. Your weakness is that silver is deadly to you. Your instinct is to be prone to protectiveness and territoriality. Roll+WIS. On a 16-19, the spirit quickly possesses you and without issue. On a 9-15, you it still possesses you, but you are put in a spot or draw unwanted attention. While the spirit is possessing you, you gain any innate abilities and weaknesses of the spirit. You also gain the Instinct of your spirit; if you try and ignore this primal urge or keep it in check, you must Defy Danger. You may stop the summoning at any time.

deck_list.name: Summon Crocodilus, the Nile Spirit
deck_list.description: When you call the Crocodilus Spirit to temporarily possess you, your body changes to adapt to it. You gain the ability to swim and hide in water, including sensing prey and regenerating from injuries. Your weakness is that fire is deadly to you. Your instinct is to be prone to cunning and patience. Roll +WIS, On a 16-19, the spirit quickly possesses you and without issue. On a 9-15, you it still possesses you, but you are put in a spot or draw unwanted attention. While the spirit is possessing you, you gain any innate abilities and weaknesses of the spirit. You also gain the Instinct of your spirit; if you try and ignore this primal urge or keep it in check, you must Defy Danger. You may stop the summoning at any time.

deck_list.name: Mining Magic
deck_list.description:
Metallum:

When you cast this spell, you can sense the presence of metals within a 10-foot radius. This includes precious metals such as gold and silver, as well as base metals like iron and copper. You can also discern the purity of the metal and estimate its value.

Gemma:

When you cast this spell, you can detect the presence of gems within a 10-foot radius. You can determine the type of gem and estimate its value. You can also sense if the gem is enchanted or cursed.

Viam:

When you cast this spell, you can create a tunnel through earth and stone. The tunnel can be up to 10 feet in diameter and 100 feet in length. You can also create branching tunnels or intersecting tunnels.

Saxum:

When you cast this spell, you can manipulate stone and earth. You can cause rocks to move, shift the ground beneath someone's feet, or create a temporary barrier.

deck_list.name: Book of Blood Sacrifice
deck_list.description:
Sanguis:

When you cast this spell, you can sacrifice a living being to gain immense power. The amount of power gained depends on the strength of the sacrifice. The sacrificed being must be willing or subdued, and the caster must be willing to commit an act of murder.

Sacrificium:

When you cast this spell, you can summon a demon to do your bidding. The demon requires a sacrifice of a living being, and the strength of the demon summoned depends on the strength of the sacrifice. The sacrificed being must be willing or subdued, and the caster must be willing to commit an act of murder.

Potentia:

When you cast this spell, you can use the blood of a living being to create a powerful potion. The potency of the potion depends on the strength of the sacrifice. The sacrificed being must be willing or subdued, and the caster must be willing to commit an act of murder.

deck_list.name: Construction Magic
deck_list.description:
Structura:

When you cast this spell, you can create temporary structures out of nearby materials, such as wood, stone, or metal. These structures can be used for shelter, bridges, or even weapons. The size and complexity of the structure depends on the amount and type of materials available.

Materia:

When you cast this spell, you can manipulate the properties of nearby materials, such as hardness, flexibility, or conductivity. This can be useful for repairing or reinforcing structures, creating new materials, or even transforming objects.

Architectura:

When you cast this spell, you can create detailed plans and blueprints for complex structures, such as buildings, fortresses, or machines. These plans can be used to guide construction, estimate costs, or identify weaknesses.

Inginere:

When you cast this spell, you can control nearby machinery and tools, such as cranes, bulldozers, or drills. This can be useful for speeding up construction, fixing broken equipment, or even sabotaging enemy machinery.

deck_list.name: Astral Magic
deck_list.description:
Astralis:

When you cast this spell, you are able to project your consciousness into the astral realm. While there, you can travel great distances quickly, communicate with spirits and other entities, and even perceive events in the material realm from afar. However, your physical body is left behind and vulnerable to attack.

Spiritus:

When you cast this spell, you are able to summon a spirit from the astral realm to do your bidding. The spirit will obey your commands to the best of its abilities, but it may have its own agenda or personality quirks that can lead to unexpected results.

Communicare:

When you cast this spell, you are able to communicate with entities in the astral realm regardless of language barriers. This can be useful for gathering information or negotiating with spirits, but it can also lead to unintended consequences if you inadvertently make a bargain you don't fully understand.

Manipulare:

When you cast this spell, you are able to manipulate the astral energy around you. This can be used to create illusions, alter perceptions, or even manifest physical objects in the material realm. However, manipulating astral energy is a delicate process and can have unpredictable results if not done carefully.

deck_list.name: Farming Magic
deck_list.description:
Agricultura:

When you cast this spell, crops within a 10-foot radius will grow and mature instantly. This spell also protects crops from pests and disease.

Fructus:

When you cast this spell, the crop yield in a 10-foot radius is increased by 50%. This spell can be used on crops that are already harvested.

Terra:

When you cast this spell, the ground within a 10-foot radius becomes fertile and suitable for planting. This spell can also be used to remove unwanted vegetation or rocks.

Animal:

When you cast this spell, all animals within a 10-foot radius become healthier and more productive. This spell can also be used to communicate with animals.

deck_list.name: Watchman
deck_list.description: When investigating a crime or suspicious activity, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Agnir Spirit Possession
deck_list.description: When you call the Agnir Spirit to temporarily possess you, your body changes to adapt to it. You gain the ability to control and generate fire, including creating small flames or explosions and heating objects up to a certain temperature. Your weakness is that water is deadly to you. Your instinct is to be prone to anger and impulsiveness. Roll +WIS, on a 16-19, the spirit quickly possesses you and without issue. On a 9-15, you it still possesses you, but you are put in a spot or draw unwanted attention. While the spirit is possessing you, you gain any innate abilities and weaknesses of the spirit. You also gain the Instinct of your spirit; if you try and ignore this primal urge or keep it in check, you must Defy Danger. You may stop the summoning at any time.

deck_list.name: Apam Napatir Possession
deck_list.description: When you call the Apam Napatir Spirit to temporarily possess you, your body changes to adapt to it. You gain the ability to control and generate water, including manipulating its shape and flow and creating small waves or whirlpools. However, fire is deadly to you. In addition, you are prone to jealousy and envy. Roll +WIS, On a 16-19, the spirit quickly possesses you and without issue. On a 9-15, you it still possesses you, but you are put in a spot or draw unwanted attention. While the spirit is possessing you, you gain any innate abilities and weaknesses of the spirit. You also gain the Instinct of your spirit; if you try and ignore this primal urge or keep it in check, you must Defy Danger. You may stop the summoning at any time.

deck_list.name: Call of the Wild
deck_list.description:
When you summon nature’s beasts to your presence or to the presence of someone else, choose a type of animal and roll+WIS. On a 7+, they congregate at a location you choose. On a 9-15, choose 1:

  • It takes time for them to gather.
  • You are not precise about the location.
  • You attract other animals in addition to or instead of those you intended.

deck_list.name: Command Nature
deck_list.description: When you use Call of the Wild, you may instead attempt to call upon nature’s chosen - treants, wisps, fey, and other magical creatures.

deck_list.name: Eyes of the Tiger
deck_list.description: When you mark an animal with blood, mud, or dirt, you can see through its eyes as if they were your own, no matter what distance separates you. Only one animal may be marked in this way at a time.

deck_list.name: Weather Weaver
deck_list.description: When you are under open skies when the sun rises, the GM will ask you what the weather will be that day. Tell them whatever you like; it comes to pass.

deck_list.name: Rooted in Nature
deck_list.description:
When you stand perfectly still for a moment and listen to the world around you, roll +WIS. On a 16-19 hold 3. On a 9-15 hold 2. On a miss hold 1, but you draw unwelcome attention or put yourself in a spot.

While you hold at least 1 hold, you may spend it to:

  • Ask the GM one of the following questions: What here is of nature? What does nature want from me? How can I make nature help me?
  • Gain advantage on any roll that involves your connection to the natural world.

deck_list.name: Fungal Bloom
deck_list.description:
You call forth a burst of fungi from the ground beneath your feet, which can be used to obscure your movements or harm your enemies. Roll +INT and spend 1 mp.

  • On a 16-19 choose 3.
  • On a 9-15 choose 2.
  • On a miss, choose 1, but you expose yourself to danger.

You may:

  • Create an area of difficult terrain that lasts for a few minutes or until it is cleared.
  • Create a cloud of spores that obscures vision and smells bad, imposing a -1 penalty to all rolls for anyone within the area of effect.
  • Cause 1d6 damage to a target within range, as mushrooms burst from their flesh.
  • Summon a small army of fungus creatures to do your bidding.

deck_list.name: Thorn Whip
deck_list.description:
You conjure a thorny vine from thin air and lash out at your enemy. Roll +INT and spend 1 mp. On a 16-19, choose 2. On a 9-15, choose 1.

  • You deal damage to the target.
  • You pull the target closer to you.
  • You disarm the target, causing them to drop a weapon or other held item.
  • You entangle the target, preventing them from moving until they break free.

deck_list.name: Natures Bounty
deck_list.description:
You imbue a small plant or portion of nature with vitality and growth. Roll +WIS. On a 16-19, the plant grows and expands, providing a bounty of resources. On a 9-15, the plant grows, but attracts unwanted attention. On a miss, the plant becomes corrupted or diseased, withering away to nothing.

The plant may:

  • Provide healing properties when ingested.
  • Grow to tremendous size, forming a shelter or blockade.
  • Produce a rare or valuable resource (e.g. diamonds, gold, rare herbs).
  • Attract wildlife or elementals to your aid.

deck_list.name: Moonfire
deck_list.description:
You call upon the power of the moon, conjuring a bolt of silvery light to strike your enemy. Roll +WIS. On a 16-19, deal 1d10 damage and choose one. On a 9-15, deal 1d8 damage and choose one. On a miss, the spell backfires and deals 1d4 damage to you.

  • The target is blinded by the light, taking a -1 ongoing until they can clear their vision.
  • The spell creates an illusion that distracts or confuses the target.
  • The spell has a wider range or affects multiple targets.
  • The spell leaves a radiant residue that illuminates the area, providing better visibility for you and your allies.

deck_list.name: Thunderstorm
deck_list.description:
You call forth a raging thunderstorm to strike your enemies. Roll +INT and spend 1 mp. On a 16-19, deals double damage to all enemies in the area and choose one. On a 9-15, deals damage to all enemies in the area and choose one. On a miss, the spell backfires and deals damage to you and your allies.

  • The storm creates a deafening roar, making it difficult for enemies to communicate.
  • The storm causes the ground to become slick and muddy, making it difficult to move or maintain balance.
  • The storm generates powerful winds that knock enemies back or prevent them from moving forward.
  • The storm attracts lightning strikes, which may hit enemies or ignite nearby objects or structures.

deck_list.name: Barkskin
deck_list.description: You call upon the power of the forest to protect yourself from harm. Roll +CON. On a 16-19, your skin becomes tough as bark, giving you +2 armor. On a 9-15, your skin toughens, but you suffer a -1 ongoing to DEX until the spell wears off. On a miss, the spell backfires and you become vulnerable to nature-based attacks.

deck_list.name: Spirit Shield
deck_list.description: You call upon the spirits of nature to protect you and your allies. When you cast this spell, you and all allies within sight gain a Spirit Shield. The next time you or an ally takes damage, roll+WIS. ✴On a 16-19, the damage is negated. ✴On a 9-15, the damage is halved. After the shield has absorbed damage, it dissipates.

deck_list.name: Spirits Shed
deck_list.description: When you take damage while you are possessed by a spirit or you are shapeshifted into an animal, you may choose to forcibly stop it in order to negate the damage. If you do, you can’t use this ability again until you take the time to appeal to the spirits.

deck_list.name: Natures Balance
deck_list.description: When you deal damage, take 1 Balance. When you touch someone and channel the spirits of life, you may spend Balance. For each Balance spent, heal 1d6 HP. When you Make Camp or otherwise rest, lose all Balance.

deck_list.name: Mimicry Mastery
deck_list.description:
You can shapeshift into humanoid creatures of any size or shape, as long as they are the last being you touched or you touch an organic part of theirs (while they are still alive). Roll +WIS. On a 16-19, choose 3 and hold 3. On a 9-15, choose 2 and hold 2:
- You retain your mental faculties
- You gain the physical abilities of the creature (e.g., claws, wings, etc.)
- You gain the senses of the creature (e.g., night vision, acute hearing, etc.). On a miss, the GM chooses two options (you can't fail the shapeshifting).

. In addition, you gain the abilities and memories of any humanoid you shapeshift into, allowing you to mimic their speech, behavior, and knowledge. If you touch an organic part of the humanoid, the abilites and memories you acquire are only those that the humanoid possessed while the organic part was still attached to them.

While in humanoid form, on any failed roll you make you lose 1 hold. When you lose all holds, you are unable to keep your own identity separated from that of the humanoid you take the form of and you start believing of being that humanoid. When you go to 0 HP while in humanoid form, you regain your humanoid form. You can return to your normal form at any time (while you are still in control.)

deck_list.name: Skin of the Earth
deck_list.description:
When you touch a creature of the earth (like a giant ant, rock golem or a treant) or an organic piece of them (while they are stil alive), you can shapeshift into that creature. The form can be as big as a bear or as small as a mice. Roll +WIS. On a 16-19, choose 3 and hold 3. On a 9-15, choose 2 and hold 2:
- You retain your mental faculties
- You gain the physical abilities of the creature (e.g., claws, wings, etc.)
- You gain the senses of the creature (e.g., night vision, acute hearing, etc.). On a miss, the GM chooses two options (you can't fail the shapeshifting).

The size of the creature can affect your health and damage. If the creature is larger than your humanoid form, your HP is doubled and your hit damage (HD) becomes 2d6. If the creature is smaller, your HP becomes 3 and your hit damage (HD) becomes 1. If the creature is faster than your humanoid form, you gain +3 to DEX rolls. While in creature form, on any failed roll you make you lose 1 hold. When you lose all holds, yu are unable to control the creature instincts and you remain stuck in that creature form. When you go to 0 HP while in creature form, you regain your humanoid form. You can return to your normal form at any time (while you are still in control.

deck_list.name: Flame Form
deck_list.description:
When you touch a creature of fire, such as a fire elemental, a salamander, or a phoenix, or an organic piece of them (while they are stil alive), you can shapeshift into that creature. The form can be as big as a bear or as small as a mice. Roll +WIS. On a 16-19, choose 3 and hold 3. On a 9-15, choose 2 and hold 2:
- You retain your mental faculties
- You gain the physical abilities of the creature (e.g., claws, wings, etc.)
- You gain the senses of the creature (e.g., night vision, acute hearing, etc.). On a miss, the GM chooses two options (you can't fail the shapeshifting).

The size of the creature can affect your health and damage. If the creature is larger than your humanoid form, your HP is doubled and your hit damage (HD) becomes 2d6. If the creature is smaller, your HP becomes 3 and your hit damage (HD) becomes 1. If the creature is faster than your humanoid form, you gain +3 to DEX rolls. While in creature form, on any failed roll you make you lose 1 hold. When you lose all holds, yu are unable to control the creature instincts and you remain stuck in that creature form. When you go to 0 HP while in creature form, you regain your humanoid form. You can return to your normal form at any time (while you are still in control.

deck_list.name: Storm Shape
deck_list.description:
When you touch a creature of air, such as a storm giant, a djinni, or a griffon. or an organic piece of them (while they are stil alive), you can shapeshift into that creature. The form can be as big as a bear or as small as a mice. Roll +WIS. On a 16-19, choose 3 and hold 3. On a 9-15, choose 2 and hold 2:
- You retain your mental faculties
- You gain the physical abilities of the creature (e.g., claws, wings, etc.)
- You gain the senses of the creature (e.g., night vision, acute hearing, etc.). On a miss, the GM chooses two options (you can't fail the shapeshifting).

The size of the creature can affect your health and damage. If the creature is larger than your humanoid form, your HP is doubled and your hit damage (HD) becomes 2d6. If the creature is smaller, your HP becomes 3 and your hit damage (HD) becomes 1. If the creature is faster than your humanoid form, you gain +3 to DEX rolls. While in creature form, on any failed roll you make you lose 1 hold. When you lose all holds, yu are unable to control the creature instincts and you remain stuck in that creature form. When you go to 0 HP while in creature form, you regain your humanoid form. You can return to your normal form at any time (while you are still in control.

deck_list.name: Wave Walker
deck_list.description:
When you touch a creature of water, such as a merfolk, a water elemental, or a sea serpent; or an organic piece of them (while they are stil alive), you can shapeshift into that creature. The form can be as big as a bear or as small as a mice. Roll +WIS. On a 16-19, choose 3 and hold 3. On a 9-15, choose 2 and hold 2:
- You retain your mental faculties
- You gain the physical abilities of the creature (e.g., claws, wings, etc.)
- You gain the senses of the creature (e.g., night vision, acute hearing, etc.). On a miss, the GM chooses two options (you can't fail the shapeshifting).

The size of the creature can affect your health and damage. If the creature is larger than your humanoid form, your HP is doubled and your hit damage (HD) becomes 2d6. If the creature is smaller, your HP becomes 3 and your hit damage (HD) becomes 1. If the creature is faster than your humanoid form, you gain +3 to DEX rolls. While in creature form, on any failed roll you make you lose 1 hold. When you lose all holds, yu are unable to control the creature instincts and you remain stuck in that creature form. When you go to 0 HP while in creature form, you regain your humanoid form. You can return to your normal form at any time (while you are still in control.

deck_list.name: Hide from Animals Potion
deck_list.description:
Hide from Animals:

Drinking this potion grants the imbiber the ability to avoid detection by animals. The imbiber gains the Hide from Animals effect for 1 hour, which makes them undetectable by normal animals such as wolves, bears, or deer. This does not protect against magical or supernatural creatures or animals that have been trained or enchanted to detect specific scents or movements.

deck_list.name: Hide from Undead Potion
deck_list.description:
Hide from Undead:

Drinking this potion grants the imbiber the ability to avoid detection by undead creatures. The imbiber gains the Hide from Undead effect for 1 hour, which makes them undetectable by most undead creatures such as zombies, skeletons, or ghosts. This does not protect against powerful or intelligent undead creatures or those that have been specifically trained or enchanted to detect living beings.

deck_list.name: Shadow Dance
deck_list.description:
When you move with such grace and agility that you seem to disappear from sight, spend 1 or more combo points for these options (you can take the same multiple times):
  • You can move across any surface, including liquids, for 5 seconds.
  • you become invisible to all but magical senses, for 1 second.
  • you deal an extra 1d6 damage on your next attack
  • you gain +1 forward to Defy Danger or Hack and Slash.

deck_list.name: Jump Potion
deck_list.description:
Jump:

Drinking this potion grants the imbiber the ability to jump incredible distances. The imbiber gains the Jump effect for 1 hour, which allows them to jump up to 10 times their normal distance and height without suffering any harm or exhaustion. This does not grant the imbiber the ability to fly or levitate, nor does it protect,against falls or other hazards that might result from jumping such great distances.

deck_list.name: Mage Armor Potion
deck_list.description:
Mage Armor:

Drinking this potion creates a magical aura around the imbiber that protects them from harm. The imbiber gains the Mage Armor effect for 1 hour, which grants them a +3 bonus to their Armor Class. This does not stack with other magical armor effects and does not protect against magical attacks or effects that bypass normal armor.

deck_list.name: Magic Fang Potion
deck_list.description:
Magic Fang:

Drinking this potion enhances the imbiber\'s natural weapons or unarmed strikes with magical power. The imbiber gains the Magic Fang effect for 1 hour, which grants their natural weapons or unarmed strikes a +1 bonus to hit and damage. This does not affect weapons or attacks that are already magical in nature.

deck_list.name: Magic Stone Oil
deck_list.description:
Magic Stone:

Applying this oil to a sling bullet or other small stone imbues it with magical power. The imbued stone gains the Magic Stone effect for 1 hour, which grants it a +1 bonus to hit and damage. The imbued stone also deals an additional 1d6 magical damage to the target. This effect lasts for one hit, after which the stone becomes a normal stone again. Only one stone can be imbued with this effect at a time.

deck_list.name: Magic Weapon Oil
deck_list.description:
Magic Weapon:

Applying this oil to a non, magical weapon imbues it with magical power. The imbued weapon gains the Magic Weapon effect for 1 hour, which grants it a +1 bonus to hit and damage. The imbued weapon also deals an additional 1d6 magical damage to the target. This effect lasts for one hit, after which the weapon becomes a normal weapon again. Only one weapon can be imbued with this effect at a time.

deck_list.name: Pass without Trace Potion
deck_list.description:
Pass without Trace:

Drinking this potion makes the imbiber nearly impossible to track. The imbiber gains the Pass without Trace effect for 1 hour, which grants them a +10 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to avoid detection. The imbiber also leaves no tracks or scent and cannot be tracked by non-magical means.

deck_list.name: Protection from (Alignment) Potion
deck_list.description:
Protection from (Alignment):

Drinking this potion grants the imbiber protection from a specific alignment. Choose one of the following: Chaos, Evil, Good, or Law. The imbiber gains the Protection from (Alignment) effect for 1 hour, which grants them advantage on saving throws against spells and other effects created by creatures of the chosen alignment. The imbiber also cannot be charmed, frightened, or possessed by creatures of the chosen alignment.

deck_list.name: Remove Fear Potion
deck_list.description:
Remove Fear:

Drinking this potion banishes fear from the imbiber\'s heart. The imbiber gains the Remove Fear effect for 1 hour, which grants them immunity to fear effects and allows them to remove the frightened condition from one creature they touch as an action. The imbiber is still vulnerable to other forms of mental manipulation and is not immune to the effects of fear caused by physical threats or danger.

deck_list.name: Sanctuary Potion
deck_list.description:
Sanctuary:

Drinking this potion imbues the imbiber with a sense of divine protection. The imbiber gains the Sanctuary effect for 1 hour, which allows them to create a 30-foot radius aura of protection centered on themselves. The aura lasts for 1 minute and moves with the imbiber. Any friendly creature within the aura gains advantage on saving throws against spells and other effects created by creatures outside the aura. The imbiber cannot attack or cast spells while maintaining the aura and the effect ends if the imbiber attacks or casts a spell.

deck_list.name: Shield of Faith Potion
deck_list.description:
Shield of Faith:

Drinking this potion imbues the imbiber with a shimmering field of divine energy. The imbiber gains the Shield of Faith effect for 1 hour, which grants them a +2 bonus to AC. The imbiber also has advantage on saving throws against spells and other effects created by undead creatures. The effect ends if the imbiber casts a spell or attacks.

deck_list.name: Shillelagh Oil
deck_list.description: This magical oil can be applied to a club or staff to transform it into a powerful magical weapon. For the next minute, the weapon glows with a greenish light and deals an extra 1d8 damage to its target. In addition, the weapon becomes magical, allowing it to bypass resistances to non-magical attacks.

deck_list.name: Bless Weapon Oil
deck_list.description: This holy oil can be applied to a weapon to imbue it with the power of the gods. For the next minute, the weapon glows with a radiant light and deals an extra 1d6 radiant damage to undead and fiends. In addition, the weapon becomes magical, allowing it to bypass resistances to non-magical attacks.

deck_list.name: Potion of Enlarge Person
deck_list.description: This potion causes the person who drinks it to grow to twice their normal size. While enlarged, the person gains +2 to their damage rolls, and they can lift and carry twice as much weight. However, they also become slower and more cumbersome, suffering a -2 penalty to their DEX score and reducing their movement speed by half.

deck_list.name: Potion of Reduce Person
deck_list.description: This potion causes the person who drinks it to shrink to half their normal size. While reduced, the person gains +2 to their,AC score, and they become more nimble and agile, gaining a +2 bonus to their DEX score and doubling their movement speed. However, they also suffer a -2 penalty to their STR score and can only carry half as much weight.

deck_list.name: Potion of Aid
deck_list.description: This potion provides a burst of energy and vitality to the person who drinks it. For the next minute, the person gains +10 temporary hit points, and they can add a +2 bonus to their attack rolls, damage rolls, and saving throws. In addition, they become immune to fear and gain advantage on all Wisdom (Perception) checks.

deck_list.name: Potion of Barkskin
deck_list.description: This potion toughens the skin of the person who drinks it, providing natural armor protection. For the next minute, the person gains a +2 bonus to their AC score, and they become resistant to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. However, they also become slower and less agile, suffering a -2 penalty to their DEX score.

deck_list.name: Potion of Bears Endurance
deck_list.description: This potion imbues the person who drinks it with the endurance and strength of a bear. For the next minute, the person gains +4 to their Constitution score, increasing their maximum hit points and improving their resistance, to poisons, diseases, and other harmful effects. In addition, they gain advantage on all Constitution checks and saving throws. However, they also become more sluggish and slow, suffering a -2 penalty to their DEX score.

deck_list.name: Potion of Superior Resist Energy
deck_list.description:
Resist Energy:

When you drink the potion of resist energy, you gain resistance to a specific energy type for the next hour. Choose one of the following energy types: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. You gain resistance 20 against that energy type. If you are already resistant to that energy type, your resistance increases by 10 instead.

deck_list.name: Potion of Cure Serious Wounds
deck_list.description:
Cure Serious Wounds:

When you drink the potion of cure serious wounds, you regain 3d8+3 hit points.

deck_list.name: Oil of Daylight
deck_list.description:
Daylight:

When you apply the oil of daylight to a weapon or other object, it emits bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 60 feet for the next hour.

deck_list.name: Potion of Displacement
deck_list.description:
Displacement:

When you drink the potion of displacement, you become displaced for the next minute. Attacks against you have a 50% miss chance, as if you had the displacement spell cast upon you.

deck_list.name: Potion of Blur
deck_list.description:
Blur:

When you drink the potion of blur, you become hard to see and your movements appear blurred. For the next hour, you gain +1 to your Dexterity and your enemies have disadvantage on their attacks against you. However, you also have disadvantage on your attacks.

deck_list.name: Potion of Bulls Strength
deck_list.description:
Bull\'s Strength:

When you drink the potion of bull\'s strength, you feel your muscles bulge and your veins pump with power. For the next hour, you gain +2 to your Strength and your damage with melee weapons is increased by one dice size. However, you also have disadvantage on your Dexterity-based rolls.

deck_list.name: Potion of Cats Grace
deck_list.description:
Cat\'s Grace:

When you drink the potion of cat\'s grace, you become light and agile like a cat. For the next hour, you gain +2 to your Dexterity and your jumping distance is doubled. However, you also have disadvantage on your Strength-based rolls.

deck_list.name: Potion of Cure Moderate Wounds
deck_list.description:
Cure Moderate Wounds:

When you drink the potion of cure moderate wounds, your injuries start to heal and your pain subsides. You regain 2d8+3 hit points.

deck_list.name: Oil of Darkness
deck_list.description:
Darkness:

When you apply the oil of darkness on, your weapon or armor, it emanates a thick darkness that can obscure even the brightest light. For the next hour, you have advantage on your stealth rolls and your attacks against enemies that rely on vision, but you also have disadvantage on your perception and investigation rolls.

deck_list.name: Potion of Darkvision
deck_list.description:
Darkvision:

When you drink the potion of darkvision, your eyes adjust to darkness and you can see as if it were dim light. For the next hour, you gain darkvision up to 60 feet, and you can see in total darkness as if it were dim light. However, your sensitivity to light is increased, and you have disadvantage on your rolls that involve bright light.

deck_list.name: Potion of Delay Poison
deck_list.description:
Delayed Reaction:

When you drink this potion, you become immune to any poison for the next hour. If you\'re already poisoned, the potion gives you a chance to delay the effects of the poison, giving you +1 to your Defy Danger rolls to resist the poison\'s effects. However, after the hour is over, you must immediately Defy Danger again to avoid the poison\'s effects.

deck_list.name: Potion of Eagles Splendor
deck_list.description:
Graceful Confidence:

When you drink this potion, you gain a +2 bonus to your charisma for the next hour. This bonus applies to your Charisma-based moves and interactions with NPCs.

deck_list.name: Potion of Foxs Cunning
deck_list.description:
Clever Mind:

When you drink this potion, you gain a +2 bonus to your intelligence for the next hour. This bonus applies to your Intelligence-based moves and spells.

deck_list.name: Potion of Invisibility
deck_list.description:
Vanishing Act:

When you drink this potion, you become invisible for the next hour. While invisible, you can still be heard, smelled, or touched, but you cannot be seen. Attacking or casting a spell will break your invisibility. Also, if you interact with an object or creature, you must roll +Dex to avoid revealing your location.

deck_list.name: Potion of Lesser restoration
deck_list.description:
Lesser Restoration:

When you drink the potion of lesser restoration, you feel a surge of energy and vitality. You immediately recover from one of the following conditions: dazed, dazzled, fatigued, nauseated, shaken, or sickened.

deck_list.name: Potion of Levitate
deck_list.description:
Levitate:

When you drink the potion of levitate or apply the oil, you gain the ability to levitate off the ground. You can float up to 20 feet in any direction and can hover in place. The effect lasts for 10 minutes.

deck_list.name: Potion of Misdirection
deck_list.description:
Misdirection:

When you drink the potion of misdirection, you become harder to hit. For the next hour, you gain a +2 bonus to your AC against all attacks.

deck_list.name: Potion of Owls wisdom
deck_list.description:
Owl\'s Wisdom:

When you drink the potion of owl\'s wisdom, you become wiser and more insightful. For the next hour, you gain a +2 bonus to your Wisdom score, which affects your spellcasting and some other moves.

deck_list.name: Potion of Protection from arrows
deck_list.description:
Protection from Arrows:

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to non-magical arrows. For the next 10 minutes, you take half damage from all attacks made by ranged weapons.

deck_list.name: Potion of Remove paralysis
deck_list.description:
Remove Paralysis:

When you drink this potion, you are cured of all forms of paralysis. If you are currently paralyzed, you can immediately take an action.

deck_list.name: Potion of Resist Energy
deck_list.description:
Resist Energy:

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to a specific type of energy for the next 10 minutes. Choose one of the following types of energy: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. You take half damage from all attacks of that type of energy.

deck_list.name: Potion of Spider climb
deck_list.description:
Spider Climb:

When you drink this potion, you gain the ability to climb walls and ceilings like a spider. You can climb at your normal speed and do not need to make Defy Danger rolls to do so. The effect lasts for 1 hour.

deck_list.name: Potion of Undetectable alignment
deck_list.description:
Undetectable Alignment:

When you drink this potion, your alignment becomes impossible to detect by magical or mundane means for 1 hour.

deck_list.name: Potion of Superior Barkskin
deck_list.description:
Barkskin:

When you drink this potion, your skin becomes as tough as bark. You gain +3 armor for 1 hour.

deck_list.name: Potion of Superior Shield of Faith
deck_list.description:
Shield of Faith:

When you drink this potion, a shimmering shield of force appears around you. You gain +4 to your AC for 1 hour.
deck_list.header_image: Potion of Superior Shield of Faith.png

deck_list.name: Flame arrow (oil)
deck_list.description:
Flame Arrow:

This oil imbues a single arrow (or similar projectile) with magical fire, allowing it to deal an extra 1d6 fire damage on a hit. The fire also ignites any flammable material it hits. The oil is consumed when the arrow is fired.

deck_list.name: Fly (potion)
deck_list.description:
Flight:

When you drink this potion, you gain the ability to fly at a speed of 30 feet (9 meters) per round for the next hour. You can fly up to 1000 feet (305 meters) above the ground and maneuver in any direction. At the end of the hour, you fall gently to the ground.

deck_list.name: Gaseous form (potion)
deck_list.description:
Ethereal Form:

When you drink this potion, you become insubstantial and can pass through solid objects as if they were not there. You can also move through small spaces and under doors. The effect lasts for up to 10 minutes or until you attack or are attacked. You cannot manipulate objects or interact with the physical world while in this form.

deck_list.name: Potion of Greater Magic Fang +1
deck_list.description:
Greater Magic Fang +1:

When you drink this potion, your natural weapons gain a +1 enhancement bonus for the next hour. This bonus applies to attack rolls and damage rolls.

deck_list.name: Oil of Greater Magic Weapon +1
deck_list.description:
Greater Magic Weapon +1:

When you apply this oil to a weapon, it gains a +1 enhancement bonus for the next hour. This bonus applies to attack rolls and damage rolls.

deck_list.name: Potion of Haste
deck_list.description:
Haste:

When you drink this potion, you gain the effects of the haste spell for the next minute. This means you gain an extra action on each of your turns, which can be used for attacking, moving, or performing other actions. You also gain a +1 bonus to AC and reflex saves, and a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls.

deck_list.name: Potion of Heroism
deck_list.description:
Heroic Boost:

When you drink the potion of heroism, you feel a surge of courage and strength. For the next hour, you gain +1 to all your rolls and you can mark one additional option when you hack and slash or volley. You also ignore the effects of fear, pain, and exhaustion. However, after the hour is over, you suffer a -1 ongoing to all your rolls until you rest.

deck_list.name: Keen edge (oil)
deck_list.description:
Keen Edge:

When you apply this oil to a bladed weapon, it becomes incredibly sharp. The weapon gains the \'precise\' and \'messy\' tags for the next hour. Additionally, when you roll a 16-19 on a Hack and Slash with this weapon, you may choose to deal an extra 1d4 damage or disarm your foe.

deck_list.name: Magic circle against (alignment) (potion)
deck_list.description:
Magic Circle:

When you drink this potion, you create a Domain of protection against a specific alignment (chaos, evil, good, or law) around you. The circle has a radius of 10 feet and lasts for 1 hour. Creatures of the specified alignment cannot enter the circle by non-magical means. Any attempt to do so will cause them pain and they will be unable to cross the circle\'s boundary. Additionally, any summoned creatures of the specified alignment are banished back to their own plane of existence if they try to enter the circle.

deck_list.name: Magic vestment +1 (oil)
deck_list.description:
Magic Vestment:

When you apply this oil to a piece of armor, it becomes magically enchanted. For the next hour, the armor gains a +1 bonus to its AC. Additionally, if the armor has any special properties (such as being made of mithril), those properties are enhanced for the duration of the oil\'s effect.

deck_list.name: Neutralize poison
deck_list.description:
Neutralize Poison:

When you drink the potion of neutralize poison, you feel a sudden relief. This potion cures the effects of any poison or venom currently affecting you.

deck_list.name: Nondetection
deck_list.description:
Nondetection:

When you drink the potion of nondetection, you feel your senses become duller. For the next hour, you are immune to scrying and divination spells, and any attempts to detect your location or presence by magical or non-magical means automatically fail.

deck_list.name: Protection from energy (type)
deck_list.description:
Protection from Energy (Type):

When you drink the potion of protection from energy, you feel a warm energy wrap around you. For the next hour, you gain resistance to a specific energy type (acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder) of your choice. You have resistance 10 against that energy type, and you also have advantage on saving throws against spells and effects that deal that type of damage.

deck_list.name: Rage
deck_list.description:
Rage:

When you drink the potion of rage, you feel an intense surge of power. For the next minute, you have advantage on all your attacks, deal extra damage equal to your level, and have resistance to all damage. However, after the minute is over, you suffer a level of exhaustion.

deck_list.name: Goblin
deck_list.description:
Goblin Tactics:

When you encounter a goblin, roll +Wis. On a 16-19, you spot their ambush or trap before it’s too late. On a 9-15, you spot it but not before it’s sprung. On a miss, you walk right into it and suffer the consequences.

Goblin Frenzy:

When you fight a goblin, roll +Str. On a 16-19, you deal your damage and the goblin flees or surrenders. On a 9-15, you deal your damage but the goblin fights back with ferocity, dealing its damage to you. On a miss, the goblin calls for reinforcements or tries to stab you in the back.

deck_list.name: Goblin Shaman
deck_list.description:
Goblin Magic:

When you encounter a goblin shaman, roll +Int. On a 16-19, you recognize their spells and can counter them with your own magic. On a 9-15, you recognize their spells but they have a trick up their sleeve. On a miss, you are caught off guard by their magic and suffer the effects.

Goblin Curse:

When you fight a goblin shaman, roll +Con. On a 16-19, you resist their curse and deal your damage. On a 9-15, you resist their curse but it leaves a mark on you. The GM will tell you what it is. On a miss, you are cursed and take -1 ongoing to all your rolls until you remove it.

deck_list.name: Goblin Chieftain
deck_list.description:
Goblin Leadership:

When you encounter a goblin chieftain, roll +Cha. On a 16-19, you can intimidate or persuade them to do what you want. On a 9-15, you can negotiate with them but they want something in return. On a miss, they laugh at you and order their minions to attack.

Goblin Challenge:

When you fight a goblin chieftain, roll +Str. On a 16-19, you deal your damage and the chieftain respects your strength. They may offer you a truce or a reward. On a 9-15, you deal your damage but the chieftain fights back with cunning, dealing their damage to you. On a miss, the chieftain mocks you and calls for reinforcements.

deck_list.name: Goblin Berserker
deck_list.description:
Goblin Rage:

When you encounter a goblin berserker, roll +Wis. On a 16-19, you calm them down or avoid their attention. On a 9-15, you anger them or attract their attention. On a miss, you enrage them and they charge at you.

Goblin Fury:

When you fight a goblin berserker, roll +Dex. On a 16-19, you deal your damage and dodge their attack. On a 9-15, you deal your damage but the berserker hits you hard, dealing their damage to you. On a miss, the berserker goes into a frenzy and deals +1d4 damage to you and anyone nearby.

deck_list.name: Sahuagin
deck_list.description:
Sahuagin Ambush:

When you enter a sahuagin’s territory, roll +Wis. On a 16-19, you notice their signs and avoid their ambush. On a 9-15, you notice their signs but they have already prepared their ambush. On a miss, you are caught unaware by their ambush and suffer the consequences.

Sahuagin Bite:

When you fight a sahuagin in melee, roll +Str. On a 16-19, you deal your damage and the sahuagin backs off. On a 9-15, you deal your damage but the sahuagin bites you with its sharp teeth, dealing its damage to you. On a miss, the sahuagin bites you and tries to drag you underwater.

deck_list.name: Sahuagin Shaman
deck_list.description:
Sahuagin Ritual:

When you encounter a sahuagin shaman, roll +Int. On a 16-19, you disrupt their ritual and gain an advantage over them. On a 9-15, you disrupt their ritual but they have already invoked some of its effects. On a miss, you are too late to stop their ritual and suffer the effects.

Sahuagin Hex:

When you fight a sahuagin shaman, roll +Con. On a 16-19, you resist their hex and deal your damage. On a 9-15, you resist their hex but it weakens you. The GM will tell you how. On a miss, you are hexed and take -1 ongoing to all your rolls until you remove it.

deck_list.name: Sahuagin Knight
deck_list.description:
Sahuagin Honor:

When you encounter a sahuagin knight, roll +Cha. On a 16-19, you can challenge them to a duel or offer them a tribute. On a 9-15, you can challenge them to a duel or offer them a tribute but they demand something more. On a miss, they reject your offer and order their minions to attack.

Sahuagin Duel:

When you fight a sahuagin knight in a duel, roll +Str. On a 16-19, you deal your damage and the knight yields or dies. On a 9-15, you deal your damage but the knight wounds you, dealing their damage to you. On a miss, the knight defeats you and decides your fate.

deck_list.name: Sahuagin Mutant
deck_list.description:
Sahuagin Abomination:

When you encounter a sahuagin mutant, roll +Wis. On a 16-19, you identify their mutation and know how to exploit it. On a 9-15, you identify their mutation but it gives them an advantage over you. On a miss, you are horrified by their mutation and suffer the consequences.

Sahuagin Devour:

When you fight a sahuagin mutant in melee, roll +Dex. On a 16-19, you deal your damage and avoid their bite. On a 9-15, you deal your damage but the mutant bites you with its monstrous jaws, dealing its damage to you. On a miss, the mutant bites you and tries to swallow you whole.

deck_list.name: Fire Elemental
deck_list.description:
Fire Storm:

The fire elemental conjures a storm of fire around you. Roll +Int to find a way out. On a 16-19, you escape the storm unharmed. On a 9-15, you escape the storm but take 1d4 damage or lose something valuable. On a miss, you are trapped in the storm and take 1d8 damage.

Fire Blast:

The fire elemental shoots a blast of fire at you. Roll +Dex to dodge it. On a 16-19, you avoid the blast and deal your damage. On a 9-15, you avoid the blast but the elemental gets closer to you. On a miss, you are hit by the blast and take 1d8 damage and catch on fire.

deck_list.name: Water Elemental
deck_list.description:
Water Surge:

The water elemental creates a surge of water that sweeps you away. Roll +Str to resist it. On a 16-19, you stand your ground and deal your damage. On a 9-15, you stand your ground but take 1d4 damage or lose something valuable. On a miss, you are swept away and take 1d6 damage.

Water Blast:

The water elemental shoots a blast of water at you. Roll +Dex to dodge it. On a 16-19, you avoid the blast and deal your damage. On a 9-15, you avoid the blast but the elemental gets closer to you. On a miss, you are hit by the blast and take 1d6 damage and are knocked back or off balance.

deck_list.name: Vampire Lord
deck_list.description:
Vampire Charm:

The vampire lord tries to charm you with their gaze. Roll +Cha to resist it. On a 16-19, you shake off their charm and can act freely. On a 9-15, you shake off their charm but they have an influence over you. The GM will tell you what it is. On a miss, you are charmed by them and will do anything they ask.

Vampire Bite:

The vampire lord tries to bite you with their fangs. Roll +Con to resist it. On a 16-19, you fend them off and deal your damage. On a 9-15, you fend them off but they wound you, dealing their damage to you and draining your blood. The GM will tell you what it does. On a miss, they bite you and drain your blood until you are unconscious or dead.

deck_list.name: Ancient Blue Dragon
deck_list.description:
Dragon Storm:

The ancient blue dragon conjures a thunderstorm around you. Roll +Int to find a way out. On a 16-19, you escape the storm unharmed. On a 9-15, you escape the storm but take 1d6 damage or lose something valuable. On a miss, you are trapped in the storm and take 1d10 damage.

Lightning Breath:

The ancient blue dragon shoots a blast of lightning at you. Roll +Dex to dodge it. On a 16-19, you avoid the blast and deal your damage. On a 9-15, you avoid the blast but the dragon gets closer to you. On a miss, you are hit by the blast and take 1d10 damage and are stunned.

deck_list.name: Salamander Warrior
deck_list.description:
Salamander Ambush:

The salamander warrior hides in the flames and waits for you. Roll +Wis to spot them. On a 16-19, you notice them and avoid their ambush. On a 9-15, you notice them but they have already prepared their ambush. On a miss, you are caught unaware by their ambush and suffer the consequences.

Salamander Strike:

The salamander warrior strikes at you with their flaming spear. Roll +Str to resist it. On a 16-19, you fend them off and deal your damage. On a 9-15, you fend them off but they wound you, dealing their damage to you and setting you on fire. On a miss, they strike you and deal +1d4 damage to you and set you on fire.

deck_list.name: Salamander Pyromancer
deck_list.description:
Salamander Magic:

The salamander pyromancer casts a fire spell at you. Roll +Int to counter it. On a 16-19, you negate their spell and deal your damage. On a 9-15, you negate their spell but they have another one ready. On a miss, you are hit by their spell and suffer the effects.

Salamander Burn:

The salamander pyromancer burns you with their touch. Roll +Con to resist it. On a 16-19, you shake off their touch and deal your damage. On a 9-15, you shake off their touch but they scorch you, dealing their damage to you and setting you on fire. On a miss, they burn you and deal +1d4 damage to you and set you on fire.

deck_list.name: Vampire Spawn
deck_list.description:
Vampire Stealth:

The vampire spawn hides in the shadows and waits for you. Roll +Wis to spot them. On a 16-19, you notice them and avoid their surprise attack. On a 9-15, you notice them but they have already struck. On a miss, you are caught unaware by their surprise attack and suffer the consequences.

Vampire Bite:

The vampire spawn tries to bite you with their fangs. Roll +Con to resist it. On a 16-19, you fend them off and deal your damage. On a 9-15, you fend them off but they wound you, dealing their damage to you and draining your blood. The GM will tell you what it does. On a miss, they bite you and drain your blood until you are unconscious or turned.

deck_list.name: Centaur Warrior
deck_list.description:
Centaur Charge:

The centaur warrior charges at you with their spear. Roll +Dex to avoid it. On a 16-19, you dodge their charge and deal your damage. On a 9-15, you dodge their charge but they get closer to you. On a miss, you are hit by their charge and take 1d8 damage and are knocked prone.

Centaur Strike:

The centaur warrior strikes at you with their axe. Roll +Str to resist it. On a 16-19, you fend them off and deal your damage. On a 9-15, you fend them off but they wound you, dealing their damage to you. On a miss, they strike you and deal +1d4 damage to you.

deck_list.name: Centaur Shaman
deck_list.description:
Centaur Magic:

The centaur shaman casts a spell at you. Roll +Int to counter it. On a 16-19, you negate their spell and deal your damage. On a 9-15, you negate their spell but they have another one ready. On a miss, you are hit by their spell and suffer the effects.

Centaur Blessing:

The centaur shaman blesses their allies with their magic. Roll +Wis to disrupt it. On a 16-19, you disrupt their blessing and gain an advantage over them. On a 9-15, you disrupt their blessing but they have another one ready. On a miss, they bless their allies and they gain an advantage over you.

deck_list.name: Bandit
deck_list.description:
Bandit Ambush:

The bandit hides in the shadows and waits for you. Roll +Wis to spot them. On a 16-19, you notice them and avoid their surprise attack. On a 9-15, you notice them but they have already struck. On a miss, you are caught unaware by their surprise attack and suffer the consequences.

Bandit Stab:

The bandit stabs at you with their dagger. Roll +Dex to dodge it. On a 16-19, you avoid the stab and deal your damage. On a 9-15, you avoid the stab but the bandit gets closer to you. On a miss, you are stabbed and take 1d6 damage and bleed.

deck_list.name: Bandit Wizard
deck_list.description:
Bandit Magic:

The bandit wizard casts a spell at you. Roll +Int to counter it. On a 16-19, you negate their spell and deal your damage. On a 9-15, you negate their spell but they have another one ready. On a miss, you are hit by their spell and suffer the effects.

Bandit Trick:

The bandit wizard uses their magic to trick you. Roll +Wis to see through it. On a 16-19, you see through their trick and gain an advantage over them. On a 9-15, you see through their trick but they have another one ready. On a miss, you fall for their trick and they gain an advantage over you.

deck_list.name: Wizard Justiciar
deck_list.description:
Wizard Law:

The wizard justiciar casts a spell to enforce the law. Roll +Int to resist it. On a 16-19, you negate their spell and deal your damage. On a 9-15, you negate their spell but they have another one ready. On a miss, you are hit by their spell and suffer the effects.

Wizard Detain:

The wizard justiciar casts a spell to detain you or your allies. Roll +Wis to avoid it. On a 16-19, you avoid the spell and gain an advantage over them. On a 9-15, you avoid the spell but they have another one ready. On a miss, you or your allies are detained by the spell and can’t attack, block or activate abilities until your next turn.

deck_list.name: Iron Golem
deck_list.description:
Iron Smash:

The iron golem smashes you with its fists. Roll +Str to resist it. On a 16-19, you fend it off and deal your damage. On a 9-15, you fend it off but it crushes you, dealing its damage to you. On a miss, it smashes you and deals +1d4 damage to you.

Iron Breath:

The iron golem breathes fire at you. Roll +Dex to dodge it. On a 16-19, you avoid the fire and deal your damage. On a 9-15, you avoid the fire but it gets closer to you. On a miss, you are hit by the fire and take 1d8 damage and catch on fire.

deck_list.name: Treasure Finder
deck_list.description: You have heard rumors of a great treasure hidden in a dangerous place. To complete this destiny, you must find and obtain the treasure. Once you have claimed the treasure, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, everyone in your party gains 1 XP point each session by taking actions that move you closer to the treasure or that help you overcome obstacles in your search.

deck_list.name: Lore Seeker
deck_list.description: You are fascinated by the history and secrets of the world, and seek to uncover forgotten knowledge. To complete this destiny, you must discover a piece of ancient lore or solve a mystery that has confounded others. Once you have uncovered the knowledge you seek, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, everyone in your party gains 1 XP point each session by taking actions that advance your understanding of the world or that help you gather information.

deck_list.name: Beast Slayer
deck_list.description: You have dedicated yourself to hunting down and defeating dangerous beasts that threaten civilization. To complete this destiny, you must hunt and slay a powerful beast that has terrorized a region. Once you have vanquished the beast, everyone in your party gains 10 XP points as a reward. Additionally, everyone in your party gains 1 XP point each session by taking actions that help you track down the beast or that prepare you for the fight ahead.

deck_list.name: Tribe Warrior
deck_list.description: When you resist to poisons and diseases, and gain +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Historian
deck_list.description: When you need to recall an historical fact, you get +3 to your rolls.

deck_list.name: Education Magic
deck_list.description:
Educatio:

When you cast this spell, you gain a +1 forward to any roll related to learning or education for the next hour.

Memoria:

When you cast this spell, you can recall any piece of information you have learned in the past with perfect clarity.

Intellegentia:

When you cast this spell, you gain a +1 forward to any roll related to problem-solving or critical thinking for the next hour.

Legere:

When you cast this spell, you can read any written language, even if you have never seen it before.

deck_list.name: Emotion Magic
deck_list.description:
Emotio:

When you cast this spell, you can manipulate the emotions of a target within a 10-foot radius. You can make the target feel happy, sad, angry, or any other emotion of your choice.

Tranquillitas:

When you cast this spell, you can calm down a target within a 10-foot radius. This spell can be used to ease anxiety, reduce stress, or help someone fall asleep.

Laetus:

When you cast this spell, you can create a sense of happiness within a 10-foot radius. This spell can be used to lift the spirits of a group, boost morale, or create a festive atmosphere.

Fidelis:

When you cast this spell, you can create a sense of loyalty or trust between two targets within a 10-foot radius. This spell can be used to make allies more willing to cooperate, or to convince an enemy to become a temporary ally.

deck_list.name: Art Magic
deck_list.description:
Ars:

When you cast this spell, you can create a masterpiece of art within a 10-foot radius. You can choose the type of art you want to create, such as a painting, sculpture, or even a garden.

Creatio:

When you cast this spell, you can create anything you can imagine out of thin air. This includes objects, creatures, and even environments. The only limit is your imagination and the amount of magic you have.

Color:

When you cast this spell, you can manipulate the colors of objects within a 10-foot radius. You can change the color of anything you want, including walls, clothes, or even people's hair.

Opus:

When you cast this spell, you can manipulate objects within a 10-foot radius to create intricate designs and patterns. You can use this spell to create mosaics, sculptures, or even complex machinery.

deck_list.name: Housekeeping Magic
deck_list.description:
Purgare:

When you cast this spell, all dirt and grime within a 10-foot radius is magically cleaned. All objects in the area are now spotless, including surfaces, clothes, and dishes.

Ordinare:

When you cast this spell, objects within a 10-foot radius are automatically organized according to your specifications. For example, you can use this spell to sort books, clothes, or even silverware.

Movere:

When you cast this spell, objects within a 10-foot radius will move to your command. You can use this spell to move heavy furniture, open doors, or even sweep the floor.

Automatice:

When you cast this spell, objects within a 10-foot radius will perform a specific action automatically. For example, you can use this spell to make dishes wash themselves or laundry fold itself.

deck_list.name: Turinese ClockKnight
deck_list.description:
The Turinese Clock-Knight is a warrior of precision, wielding a clockwork sword and shield with skill and grace. You gain the following abilities:

  • You have a +1 bonus to Hack and Slash when wielding a clockwork weapon
  • You can spend an action to wind up your sword, granting you +1 forward to your next Hack and Slash or Parry roll
  • You have a +1 bonus to Discern Realities when investigating clockwork or mechanical devices

deck_list.name: Guild of Blacksmiths
deck_list.description:
You are a member of this guild, and as such, you have connections and resources that can aid you in your adventures. When you need assistance from the guild, roll +Charisma.

  • On a 10+, your contacts within the guild can provide you with valuable information or resources. The GM will tell you what the guild can do for you and it will be helpful.
  • On a 7-9, your contacts can help you, but there will be a cost or a complication. The GM will offer you a choice between a price to pay or a complication to deal with.
  • On a 6-, your contacts cannot help you, and you may have attracted unwanted attention from the guild or its enemies. The GM will tell you what kind of trouble you've caused.

deck_list.description:
You are a member of this guild, and as such, you have connections and resources that can aid you in your adventures. When you need assistance from the guild, roll +Charisma.

deck_list.name: Guild of Shipwrights
deck_list.description:
You are a member of this guild, and as such, you have connections and resources that can aid you in your adventures. When you need assistance from the guild, roll +Charisma.

  • On a 10+, your contacts within the guild can provide you with valuable information or resources. The GM will tell you what the guild can do for you and it will be helpful.
  • On a 7-9, your contacts can help you, but there will be a cost or a complication. The GM will offer you a choice between a price to pay or a complication to deal with.
  • On a 6-, your contacts cannot help you, and you may have attracted unwanted attention from the guild or its enemies. The GM will tell you what kind of trouble you've caused.
