deck_list.name: Pitchfork
deck_list.description: A sturdy pitchfork with three tines, useful for moving hay or defending oneself.

deck_list.name: Shears
deck_list.description: A pair of sharp shears for clipping wool from sheep.

deck_list.name: Mortar and pestle
deck_list.description: A stone mortar and pestle for grinding herbs and spices.

deck_list.name: Hoe
deck_list.description: A long-handled hoe for tilling the soil.

deck_list.name: Scythe
deck_list.description: A curved blade attached to a long wooden handle, used for cutting down crops.

deck_list.name: Flint and steel
deck_list.description: A small piece of flint and a piece of steel used to create sparks for starting fires.

deck_list.name: Sickle
deck_list.description: A small curved blade attached to a wooden handle, used for cutting grain.

deck_list.name: Lantern
deck_list.description: A metal lantern with a glass pane and a hook for hanging.

deck_list.name: Oil
deck_list.description: A small bottle of oil for lubricating tools or lighting lamps.

deck_list.name: Bucket
deck_list.description: A sturdy wooden bucket for carrying water or feed.

deck_list.name: Candles
deck_list.description: A set of 5 beeswax candles for lighting.

deck_list.name: Bellows
deck_list.description: A pair of bellows used to stoke the flames of a fire.

deck_list.name: Fishing net
deck_list.description: A large fishing net for catching fish in nearby rivers or lakes.

deck_list.name: Saddle
deck_list.description: A simple leather saddle for riding a horse or donkey.

deck_list.name: Tongs
deck_list.description: A pair of metal tongs for handling hot objects.

deck_list.name: Deer Antler
deck_list.description: A large antler shed by a deer. It could be used as a decoration or crafted into something useful.

deck_list.name: Fishing Net
deck_list.description: A large net used for catching fish. It could also be used for other purposes, like trapping small animals.

deck_list.name: Mushroom Spores
deck_list.description: A vial of spores from a rare and delicious mushroom. If planted in the right conditions, they could grow into a valuable crop.

deck_list.name: Rabbit Foot
deck_list.description: A lucky charm made from the foot of a rabbit. It is said to bring good fortune to its owner.

deck_list.name: Hunting Trap
deck_list.description: A metal trap used for catching small animals. It could be dangerous if mishandled.

deck_list.name: Candlestick
deck_list.description: A metal or wooden holder used to hold candles for illumination.

deck_list.name: Chamber pot
deck_list.description: A portable container used as a toilet during the night, typically made of ceramic or metal.

deck_list.name: Bear Grease
deck_list.description: A jar of grease made from bear fat. It could be used as a lubricant or as a salve for treating minor injuries.

deck_list.name: Honeycomb
deck_list.description: A delicious and sweet honeycomb harvested from a beehive. It could be used as a sweetener or as a trade item.

deck_list.name: Falconry Gloves
deck_list.description: A pair of gloves used for handling and training falcons. They are made from sturdy leather and have reinforced fingertips.

deck_list.name: Wolf Pelt
deck_list.description: A thick and warm pelt from a wolf. It could be used as a rug or as a piece of clothing.

deck_list.name: Horned Beetle
deck_list.description: A large and dangerous beetle with sharp horns. It could be used as a test of courage or as a rare ingredient for alchemical concoctions.

deck_list.name: Tracking Powder
deck_list.description: A fine powder made from crushed herbs and minerals. It could be used to track animals or as a component for certain spells.

deck_list.name: Flint and Steel
deck_list.description: A small kit containing flint and steel for starting fires in the wilderness.

deck_list.name: Healing Herbs
deck_list.description: A bundle of healing herbs that can be used to make a poultice or tea that heals 1d8 HP.

deck_list.name: Lockpicks
deck_list.description: A small set of tools used for picking locks. Useful for getting past locked doors and chests.

deck_list.name: Cooking Pot
deck_list.description: A small pot with a lid, useful for cooking meals over a campfire.

deck_list.name: Antitoxin
deck_list.description: A vial of antitoxin that can be used to cure poison.

deck_list.name: Signal Whistle
deck_list.description: A small whistle that can be used to signal for help or to communicate with allies at a distance.

deck_list.name: Chromatic Dust
deck_list.description: A small bag of shimmering dust that, when thrown into the air, creates a colorful, distracting display.

deck_list.name: Mushroom Stew
deck_list.description: A thick, chunky stew made from mushrooms and other forest ingredients. It's surprisingly tasty, but the smell might be off-putting to some.

deck_list.name: Fishing Net
deck_list.description: A large, tangled fishing net. It might be useful for catching fish or trapping small animals.

deck_list.name: Lockpicks
deck_list.description: A set of slim metal tools used for picking locks. They look well-used and slightly rusted.

deck_list.name: Spool of Twine
deck_list.description: A small spool of rough twine. It might come in handy for tying things up or making traps.

deck_list.name: Bag of Mushrooms
deck_list.description: A small bag filled with various mushrooms. They might have medicinal properties, or they might just be tasty.

deck_list.name: Rat Tail
deck_list.description: A severed rat tail. It might be used in some kind of potion or spell.

deck_list.name: Horned Beetle Shell
deck_list.description: A sturdy shell from a horned beetle. It could be used to fashion armor or other protective gear.

deck_list.name: Sack of Grain
deck_list.description: A large sack filled with grain. It might be useful for feeding animals or for making bread.

deck_list.name: Bottle of Oil
deck_list.description: A small bottle filled with oil. It might be used for lighting torches or for making things slippery.

deck_list.name: Furry Pelt
deck_list.description: A shaggy pelt from some kind of small animal. It might be used for warmth or for making clothing.

deck_list.name: Venetian Glass Goblet
deck_list.description: Crafted by the skilled glassblowers of Venice, this goblet features intricate patterns and vivid colors that are unique to the city's glass-making tradition.

deck_list.name: Bavarian Beer Stein
deck_list.description: This sturdy mug is a staple in every Bavarian household, and is decorated with intricate designs that showcase the region's rich brewing culture.

deck_list.name: English Tea Set
deck_list.description: This delicate tea set is made from the finest English bone china, and is adorned with classic floral patterns that are synonymous with the country's tea-drinking traditions.

deck_list.name: Celtic Knot Rug
deck_list.description: Hand-woven by skilled artisans in the Celtic lands, this rug features intricate knotwork patterns that are steeped in ancient symbolism.

deck_list.name: Norman Tapestry
deck_list.description: This exquisitely crafted tapestry tells the story of the Norman conquest of England, and is a prized possession in any Norman household.

deck_list.name: Florentine Perfume Bottle
deck_list.description: This ornate bottle is filled with a heady perfume that is unique to the Florentine region, and is coveted by nobles and merchants alike.

deck_list.name: Parisian Chandelier
deck_list.description: This grand chandelier is a masterpiece of Parisian craftsmanship, and features sparkling crystals that illuminate any room with a warm and inviting glow.

deck_list.name: Viennese Clock
deck_list.description: This elegant clock is a symbol of Viennese precision and craftsmanship, and features intricate mechanisms that keep time with unparalleled accuracy.

deck_list.name: Swiss Cheese Board
deck_list.description: This rustic cheese board is hand-carved from the finest Swiss wood, and is a staple in every Swiss household for serving up delicious cheeses and charcuterie.

deck_list.name: Tuscan Olive Oil Flask
deck_list.description: This rustic flask is filled with the finest olive oil from the rolling hills of Tuscany, and is a prized possession in any Tuscan kitchen.

deck_list.name: Eadrics Larder of Leicester
deck_list.description: This magical larder from the city of Leicester can preserve food for weeks without spoilage. It is powered by a crystal shard enchanted by an alchemist.

deck_list.name: Thibaults Bread Box of Toulouse
deck_list.description: This enchanted bread box from the city of Toulouse keeps bread fresh and warm for days. It is powered by a trapped fire elemental.

deck_list.name: Ulfs Dishwasher of Uppsala
deck_list.description: This magical dishwasher from the city of Uppsala can clean dishes in seconds without any scrubbing. It is powered by a glyph inscribed by a wizard.

deck_list.name: Giovannis Frost Box of Florence
deck_list.description: This enchanted frost box from the city of Florence can freeze food and keep it fresh for days. It is powered by a gem soul of a winter faerie.

deck_list.name: Katarzynas Spice Rack of Krakow
deck_list.description: This magical spice rack from the city of Krakow can dispense any spice or herb instantly. It is powered by a crystal orb blessed by a priest.

deck_list.name: Adalberts Sewing Machine of Augsburg
deck_list.description: This enchanted sewing machine from the city of Augsburg can mend clothes and fabrics with magical precision. It is powered by a glyph crafted by a runemaster.

deck_list.name: Bélas Oven of Buda
deck_list.description: This magical oven from the city of Buda can bake any dish to perfection. It is powered by a crystal shard imbued with the essence of a fire salamander.

deck_list.name: Jacquess Iron of Calais
deck_list.description: This enchanted iron from the city of Calais can press any cloth or garment in seconds. It is powered by a trapped air elemental.

deck_list.name: Miroslavs Dishware Set of Dubrovnik
deck_list.description: This magical dishware set from the city of Dubrovnik can clean and arrange itself after every meal. It is powered by a gemstone blessed by a mystic.

deck_list.name: Agnes Burgundians Illuminated Mirror
deck_list.description: This magical mirror, created by the skilled Agnes Burgundian of Dijon, illuminates the face of the person looking into it, making it easier to apply makeup or shave. Its magic is powered by a small gem soul embedded in the back.

deck_list.name: Bartolomeo Venetians Music Box
deck_list.description: This musical box, invented by the talented Bartolomeo Venetian of Venice, plays beautiful melodies on command, soothing the nerves of those around it. Its magic is powered by trapped air spirits that make the metal cylinders inside rotate.

deck_list.name: Elisabeth of Heidelbergs Quill Pen
deck_list.description: This enchanted quill pen, crafted by the renowned Elisabeth of Heidelberg, writes by itself, taking down notes as fast as the writer can think of them. Its magic is powered by glyphs of ink that imbue the quill with the ability to write on its own.

deck_list.name: Fyodorov Muscovite Phonograph
deck_list.description: This phonograph from Moscow has a unique sound quality thanks to the arcane crystals used to power it. It allows you to record and play back any sound, making it ideal for entertainment or espionage.

deck_list.name: Brugesian Light Box
deck_list.description: This light box from Bruges can illuminate even the darkest corners of a room. Its power source, a gem soul, makes it exceptionally bright and long-lasting. It's perfect for reading or working in low-light conditions.

deck_list.name: Armenian News Ticker
deck_list.description: This news ticker from Armenia uses trapped air elementals to convey news and information in real-time. It's an essential tool for anyone who needs to stay informed and up-to-date.

deck_list.name: Hessian Telegraph
deck_list.description: This telegraph from Hesse uses arcane glyphs to transmit messages across great distances. It's faster and more reliable than messengers, making it ideal for long-distance communication.

deck_list.name: Genoese Camera Obscura
deck_list.description: This camera obscura from Genoa uses a special lens crafted from a rare crystal to create incredibly detailed images. It's perfect for artists, cartographers, or anyone who needs to capture a precise likeness of a person or place.

deck_list.name: Silesian Abacus
deck_list.description: This abacus from Silesia uses a trapped fire elemental to perform calculations at incredible speed. It's an indispensable tool for merchants, bankers, and anyone else who needs to perform complex calculations quickly and accurately.

deck_list.name: Munich Clockwork Calculator
deck_list.description: This clockwork calculator from Munich uses intricate clockwork mechanisms to perform complex mathematical operations. It's a wonder of engineering and a must-have for anyone who needs to perform complex calculations regularly.

deck_list.name: Venetian Magic Lantern
deck_list.description: This magic lantern from Venice projects images onto any surface, creating a stunning visual display. Its power source, a rare gem imbued with magical energy, makes it incredibly powerful and versatile. It's perfect for use in theaters, lecture halls, or any other large gathering place.

deck_list.name: Eadwine of Wessexs Crystal Lamp
deck_list.description: This lamp, originating from the Wessex region, is powered by a small arcane crystal that glows brightly when activated. It provides a steady source of light, useful for reading or working in dark places. Its simple design and low price make it a common item among scholars and adventurers.

deck_list.name: Georgian Water Clock
deck_list.description: This clock from Georgia runs on water and uses a series of gears to measure time. It's accurate enough for daily use, but not precise enough for scientific purposes. It's popular among merchants and travelers who need to keep track of time during long journeys.

deck_list.name: Domenico of Venices Enchanted Lens
deck_list.description: This lens, created by Domenico of Venice, uses a trapped element to magnify objects up to ten times their original size. It's ideal for inspecting small objects or examining fine details. Its high price reflects the rarity and value of the trapped element used to power it.

deck_list.name: Baltic Compass
deck_list.description: This compass from the Baltic region uses a gem soul to point to true north. It's a useful tool for navigating at sea or on land. Its low price and simple design make it a popular item among sailors and explorers.

deck_list.name: Madridian Alchemical Scale
deck_list.description: This scale, created by alchemists in Madrid, uses a series of glyphs to measure weight and mass. It's highly accurate and can detect even the smallest differences in weight. Its high price reflects the cost of the rare and exotic materials used to create the glyphs.

deck_list.name: Flemish Weather Glass
deck_list.description: This glass instrument from Flanders uses trapped air to predict changes in the weather. It's not always accurate, but it can provide a useful warning of approaching storms or sudden drops in temperature. Its low price and simple design make it a popular item among farmers and shepherds.

deck_list.name: Sicilian Thaumatrope
deck_list.description: This device, invented in Sicily, uses a gem soul to create the illusion of motion. It consists of a spinning disk with two different images on either side, which blend together to create the illusion of movement. Its high price reflects the rarity and value of the gem soul used to power it.

deck_list.name: Balthazars Breton Lamp
deck_list.description: This lamp uses an arcane crystal found only in the Breton region of Europe. It emits a bright, white light that lasts for hours, making it perfect for studying or crafting during long winter nights. It can be turned on and off with a simple flick of the wrist.

deck_list.name: Gertrudes German Clock
deck_list.description: This clock uses a trapped elemental spirit to keep precise time. It chimes every hour and can be set to alarm at specific times. It's a popular item among busy merchants and scholars in Germany.

deck_list.name: Lucass Lombardia Fan
deck_list.description: This fan from Lombardia is magically powered by a gem soul, making it the perfect accessory for hot summer days. It produces a gentle, cool breeze that can be felt from several feet away. It's a popular item among the aristocracy in Italy.

deck_list.name: Sophies Spanish Radio
deck_list.description: This radio uses glyphs to magically transmit sound over long distances. It can pick up broadcasts from all over Spain, making it a valuable tool for travelers and merchants. It's a relatively new invention and is rapidly gaining popularity.

deck_list.name: Gustavs Gdansk Gramophone
deck_list.description: This gramophone uses a trapped elemental spirit to produce high-quality sound. It's a popular item among musicians and music enthusiasts in Gdansk. It can play all types of records and has a volume control.

deck_list.name: Klauss Krakow Camera
deck_list.description: This camera uses an arcane crystal to capture images. It's a popular item among artists and historians in Krakow. It produces high-quality, detailed photographs that can be developed in a darkroom.

deck_list.name: Martas Moscow Mirror
deck_list.description: This mirror from Moscow is magically powered by a gem soul. It can be used to communicate with other mirrors in different locations, making it a valuable tool for spies and diplomats. It's a closely guarded secret and is only available to a select few.

deck_list.name: Guglielmo Sicilian Telegraph
deck_list.description: This handheld device is powered by arcane crystals and enables users to send messages instantly over long distances. It was invented by Guglielmo from Sicily, and its unique design allows for easy one-handed use. It has a range of up to 50 miles and can send up to 25 words per message. It is highly sought after by traders, merchants, and nobles.

deck_list.name: Parisian Projector
deck_list.description: This small device, invented in Paris, uses gem souls to project images and videos onto walls or other surfaces. It is highly popular among wealthy aristocrats who use it for entertainment, and also among scholars who use it for presentations. It has a range of up to 20 feet and can project images up to 3 feet wide. It is powered by a single gem soul and has a battery life of up to 8 hours.

deck_list.name: Madrid Music Box
deck_list.description: This small, intricately crafted music box was invented in Madrid and is powered by trapped elemental spirits. It produces beautiful, haunting melodies that have been known to entrance listeners. It is highly valued by musicians and performers, and is said to have magical properties that enhance the creativity of its users.

deck_list.name: Viennese Clockwork
deck_list.description: This sophisticated clockwork device was invented in Vienna and uses complex glyphs to keep time with incredible accuracy. It is highly sought after by astronomers, navigators, and other scholars who require precise timekeeping. It has a battery life of up to 10 years and can be wound up by hand if needed.

deck_list.name: Nuremberg Calculator
deck_list.description: This small handheld device was invented in Nuremberg and uses arcane crystals to perform complex calculations with lightning speed. It is highly valued by scholars, merchants, and engineers, and is said to have magical properties that enhance the intelligence of its users. It can perform addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division, as well as more complex functions such as logarithms and trigonometry.

deck_list.name: Hamburgic Telescope
deck_list.description: This powerful telescope was invented in Hamburg and uses gem souls to enhance its vision. It has a range of up to 100 miles and can see stars and planets in incredible detail. It is highly sought after by astronomers and navigators, and is said to have magical properties that enhance the perception of its users. It is mounted on a sturdy tripod and can be easily transported.

deck_list.name: Isaac of Yorks Whispering Earrings
deck_list.description: These earrings allow the wearer to communicate telepathically with anyone within 50ft. The communication is completely private and cannot be heard by anyone else, making it perfect for espionage. The earrings are powered by a small arcane crystal embedded in each earring.

deck_list.name: Catalan Rain Barrel
deck_list.description: This barrel is enchanted to never run out of water. Once filled, it can be used to provide fresh water for a small group of people for weeks. The enchantment is powered by a gem soul, which must be replaced every year to maintain the enchantment.

deck_list.name: Munich Smokestick
deck_list.description: This smokestick emits a thick smoke that obscures vision and smells like freshly baked bread. The smoke lasts for 10 minutes and can be used to hide the user's movements or to create a distraction. The smokestick is powered by a trapped air elemental.

deck_list.name: Florentine Wax Seal
deck_list.description: This wax seal allows the user to seal a message with a magical enchantment that can only be read by the intended recipient. The message can only be opened by breaking the seal, which releases a small amount of enchanted dust that activates the spell. The enchantment is powered by a set of enchanted glyphs etched into the seal.

deck_list.name: Venetian Fog Horn
deck_list.description: This horn emits a loud foghorn sound that causes everyone within earshot to forget what they were doing for a few seconds. It can be used to disrupt an enemy's attack or to escape from a sticky situation. The horn is powered by a small, enchanted water globe that must be refilled every time it is used.

deck_list.name: Hans of Brussels Spring Boots
deck_list.description: These boots allow the wearer to jump three times higher than normal, making it perfect for traversing difficult terrain or escaping from danger. The enchantment is powered by a small, enchanted spring embedded in each boot.

deck_list.name: Pragues Singing Bell
deck_list.description: This bell emits a beautiful, enchanting sound that causes anyone who hears it to become completely entranced. While under its spell, the listener is completely susceptible to the user's suggestions. The bell is powered by a set of enchanted glyphs etched into the bell itself.

deck_list.name: Giovanni Venetians Divining Glass
deck_list.description: This glass is enchanted with a water elemental trapped inside. When filled with water and held up to the light, it allows the user to see the location of the nearest underground water source. However, it only works when held by someone born in the city of Venice.

deck_list.name: Leipzig Ghosthounds Collar
deck_list.description: This collar is made of silver and inscribed with magical glyphs. When placed on a dog, it grants the animal the ability to see and interact with ghosts. However, the dog must be a dachshund breed and must be kept on a strict diet of raw sausages.

deck_list.name: Antonios Florentine Chameleon Cloak
deck_list.description: This cloak is made of a rare fabric that can change color to match its surroundings. However, it only works if the wearer remains completely still and silent while wearing it. It was invented by a tailor in Florence who was known for his ability to blend in with any crowd.

deck_list.name: Elviras Catalan Candlestick
deck_list.description: This candlestick is enchanted with the ability to light candles and torches at a distance. However, it can only be activated by a person who speaks Catalan.

deck_list.name: Nuremberg Clockmakers Timekeeper
deck_list.description: This pocket watch can pause time for 10 seconds. However, it can only be used once a day.

deck_list.name: Edinburgh Stonecutters Gargoyle Eye
deck_list.description: This gemstone, extracted from a gargoyle, allows the user to see through stone walls. However, it can only be activated by a person born in Edinburgh and only if they are standing on Scottish soil.

deck_list.name: Kołobrzeg Seaside Weavers Shell
deck_list.description: This seashell, when blown, creates a powerful gust of wind. However, it can only be used by someone who has been baptized in the sea off the coast of Kołobrzeg.

deck_list.name: Flamenco Murmurer
deck_list.description: This odd contraption is a metal funnel attached to a wooden box. When you whisper into the funnel, the box amplifies the sound and creates a flame that shoots out of the box. The flame burns for as long as you whisper. The Flamenco Murmurer is powered by a small arcane crystal embedded in the base of the funnel. It was invented by a group of gnomish tinkers in the Andalusian region.

deck_list.name: Hanseatic Lantern
deck_list.description: This lantern is made of bronze and has a small, circular window that emits a bright, white light. The Hanseatic Lantern is powered by a trapped fire elemental that flickers inside the lantern. The lantern has a strange effect on plants, causing them to grow at an accelerated rate when exposed to its light. It was invented by a group of merchants in the Hanseatic League.

deck_list.name: Dacian Bladder
deck_list.description: This bladder is made from the stomach of a pig and has a small, brass valve on one end. When inflated with air, the Dacian Bladder allows the user to breathe underwater for up to 10 minutes. The bladder is powered by a gem soul that glows faintly when activated. It was invented by a group of craftsmen in the Dacian Mountains.

deck_list.name: Bremen’s Whistler
deck_list.description: This small, wooden whistle emits a high-pitched noise when blown. The Whistler is powered by a glyph carved into the wood that activates when the whistle is blown. The glyph causes all small animals within 50 feet to gather around the user. It was invented by a reclusive wizard in the city of Bremen.

deck_list.name: Venetian Gondolier
deck_list.description: This gondola has an intricate design etched into the wood. The Gondolier is powered by a trapped water elemental that propels the gondola through water at an incredible speed. However, the elemental requires a sacrifice of a small fish every hour to keep it happy. The Gondolier was invented by a group of Venetian engineers.

deck_list.name: Bohemian Jesters Box
deck_list.description: This small, wooden box has a clown etched into the lid. When opened, the box emits a high-pitched sound that causes anyone within earshot to burst out laughing uncontrollably. The Jester's Box is powered by a small, trapped air elemental that activates when the box is opened. It was invented by a court jester in Bohemia.

deck_list.name: Giovanni of Florences Weatherglass
deck_list.description: This small glass sphere filled with water can predict the weather for the next 24 hours. However, it only works in areas where the temperature is below 20°C. It is powered by a small amount of elemental air trapped inside the glass.

deck_list.name: Francesco of Venices Float Shoes
deck_list.description: These shoes allow the wearer to walk on water for up to 10 minutes. However, they only work in saltwater and can only be used once a day. They are powered by a small gemstone that must be recharged by exposing it to the full moon.

deck_list.name: Lorenzo of Pisas Levitating Chair
deck_list.description: This chair floats a foot off the ground and can move in any direction at a speed of 1 mph. However, it can only be used indoors and must be activated by speaking a command word in ancient Greek. It is powered by an arcane crystal that must be recharged with a rare herb found only in the mountains of Greece.

deck_list.name: Isabella of Genoas Whisper Box
deck_list.description: This small wooden box can record and play back whispered messages up to 10 seconds long. However, it can only be used indoors and the message can only be heard by someone holding their ear to the box. It is powered by a trapped air elemental that must be released and recaptured every time the box is used.

deck_list.name: Guglielmo of Sienas Insect Catcher
deck_list.description: This small metal box emits a high-pitched sound that attracts insects. However, it can only attract one type of insect at a time and the user must be able to identify the insect's call. It is powered by a small amount of trapped elemental earth.

deck_list.name: Leonardo of Milans Shadow Lantern
deck_list.description: This lantern casts a shadow that can be manipulated by the user to create shapes and images. However, it can only be used at night and the user must be skilled in shadow puppetry. It is powered by a rare gem soul that must be fed with the user's blood.

deck_list.name: Caterina of Naples Time Ticker
deck_list.description: This pocket watch can accurately tell time to the second. However, it only works when the user is standing perfectly still and cannot be used while moving or riding a horse. It is powered by a small arcane crystal that must be recharged with the user's own life force.

deck_list.name: Aldobrandini Naples Horn
deck_list.description: This horn can be used to summon a dense fog that lasts for 1 hour. However, it can only be used in Naples due to the unique humidity and atmospheric pressure of the city. The horn is powered by an arcane crystal.

deck_list.name: Crescenzi Ferraras Bellows
deck_list.description: These bellows can be used to instantly ignite any fire. However, they can only be used in Ferrara due to the unique concentration of sulphur in the air. The bellows are powered by a trapped elemental spirit.

deck_list.name: De Castellos Lucca Umbrella
deck_list.description: This umbrella can be used to create a small, protective force field around the user. However, it can only be used in Lucca due to the unique alignment of ley lines in the city. The umbrella is powered by a gem soul.

deck_list.name: Del Giudices Genoa Hourglass
deck_list.description: This hourglass can be used to manipulate time in a small area, causing it to either speed up or slow down. However, it can only be used in Genoa due to the unique gravitational forces in the city. The hourglass is powered by an arcane crystal.

deck_list.name: Gianfigliazzi Florences Hourglass
deck_list.description: This hourglass can be used to freeze any liquid in a small area. However, it can only be used in Florence due to the unique alchemical properties of the water in the city. The hourglass is powered by a trapped elemental spirit.

deck_list.name: Lorenzetti Sienas Mirror
deck_list.description: This mirror can be used to create an exact duplicate of the user, which can be controlled remotely. However, it can only be used in Siena due to the unique composition of the soil in the city. The mirror is powered by a series of ancient glyphs etched into its surface.

deck_list.name: Malatesta Riminis Compass
deck_list.description: This compass can be used to locate any type of treasure or valuable item within a certain radius. However, it can only be used in Rimini due to the unique magnetic properties of the sand on the city's beaches. The compass is powered by an arcane crystal.

deck_list.name: Ordelaffi Forlìs Lantern
deck_list.description: This lantern can be used to summon and control a swarm of fireflies that can manipulate light and darkness in a small area. However, it can only be used in Forlì due to the unique alignment of the stars and the concentration of magic in the city. The lantern is powered by a trapped elemental spirit.

deck_list.name: Fulvio Genoveses Bolognaise Shaker
deck_list.description: This small container is filled with dried herbs and spices from the city of Bologna. When shaken, it releases a fragrant cloud that can obscure scents up to 10 feet away. The shaker is powered by a small gemstone embedded in the lid.

deck_list.name: Cristina Fiorentinos Perugian Umbrella
deck_list.description: This colorful umbrella from the city of Perugia can repel rainwater and create a small dome of dryness for the user. However, it can only be used in a maximum of 5-minute increments, and needs to be recharged by exposure to sunlight for at least an hour. The umbrella is powered by a crystal attached to the handle.

deck_list.name: Lorenzo Venetians Verona Mist Dispenser
deck_list.description: This small device releases a thick mist that can obscure vision and muffle sounds in a 10-feet radius. However, it can only be activated by speaking in rhyming couplets, and the effect lasts only for 30 seconds. The mist dispenser is powered by a trapped elemental spirit.

deck_list.name: Giovanni Pisans Pistoia Spring
deck_list.description: This small bottle contains water from the springs of Pistoia, which has healing properties and can cure minor ailments such as headaches, bruises, and fatigue. However, it can only be used three times before it needs to be refilled, and can only be used once per hour. The bottle is powered by a small enchanted crystal.

deck_list.name: Beatrice Milaneses Pavia Seed Pod
deck_list.description: This small pod contains a magical seed that can grow into a tree in just one hour, providing shade and shelter to the user. However, it can only be used once per day, and the tree disappears after 12 hours. The seed pod is powered by a glyph etched on its surface.

deck_list.name: Simone Genoveses Ferrarese Glowing Stone
deck_list.description: This small stone from the city of Ferrara glows in the dark, providing light in a 5-feet radius. However, it can only be used for 10 minutes at a time, and needs to be recharged by exposure to sunlight for at least an hour. The stone is powered by a small enchanted crystal.

moves.moves_description: You can combine it with other ingredients to create a Minor Glyph, a magical symbol that can be used to enchant items. To create a Minor Glyph, you need to spend 1 hour of uninterrupted work and have access to a crafting station  and some ingredients that will determine its properties. Once created, the glyph can be applied to an item with an enchantment slot, granting it a minor magical effect.

You can use it to create a Glyph, a powerful magical symbol that can be used to enchant items. To create a Glyph, you need to spend 2 hours of uninterrupted work and have access to a crafting station  and some ingredients that will determine its properties. Once created, the glyph can be applied to an item with an enchantment slot, granting it a significant magical effect.

You can use it to create a Greater Glyph, a complex magical symbol that can be used to enchant items with incredibly powerful effects. To create a Greater Glyph, you need to spend 4 hours of uninterrupted work and have access to a crafting station and some ingredients that will determine its properties. Once created, the glyph can be applied to an item with an enchantment slot, granting it an incredibly powerful magical effect.

You can craft 50 potions spending 10 coins each. When you drink this potion, roll +STR. On a 20+ choose 3, on a 16+, choose 2. On a 9-15, choose only one.
  • You gain the ability to see in the dark for 1 hour.
  • You gain the ability to move quickly for 1 minute, gaining +1 armor and +1d4 damage to your next attack.
  • You gain the ability to intimidate your enemies, making them flee for a short time.

(Requires Weak Soul Gem to craft it)
Costs 1 mp to use it, works like Goblin's Fury, but +3 to STR roll and has an additional option: create a sonic boom that damages enemies in a cone in front of you.

(Requires Average Soul Gem to craft it)
Costs 2 mp to use it, works like Goblin's Fury, but +3 to STR roll and has an additional option: summon a pack of goblin minions to fight by your side for 1 minute.

(Requires Strong Soul Gem to craft it)
Costs 3 mp to use it, works like Goblin's Fury, but +3 to STR roll and has an additional option: transform into a giant goblin for 1 minute, gaining +3 armor and +2d6 damage to your attacks.

You can craft 50 potions spending 100 coins each. When you drink this potion, roll +INT. On a 20+ choose 3, on a 16+, choose 2. On a 9-15, choose only one.
  • You gain the ability to channel lightning through your body, dealing extra md damage with your melee attacks and creating electric arcs that hit nearby enemies
  • You gain the ability to create an electric shield around you, absorbing md damage and dealing it to attackers

(Requires Weak Soul Gem to craft it)
Costs 1 mp to use it, works like Potion of Lightning

(Requires Average Soul Gem to craft it)
Costs 2 mp to use it, works like Potion of Lightning, but +3 to INT roll and has an additional option: create a lightning blast that damages all enemies within range.

(Requires Strong Soul Gem to craft it)
Costs 3 mp to use it, works like Potion of Lightning, but +3 to INT roll and has an additional option: Summon a Dragon made of lightning that lasts 1 minute

deck_list.name: Raw Gem
deck_list.description: A raw gemstone of various colors and types, not worth much on its own. Examples: Agate, Amazonite, Amber, Amethyst, Aventurine, Bloodstone, Carnelian, Chrysoprase, Citrine, Fluorite, Garnet, Hematite, Jade, Jasper, Lapis Lazuli, Moonstone, Obsidian, Peridot, Rose Quartz, Turquoise

moves.moves_description: When a creature with a lesser soul dies in the vicinity of a raw gem, its soul gets catpured by it creating a Weak Soul Gem.

deck_list.name: Precious Gem
deck_list.description: A beautiful gemstone of various colors and types, with a moderate value. Examples: Diamond, Emerald, Ruby, Sapphire, Opal, Aquamarine, Topaz, Garnet, Amethyst, Pearl, Tourmaline, Alexandrite, Tanzanite, Zircon, Peridot, Spinel, Morganite, Tsavorite, Chrome Diopside, Kunzite

moves.moves_description: When a creature with a average soul dies in the vicinity of a precious gem, its soul gets catpured by it creating a Average Soul Gem.

deck_list.name: Very Rare Gem
deck_list.description: An extremely valuable and rare gemstone of various colors and types. Examples: Black Opal, Demantoid Garnet, Jadeite, Benitoite, Musgravite, Grandidierite, Tanzanite, Poudretteite, Serendibite, Red Beryl, Jeremejevite, Paraiba Tourmaline, Blue Garnet, Painite, Black Jade, Benitoite, Alexandrite, Red Diamonds, Pink Star Diamond, Blue Moon Diamond

moves.moves_description: When a creature with a strong soul dies in the vicinity of a very rare gem, its soul gets catpured by it creating a Strong Soul Gem.

You learn a recipe of a poison that inflicts a debilitating shock to the target's nervous system. You can craft 50 of them spending 100 coins each. When you apply this poison to a weapon, roll +DEX. On a 16-19, choose 3. On a 9-15, choose only 1.

  • The target is stunned and cannot act for a few seconds
  • The target takes extra damage from the poisoned weapon
  • The target is unable to use magical abilities for a few seconds
  • The target's movements are slowed down, reducing its speed and agility

Additionally, you can use the thunderstone to craft glyphs, a minor one using a weak soul gem, a normal one using an average one and a greater glyph using a strong soul gem.

  • Minor Glyph: Spend 1 mp, roll +DEX and choose the same options
  • Glyph: Spend 2 mp, choose the same options and gain a +3 bonus to your DEX roll. You can also choose to add an additional option: create a thunderous explosion that damages all enemies within range.
  • Greater Glyph: Spend 3 Mp, choose the same options and gain a +5 bonus to your DEX roll. You can also choose to add two additional options: create a chain lightning effect that jumps from one target to another within range, or create a thunderstorm that damages all enemies within an area.

You learn to craft a glass shard that shatters on impact and releases a powerful electric shock. You can craft 50 of them spending 100 coins each. When you throw this poison shard at a target, roll +DEX. On a 16-19, choose 3. On a 9-15, choose only 1.

  • The target takes damage from the poison and is stunned for a few seconds
  • The target takes extra damage from the poisoned shard
  • The target is unable to use magical abilities for a few seconds
  • The target's movements are slowed down, reducing its speed and agility

Additionally, you can use the stormglass to craft glyphs, a minor one using a weak soul gem, a normal one using an average one and a greater glyph using a strong soul gem.

  • Minor Glyph: Spend 1 mp, roll +DEX and choose the same options
  • Glyph: Spend 2 mp, choose the same options and gain a +3 bonus to your DEX roll. You can also choose to add an additional option: create a thunderous explosion that damages all enemies within range.
  • Greater Glyph: Spend 3 Mp, choose the same options and gain a +5 bonus to your DEX roll. You can also choose to add two additional options: create a chain lightning effect that jumps from one target to another within range, or create a thunderstorm that damages all enemies within an area.

You learn to craft a poison that inflicts a memory loss effect on your target. You can craft 50 of them spending 100 coins each. When you apply this poison to a weapon, roll +DEX. On a 16-19, choose 2. On a 9-15, choose only one.

  • The target forgets how to use their weapon and suffers a -2 penalty to their attack rolls
  • The target forgets their skills and abilities, losing access to one of them (GM's choice)

Additionally, you can use the memory dust to craft glyphs, a minor one using a weak soul gem, a normal one using an average one and a greater glyph using a strong soul gem.

  • Minor Glyph: Spend 1 mp, roll +INT and choose the same options
  • Glyph: Spend 2 mp, choose the same options and gain a +3 bonus to your INT roll. You can also choose to add an additional option: create an illusion that makes the target forget their current objective and become confused for one turn.
  • Greater Glyph: Spend 3 Mp, choose the same options and gain a +5 bonus to your INT roll. You can also choose to add two additional options: make the target forget all their spells and magical abilities, or make them forget a crucial piece of information related to their current quest or mission.

You learn a recipe of a potion and can craft 50 of them spending 100 coins each. When you drink this potion, roll +INT. On a 16-19, choose 2. On a 9-15, choose only one.

  • You gain the ability to slow down time for everyone except yourself, allowing you to act more quickly and dodge attacks with ease.
  • You gain the ability to speed up time for yourself, allowing you to move and attack faster than your enemies can react.

Additionally, you can use the time essence to craft glyphs, a minor one using a weak soul gem, a normal one using an average one and a greater glyph using a strong soul gem.

  • Minor Glyph: Spend 1 mp, roll +INT and choose the same options
  • Glyph: Spend 2 mp, choose the same options and gain a +3 bonus to your INT roll. You can also choose to add an additional option: create a temporal distortion that slows down enemies within range.
  • Greater Glyph: Spend 3 Mp, choose the same options and gain a +5 bonus to your INT roll. You can also choose to add two additional options: create a temporal acceleration that speeds up allies within range, or create a time-stop effect that freezes all enemies within an area.

moves.moves_description:
You learn to brew a potion that grants immense strength and endurance for a short period of time. You can brew 10 of them spending 50 coins each. When you drink this potion, roll +CON. On a 16-19, choose 3. On a 9-15, choose only 1.

  • Your physical attacks deal extra damage
  • You gain resistance to physical damage
  • You can lift and carry heavy objects with ease
  • You can run and swim at incredible speeds

Additionally, you can use the Troll's Blood Moss to craft glyphs, a minor one using a weak soul gem, a normal one using an average one and a greater glyph using a strong soul gem.

  • Minor Glyph: Spend 1 mp, roll +CON and choose the same options
  • Glyph: Spend 2 mp, choose the same options and gain a +3 bonus to your CON roll. You can also choose to add an additional option: create a shockwave that knocks back enemies within range.
  • Greater Glyph: Spend 3 Mp, choose the same options and gain a +5 bonus to your CON roll. You can also choose to add two additional options: create a sonic boom that damages all enemies within an area, or create a force field that grants temporary invulnerability to you and your allies within range.

You learn to create an elixir that enhances your vision and perception. You can create 20 of them spending 100 coins each. When you drink this elixir, roll +WIS. On a 16-19, choose 3. On a 9-15, choose only 1.

  • You can see in complete darkness
  • You can see invisible creatures and objects
  • Your vision becomes incredibly sharp, allowing you to spot hidden details and clues
  • You gain resistance to blindness and other vision impairments

Additionally, you can use the Troll's Eye to craft glyphs, a minor one using a weak soul gem, a normal one using an average one and a greater glyph using a strong soul gem.

  • Minor Glyph: Spend 1 mp, roll +WIS and choose the same options
  • Glyph: Spend 2 mp, choose the same options and gain a +3 bonus to your WIS roll. You can also choose to add an additional option: create a blinding flash that dazzles enemies within range.
  • Greater Glyph: Spend 3 Mp, choose the same options and gain. a +5 bonus to your WIS roll. You can also choose to add two additional options: create an illusion that confuses enemies within range, or create a beacon that reveals hidden objects and secrets within an area.

move.moves_description:
You learn a recipe of a potion that imbues you with the grace and agility of a unicorn. When you drink this potion, roll +DEX. On a 16-19, choose 2. On a 9-15, choose only one.

  • You gain increased speed and agility, allowing you to move more quickly and dodge attacks with ease.
  • You gain the ability to move silently, making it harder for enemies to detect your presence.

Additionally, you can use Unicorn's Grace to craft glyphs, a minor one using a weak soul gem, a normal one using an average one and a greater glyph using a strong soul gem.

  • Minor Glyph: Spend 1 mp, roll +DEX and choose the same options.
  • Glyph: Spend 2 mp, choose the same options and gain a +3 bonus to your DEX roll. You can also choose to add an additional option: create an illusionary copy of yourself that distracts enemies.
  • Greater Glyph: Spend 3 Mp, choose the same options and gain a +5 bonus to your DEX roll. You can also choose to add two additional options: create a blinding flash that dazzles enemies within range, or create a protective barrier that increases your defenses against attacks.

moves.moves_description:
You learn a recipe of a potion that harnesses the healing power of a unicorn's horn. When you drink this potion, roll +WIS. On a 16-19, choose 2. On a 9-15, choose only one.

  • You are healed of all injuries and ailments.
  • You gain temporary hit points that protect you from further harm.

Additionally, you can use Unicorn's Healing Horn to craft glyphs, a minor one using a weak soul gem, a normal one using an average one and a greater glyph using a strong soul gem.

  • Minor Glyph: Spend 1 mp, roll +WIS and choose the same options.
  • Glyph: Spend 2 mp, choose the same options and gain a +3 bonus to your WIS roll. You can also choose to add an additional option: create a healing aura that restores the health of allies within range.
  • Greater Glyph: Spend 3 Mp, choose the same options and gain a +5 bonus to your WIS roll. You can also choose to add two additional options: create a burst of healing energy that restores the health of all allies within an area, or create a ward that prevents damage and negates negative effects for a short time.

move.moves_description: A notice from the Council of Wizards warning about the dangers of unauthorized magic items and offering rewards for their confiscation.
A flyer advertising a performance by a famous bard at the Medici Palace.

deck_list.name: Venetians
deck_list.description: People from the republic of Venice, built on a group of islands in the Venetian Lagoon. They are known for their trade in luxury goods and their skilled craftsmen, who create intricate glassware and jewelry. They are also known for their naval prowess and their special army unit, The Blackwater Blades, a group of elite assassins who wield poisoned rapiers and are skilled in underwater combat. They are known for their stealth and cunning, and are rumored to be aided by merfolk allies. Venetians are known for their charm.

deck_list.name: Milanese
deck_list.description: People from the city of Milan, a city known for its fashion and design. They are known for their trade in fine fabrics and their skilled tailors, who create some of the most fashionable clothing in all of Europe. Their special army unit is the The Milanesi Dragonslayers - A group of warriors from Milan, trained in the art of dragon hunting. They are known for their bravery and their ability to track and slay even the most fearsome of dragons. Milanese are known for their elegant and refined appearances.

deck_list.name: Romans
deck_list.description: People from the city of Rome, a city known for its history and ancient ruins. They are known for their trade in rare artifacts and their skilled archaeologists, who uncover some of the most valuable treasures in all of Europe. The Blades of Rome - An elite unit of paladins, known for their holy magic and fierce combat skills. They are often summoned by the Pope to defend the Vatican from threats.

deck_list.name: Turinese
deck_list.description: People from the city of Turin, a city known for its industrial innovation and engineering. They are known for their trade in advanced machinery and their skilled inventors, who create marvels of clockwork and steam power. They are also known for their special army unit, the Turinese Clockwork Knights, a group of elite soldiers who are equipped with powerful clockwork suits that enhance their strength and agility. Turinese are known for their practicality and innovation, which makes them admired by both humans and elves.

deck_list.name: Florentines
deck_list.description: People fro the city of Florence, a city known for its beautiful art and architecture. They are known for their trade in fine textiles and their skilled artists, who create breathtaking paintings and sculptures. They are also known for their political prowess and their special army unit, The Arcanum Guard, a group of mages and battlemages who are trained in both defensive and offensive magic. They are known for their ability to harness the power of the elements and summon powerful constructs.

deck_list.name: Neapolitans
deck_list.description: People from the Naples Kingdom, known for its vibrant culture and its delicious cuisine. They are known for their trade in spices and their skilled cooks, who create some of the most flavorful dishes in all of Europe. They are also known for their special army unit, The Hellfire Legion, a group of warriors and paladins who are infused with infernal energy and wield flaming swords. They are known for their fanatical devotion and their ability to channel their rage into devastating attacks. Neapolitans are known for their passion and enthusiasm.

deck_list.name: Palermitans
deck_list.description: People fromthe city of Palermo, a city known for its vibrant culture and its delicious cuisine. They are known for their trade in spices and their skilled cooks, who create some of the most flavorful dishes in all of Europe. Their special army unit is the Palermitan Spice Squad, a group of expert chefs who use their magic to create delicious and nourishing meals for the troops. Palermitans are known for their passion and enthusiasm.

deck_list.name: Catanians
deck_list.description: People from the city of Catania, a city known for its volcanic history and its fertile soil. They are known for their trade in rare minerals and their skilled farmers, who cultivate some of the most delicious and nutritious fruits and vegetables in all of Italy. Their special army unit is the Catanian Fire Brigade, a group of expert pyromancers who use their magic to control and harness the power of lava and fire thanks to their exposure to the nearby volcano. Catanians are known for their fierce and independent nature.

deck_list.name: Bolognese
deck_list.description: People from the city of Bologna, a city known for its rich history and its thriving university. They are known for their diplomatic skills and their special army unit, the Bolognese Mediators, a group of skilled negotiators who are often called upon to resolve conflicts between different races. The Bolognese have a Rare relationship with the Sun Elves, who have been allies with the city for centuries. They are also known for their expertise in alchemy and their skilled apothecaries, who create powerful potions and remedies.

deck_list.name: Forlivesi
deck_list.description: People from the city of Forli, a city known for its beautiful countryside and its thriving livestock industry. They are known for their trade in high-quality meats and their skilled farmers, who raise some of the finest animals in all of Italy. They are also known for their strength and their special army unit, the Forlivesi Brutes, a group of formidable warriors who are renowned for their physical prowess. The Forlivesi have a strained relationship with the Dark Elves, who often try to steal their livestock.

deck_list.name: Genovesi
deck_list.description: People from the city of Genoa, a city known for its bustling port and its thriving maritime trade. They are known for their trade in exotic goods and their skilled sailors, who brave the rough seas to bring back rare and valuable treasures. They are also known for their cunning and their special army unit, the Genovesi Swashbucklers, a group of agile and resourceful fighters who excel at naval combat. The Genovesi have a friendly relationship with the Sea Elves, who often lend them their magical assistance in times of need.

deck_list.name: Sienese
deck_list.description: People from the city-state of Siena, known for their skilled horsemanship and their famous Palio horse race. They are also known for their expertise in alchemy, creating potent potions and elixirs that grant temporary magical powers. Their special unit, the Wolf Riders, are mounted warriors who ride massive wolves into battle. These beasts are trained from birth to fight alongside their riders and are said to have a bond with them that transcends the physical realm.

deck_list.name: Lucchesi
deck_list.description: People from the city of Lucca, known for their mastery of gunpowder and the production of advanced firearms. They are also skilled in clockwork and mechanical engineering, creating intricate automatons and clockwork devices. Their special unit, the Griffin Knights, are heavily armored soldiers who ride mechanical griffins into battle. These beasts are powered by alchemical reactors and can breathe fire or shoot bolts of lightning.

deck_list.name: Ferrarese
deck_list.description: People from the city-state of Ferrara, known for their expertise in astrology and divination. They are also skilled in the creation of magical talismans and amulets. Their special unit, the Unicorn Cavalry, are mounted soldiers who ride powerful unicorns into battle. These beasts have the ability to heal their riders and can summon magical barriers to protect them from harm.

deck_list.name: Mantuans
deck_list.description: People from the city-state of Mantua, known for their mastery of herbalism and medicine. They are also skilled in the creation of magical runes and glyphs. Their special unit, the Wyvern Knights, are soldiers who ride powerful wyverns into battle. These beasts are known for their deadly venom and can breathe clouds of poisonous gas.

deck_list.name: Padovani
deck_list.description: People from the city-state of Padua, known for their mastery of elemental magic. They are skilled in the creation of powerful spells that can summon rain, lightning, and earthquakes. Their special unit, the Dragon Mages, are powerful wizards who can transform into dragons and rain destruction upon their enemies.

deck_list.name: Veronesi
deck_list.description: People from the city-state of Verona, known for their expertise in necromancy and the dark arts. They are also skilled in the creation of cursed objects and undead minions. Their special unit, the Bear Warriors, are heavily armored soldiers who wear cursed bear masks that grant them supernatural strength and resilience. They are rumored to be able to summon the spirits of dead warriors to fight alongside them.

deck_list.name: Urbinese
deck_list.description: People from the city of Urbino, famous for their excellence in scholarship and education. They are known for their expertise in the study and application of magic, particularly in the field of divination and alchemy. Their special unit is the Arcane Knights, heavily armored warriors who wield enchanted swords and shields that can deflect magical attacks. Urbinese are also known for their love of art and their refined tastes.

deck_list.name: Perugians
deck_list.description: People from the city of Perugia, known for their agricultural prowess and their culinary arts. They are experts in the cultivation of olives, grapes, and truffles, and their cuisine is renowned for its rich flavors and hearty portions. Their special unit is the Truffle Hunters, skilled archers who ride on giant boars and can track down elusive targets with their keen sense of smell. Perugians are also known for their hospitality and their love of festivals.

deck_list.name: Anconans
deck_list.description: People from the city of Ancona, famous for their seafaring traditions and their mercantile ventures. They are skilled in navigation and trade, and their ships are often used to transport goods and people across the Mediterranean. Their special unit is the Sea Serpent Riders, warriors who ride on giant sea serpents and can unleash devastating attacks from their tridents. Anconans are also known for their love of music and their melodious voices.

deck_list.name: Ravennans
deck_list.description: People from the city of Ravenna, known for their mastery in defensive warfare and their rich cultural heritage. They are experts in the construction of fortifications and siege weapons, and their defensive tactics have thwarted many enemy invasions. Their special unit is the Shield Maidens, female warriors who wield tower shields and can form a wall of defense that is almost impenetrable. Ravennans are also known for their love of poetry and their appreciation of the arts.

deck_list.name: Riminians
deck_list.description: People from the city of Rimini, famous for their fishing industry and their expertise in aquaculture. They are skilled in the capture and cultivation of seafood, and their cuisine is often based on fish, crustaceans, and mollusks. Their special unit is the Triton Warriors, who are half-human and half-fish and can use their agility and aquatic skills to outmaneuver their enemies. Riminians are also known for their love of beaches and their passion for outdoor activities.

deck_list.name: Vicenzans
deck_list.description: People from the city of Vicenza, which is known for its skilled metalworkers and blacksmiths. They excel in creating armor and weapons, and their special army unit, The Iron Guard, is made up of heavily armored knights wielding massive two-handed hammers. They are known for their brute strength and unwavering loyalty to their lord. Vicenzans also have a tradition of clockmaking and are renowned for their precision.

deck_list.name: Trevisans
deck_list.description: People from the city of Treviso, which is known for its vibrant marketplaces and traders. They excel in haggling and negotiating, and their special army unit, The Mercantile Militia, is made up of light infantry armed with crossbows and hammers. They are known for their speed and adaptability, and are able to adjust their tactics depending on the situation. Trevisans also have a tradition of wine-making and are renowned for their sparkling wines.

deck_list.name: Luganese
deck_list.description: People from the city of Lugano, which is located in the Swiss canton of Ticino. They are known for their expertise in banking and finance, and their special unit, The Swiss Guard, is made up of highly trained pikemen who also wield pistols. They are known for their unwavering loyalty to the Pope and are responsible for protecting him. Luganese also have a tradition of chocolate-making and are renowned for their rich, creamy chocolate.

deck_list.name: Bellinzonese
deck_list.description: People from the city of Bellinzona, which is known for its strategic location and impressive fortifications. They excel in siege warfare and their special army unit, The Stonecutters, is made up of engineers who can quickly build and dismantle siege weapons. They are known for their ingenuity and resourcefulness. Bellinzonese also have a tradition of cheese-making and are renowned for their flavorful cheeses.

deck_list.name: Locarnese
deck_list.description: People from the city of Locarno, which is located in the Swiss canton of Ticino. They are known for their expertise in medicine and healing, and their special unit, The Order of St. Lazarus, is made up of knights who also serve as healers. They are known for their selflessness and compassion. Locarnese also have a tradition of silk-making and are renowned for their luxurious silk fabrics.

deck_list.name: Mendrisiese
deck_list.description: People from the city of Mendrisio, which is known for its skilled architects and builders. They excel in constructing grand buildings and their special unit, The Masons, is made up of workers who can quickly build and repair fortifications. They are known for their precision and attention to detail. Mendrisiese also have a tradition of shoe-making and are renowned for their stylish leather shoes.

deck_list.name: Comaschi
deck_list.description: People from the city of Como, which is known for its textile industry and silk trade. They excel in creating intricate patterns and designs, and their special army unit, The Silkweavers, is made up of archers who also wear lightweight silk armor. They are known for their speed and agility, and are able to move quickly across the battlefield. Comaschi also have a tradition of boat-building and are renowned for their sleek, fast boats.

deck_list.name: Varese
deck_list.description: People from the city of Varese, located in northern Italy. They are known for their expertise in metallurgy and the production of weapons and armor. The Varesini are also skilled engineers, known for their innovative designs in clock-making and machinery. Their special unit is the Iron Legion, a group of heavily armored knights who are said to be invincible in battle due to their enchanted armor and shields. The Varesini are a proud people and value honor and loyalty above all else.

deck_list.name: Chiavenna
deck_list.description: People from the town of Chiavenna, located in the Lombardy region. They are known for their mastery of herbalism and natural remedies, and their skill in creating potions and elixirs. The Chiavennaschi are also expert climbers and guides, known for their ability to navigate treacherous mountain terrain. Their special unit is the Alpine Rangers, a group of elite archers who are skilled in using enchanted arrows that can freeze or entangle their targets. The Chiavennaschi are a rugged and independent people, fiercely loyal to their mountain home.

deck_list.name: Tirano
deck_list.description: People from the town of Tirano, located in the Valtellina valley. They are known for their expertise in agriculture and animal husbandry, and for their skill in brewing wine and beer. The Tiranesi are also renowned hunters and trappers, skilled in tracking and capturing elusive game. Their special unit is the Forest Wardens, a group of archers and hunters who are able to communicate with the spirits of the forest and call upon them for aid in battle. The Tiranesi are a proud and welcoming people, with a deep connection to nature and the land.

deck_list.name: Sondrio
deck_list.description: People from the city of Sondrio, located in the heart of the Alps. They are known for their expertise in mining and metalworking, and for their ability to extract rare and valuable minerals from the mountains. The Sondriesi are also skilled in the art of alchemy, able to transmute base metals into gold and create powerful potions. Their special unit is the Ironclad Brigade, a group of heavily armored warriors who are able to channel the power of the earth to create earthquakes and fissures in the ground. The Sondriesi are a stoic and disciplined people, with a deep respect for the power of the mountains.

deck_list.name: Bormio
deck_list.description: People from the town of Bormio, located in the Italian Alps. They are known for their skill in skiing and snowboarding, and for their expertise in building and maintaining ski resorts. The Bormini are also skilled in the art of ice magic, able to create and control snowstorms and blizzards. Their special unit is the Frost Brigade, a group of ice mages and snow warriors who are able to freeze their enemies in place and create treacherous ice obstacles on the battlefield. The Bormini are a fun-loving and adventurous people, with a deep appreciation for the beauty and majesty of the snow-covered Alps.

deck_list.name: Parisians
deck_list.description: People from the city of Paris, a city known for its iconic landmarks and its bustling streets. They are known for their trade in luxury goods and their skilled designers, who create some of the most fashionable clothing in all of Europe. They are also known for their artistic talent and their special army unit, the Parisian Muskeeters - a group of expert archers known for their accuracy and ability to imbue their bullets with magic. Parisians are known for their elegance and refinement, which makes them admired by both humans and elves.

deck_list.name: Marseillais
deck_list.description: People from the city of Marseille, a city known for its diverse population and its bustling port. They are known for their trade in exotic spices and their skilled merchants, who travel far and wide to bring back rare and valuable goods. They are also known for their naval strength and their special army unit, the Marseille Mermaids (SirÃ¨nes de la Guerre) - This aquatic unit is composed of merfolk and water-based mages, known for their expertise in naval combat and amphibious warfare. They are named for their shimmering blue and green armor, which is adorned with seashells and pearls.Marseillais are known for their toughness and resourcefulness, which makes them respected by both humans and elves.

deck_list.name: Lyonnais
deck_list.description: People from the city of Lyon, a city known for its rich history and its thriving silk industry. They are known for their trade in luxury fabrics and their skilled weavers, who create some of the finest textiles in all of Europe. They are also known for their cunning and their special army unit, Lyon Gryphons (Griffons de Lyon) - This aerial unit is made up of griffon riders and air mages, known for their dominance in the skies. They are named for their golden and white armor, which is adorned with feathers and talons. Lyonnais are known for their intelligence and secrecy, which makes them feared by both humans and elves.

deck_list.name: Normans

deck_list.description: The people of the Kingdom of Tlemcen are known for their expertise in metalworking and jewelry making. They are also skilled horsemen, and their special unit is the Iron Cavalry, a group of heavily armored knights who ride on the backs of giant mechanical horses. These horses are powered by clockwork mechanisms, giving them incredible speed and strength in battle. The Iron Cavalry is feared for their formidable charge, able to break through enemy lines with ease.

deck_list.name: Ifriqiyns
deck_list.description: The people of the Sultanate of Ifriqiya are skilled in the use of magic and alchemy, with a long history of mystical traditions. Their special unit is the Sand Djinns, a group of powerful elemental spirits who can take on human form to fight on the battlefield. The Sand Djinns can manipulate the elements of sand and wind to create devastating sandstorms and tornadoes, and are immune to most physical attacks. They are rumored to be bound to the service of the Sultan himself, and will obey his every command.

deck_list.name: Hafsids
deck_list.description: The people of the Hafsid Sultanate are known for their expertise in shipbuilding and navigation, and their special unit is the Corsairs, a group of fearsome pirate warriors who raid the coasts of their enemies. The Corsairs are experts in naval warfare, able to board and capture enemy ships with ease. They are armed with curved swords and throwing knives, and are known for their agility and cunning.

deck_list.name: Fezians
deck_list.description: The people of the Kingdom of Fez are skilled in the use of poisons and venom, and their special unit is the Venomous Vipers, a group of elite assassins who specialize in using deadly toxins to kill their enemies. The Venomous Vipers are experts in stealth and infiltration, able to move silently and unnoticed through enemy territory. They are armed with poisoned daggers and throwing knives, and are known for their ruthless efficiency.

deck_list.name: Mamluks
deck_list.description: The people of the Mamluk Sultanate are skilled in the use of firearms and explosives, and their special unit is the Gunpowder Jannisaries, a group of heavily armored warriors who carry muskets and grenades into battle. The Gunpowder Jannisaries are feared for their devastating firepower, able to mow down enemy soldiers with a single volley. They are also skilled in hand-to-hand combat, able to use their weapons as clubs in close combat.

deck_list.name: Banu Hilal
deck_list.description: A large tribal confederation that originated from the Arabian Peninsula and migrated to North Africa during the 11th century. They are a proud and fiercely independent people, known for their horsemanship and combat skills. Their special army unit, the Sandstorm Riders, are skilled cavalrymen who ride swift desert horses and wield curved scimitars imbued with magical sand that blinds their enemies.

deck_list.name: Banu Sulaym
deck_list.description: Another Arab tribal confederation that had a significant presence in the Arabian Peninsula and parts of North Africa. They are known for their bravery and unwavering loyalty to their leaders. Their special army unit, the Iron Eagles, are heavily armored warriors who wield giant falcon-like axes that can cleave through multiple enemies at once. The axes are said to be imbued with the spirits of their ancestors, giving the Iron Eagles the strength and guidance of their forefathers.

deck_list.name: Banu Tamim
deck_list.description: An Arab tribe that originated from the central Arabian Peninsula and had a widespread presence in the region. They are known for their cunning and strategic thinking, as well as their expertise in horse breeding. Their special army unit, the Thunder Riders, are skilled horse archers who ride lightning-fast steeds. The Thunder Riders are known for their ability to summon thunderstorms to their aid, and their arrows are said to be imbued with the power of lightning.

deck_list.name: Banu Quraysh
deck_list.description: The tribe of the Islamic prophet Muhammad, which originated from the city of Mecca in the Arabian Peninsula. They are known for their piety and devotion to their faith, as well as their trading skills. Their special army unit, the Divine Guard, are holy warriors who wield enchanted swords that glow with a divine light. The Divine Guard are able to call upon the power of the heavens to smite their enemies, and their armor is said to be impenetrable to all but the strongest of magical attacks.

deck_list.name: Banu Rabi'ah
deck_list.description: An Arab tribe that originated from the Arabian Peninsula and had a significant presence in the Levant region. They are known for their prowess in archery and their fierce independence. Their special army unit, the Sand Vipers, are skilled archers who specialize in hit-and-run tactics. The Sand Vipers are able to disappear into the sand dunes and reappear elsewhere, making them difficult to track and ambush.

deck_list.name: Banu Ghatafan
deck_list.description: An Arab tribe that originated from the central Arabian Peninsula and had a widespread presence in the region. They are known for their tenacity and their ability to adapt to changing circumstances. Their special army unit, the Desert Foxes, are expert guerrilla fighters who specialize in sabotage and ambush tactics. The Desert Foxes are able to move swiftly and silently through the desert, and their weapons are said to be enchanted with the power of illusion.

deck_list.name: Banu Bakr
deck_list.description: An Arab tribe that originated from the Arabian Peninsula and had a significant presence in the Levant region. They are known for their strength and their fierce loyalty to their kin. Their special army unit, the Blood Warriors, are heavily armored infantrymen who wield massive two-handed swords. The Blood Warriors are able to enter a berserker rage, increasing their strength and speed at the cost of their own sanity.

deck_list.name: Banu Taghlib
deck_list.description: An Arab tribe that originated from the Arabian Peninsula and had a significant presence in the Levant region. They are known for their expertise in horse breeding and their fierce independence. Their special army unit, the Sandstorm Chariots, are skilled charioteers who ride powerful warhorses. The Sandstorm Chariots are able to summon magical sandstorms that obscure their movements and disorient their enemies.

deck_list.name: Banu Uqayl
deck_list.description: An Arab tribe known for their skills in horsemanship and archery. They are a nomadic people who move throughout the region in search of resources and grazing land for their horses. Their special unit, the Wind Riders, are skilled cavalrymen who ride enchanted horses that can run faster than the wind. They are also skilled archers, able to shoot arrows accurately while riding at full speed.

deck_list.name: Banu Asad
deck_list.description: An Arab tribe known for their prowess in battle and their loyalty to their leaders. They are a settled people who have established a strong presence in the region. Their special unit, the Sand Warriors, are heavily armored soldiers who can move quickly across sandy terrain. They are trained in both swordsmanship and the use of firearms, making them a formidable force on the battlefield. Additionally, they have a special ability to call forth sandstorms that can blind and disorient their enemies.

deck_list.name: Kalderash
deck_list.description: A nomadic tribe of Romani people known for their expertise in metalworking and blacksmithing. They travel across Europe, often settling in villages for a time to ply their trade. Their special unit is the Iron Golems, massive constructs crafted from enchanted metal that are impervious to conventional weapons. These constructs are controlled by a select group of Kalderash who possess magical abilities, making them formidable in battle.

deck_list.name: Lovari
deck_list.description: Another group of nomadic Romani people known for their love of horses and equestrian skills. They travel across Europe, performing for audiences and trading horses. Their special unit is the Shadow Riders, a group of skilled horse archers who are able to move silently and swiftly through any terrain. They are known for their ability to strike suddenly and disappear without a trace, leaving their enemies bewildered and disoriented.

deck_list.name: Sinti
deck_list.description: A Romani tribe known for their musical talents and their ability to entertain. They often perform for wealthy patrons in cities and towns across Europe. Their special unit is the Bardic Circle, a group of musicians and performers who can use their music to influence the emotions and actions of others. They are able to cast spells through their music, using their abilities to charm or enrage their enemies as needed.

deck_list.name: Romungro
deck_list.description: A Romani tribe known for their expertise in divination and fortune-telling. They are often sought out by wealthy patrons who wish to know their future. Their special unit is the Seers, a group of powerful mystics who are able to see into the future and manipulate the outcomes of battles. They are able to cast powerful spells that can weaken their enemies or strengthen their allies.

deck_list.name: Ursari
deck_list.description: A Romani tribe known for their affinity with bears and other animals. They often perform with trained animals and are able to communicate with them on a deep level. Their special unit is the Beastmasters, a group of skilled trainers who can control wild animals in battle. They are able to summon bears, wolves, and other ferocious creatures to do their bidding, making them a formidable force on the battlefield.

deck_list.name: Boyash
deck_list.description: A Romani tribe known for their expertise in mining and extracting precious metals and gems from the earth. They often work in mines across Europe, trading their finds for other goods. Their special unit is the Earthshakers, a group of powerful warriors who can control the earth itself. They are able to create earthquakes, open fissures in the ground, and hurl rocks at their enemies, making them a terrifying force on the battlefield.

deck_list.name: Xoraxai
deck_list.description: A secretive Romani tribe known for their magical abilities and their connection to the Feywild. They often travel in caravans across Europe, avoiding contact with outsiders. Their special unit is the Feywalkers, a group of powerful wizards who can open portals to the Feywild and summon fey creatures to do their bidding. They are able to cast powerful spells that can confuse or disorient their enemies, making them a formidable force on the battlefield.

deck_list.name: LÄƒutari
deck_list.description: A Romani tribe known for their musical talents and their ability to entertain. They often perform in taverns and inns across Europe. Their special unit is the Dirge Singers, a group of musicians and performers who can use their music to inflict pain and suffering on their enemies. They are able to cast spells that can cause their enemies to feel intense pain or hallucinate, making them a formidable force on the battlefield.

deck_list.name: DÅ¾ambazi
deck_list.description: This tribe of Romani is known for their musical talents and their love for dancing.
